loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
Ricardo vive con su familia en la comunidad de Santa Teresita, en la provincia de Cartago. La Ciudad de Cartago presenta un relieve montañoso  formado por dos cordilleras: la Central y la cordillera de Talamanca. Esta ciudad fue capital de Costa Rica en 1823.
Desde hace varios  años Ricardo se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente a la  producción de chile dulce. Logra vender sus productos a los vecinos de su comunidad quienes se muestran muy satisfechos con la calidad de este producto. En su caso particular, la demanda ha crecido ya que algunos restaurantes locales le compran también el chile .   
Actualmente necesita  obtener un microcrédito por ¢300.000 (trescientos mil colones), para comprar  almácigo (plantas pequeñas) de chile dulce y extender su siembra, además necesita suministros para cuidar y proteger su cosecha de plagas y hongos.
Ricardo forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de El Sauce de Santa Teresita Turrialba, una de las 150 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Ricardo lives with his family in the community of Santa Teresita, in the province of Cartago. The city of Cartago has a mountainous relief formed by two mountain ranges: the Cordilera Central and the Cordillera de Talamanca. This city was the capital of Costa Rica in 1823.

For several years Ricardo has worked in agriculture, specifically the production of peppers. He sells his products to neighbors in the community who are very satisfied with the quality of this product. In his particular case, the demand has grown so that some local restaurants also buy the peppers.

Currently he needs to obtain a loan for ¢300,000 (three hundred thousand colones) to buy seed-beds (seedlings) of peppers to renew his sowing and also he needs supplies to care for and protect his crop from pests and fungi.

Ricardo is a member of the Empresa de Crédito Comunal de El Sauce de Santa Teresita Turrialba, one of the 150 organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to buy seed-beds (seedlings) of peppers

location.town: El Sauce de Santa Teresita de Turrialba

loans.name: Tracy

texts.en:
Tracy is a single mother of three children; two of her children go to school, and the third one is too young. She doesn’t take care of additional family members.  

She has a business selling used clothes and has been in this business for four years. She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes to sell on a retail basis seven days a week.  

Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She aspires to become a wholesaler and to build her own house. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent, school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 58 years old and lives in Libertad Bajo, Sinacaban. She is single with two children. 

Teresita works in the fish industry and sells dried fish for a living. She has been doing this for ten years. She has requested a loan to purchase additional fish to sell. 

Teresita has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, she hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Lout's Group

texts.en:
Lout is a single woman originally from Kampong Cham province's Dambae district in Cambodia. She is a peasant who grows rice on a 2-hectare area and plants cassava on 1.5 hectare of farmland in order to earn a living. She has been with this business for five years and is challenged by the fruitless crop caused by drought. 

Lout received her first loan with VisionFund and has finished the past three loans already with success. She has managed to repay the entire loans, which have helped her to manage her daily expenses, especially decent food. 

To continue better support for her business, she formed a group of two members to request a new loan. As the leader, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer, seed and insecticide for her farm. She hopes to receive more yields and sell it for a good price in order to double her income and make her living better.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seed, and insecticide for her farm.

loans.name: Ana Ruth

texts.es: Ana Ruth de cuarenta y nueve años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida Luis y su hijo Eduardo en casa propia; ella se dedica a la venta de artesanías cuadros, separadores, tejas decoradas entre otros, tiene varios años de tener el negocio y se ha hecho de mucha experiencia en las ventas que le permite realizar una labor de calidad, la venta esta ubicada en su vivienda en una zona muy concurrida de personas, ya tiene mucha clientela  la prefieren por el producto de calidad, por los buenos precios y además por el servicio inigualable; Ana es una mujer emprendedora, enérgica, y soñadora quiere salir adelante por sus propios méritos y no descansara hasta ganarse un futuro mas prospero, en los últimos meses tuvo algunas perdidas pero desea recuperarse e innovar con su producto, pero necesita de capital para una nueva inversión por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar tejas, madera, pintura, barniz,  etc. Ana Ruth tiene buenas referencias de pago es responsable y asegura que pagara la deuda y a la vez tiene confianza que podrá darle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en:
Ana Ruth is 49 years old. She lives with her life companion Luis and her son Eduardo in their own home. 

She works selling handicraft paintings, partitions, decorated tiles, and other items. She has had the business for several years and has gained experience in sales that allows her to perform quality work. She sells from home in a very busy area of people and so has many customers who prefer her for the quality product, for the good prices and for the unequaled service. 

Ana is an enterprising woman, energetic, and an idealist who wants to get ahead by her own merits and not rest until she wins a more prosperous future. In recent months she had some losses but she wants to recover and try some new methods for her product but she needs capital for a new investment and this is why she is asking Integral for a loan which will permit her to buy tiles, wood, paint, varnish, etc. 

Ana Ruth has good payment references and she is sure she can pay the debt and at the same time she is confident that she can offer her family a fulfilling life.

loans.use: to buy tiles, wood, paint and varnish for her handicraft business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a computer

loans.name: José Carlos

texts.es:
José tiene 32 años de edad, tiene un hijo. Él siempre se ha dedicado a realizar trabajos agrícolas, desde que tenia ocho años, fue su padre quien le enseño. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar cuatro sacos de abono, herbecidas y pago de mano de obra; para sembrar, limpiar y sacar la cosecha. Con la producción él dispondrá de maíz suficiente para su consumo y cuando exista la necesidad vender a otras personas. Él desea cultivar más, para mejorar sus ingresos y no tener que recurrir a préstamos.
texts.en:
José is 32 years old and has a child. His father taught him how to work on agricultural jobs and he has been working since he was 8 years old. 

The loan that he is requesting to is buy 4 sacks of manure, herbicides, and payment of manual labor to clean and remove the crops for sowing. With the production he will have sufficient for consumption and sale to other people.  He desires to cultivate more products to increase his income and no longer borrow loans.

loans.use: to is buy 4 sacks of manure, herbicides, and payment of manual labor to clean and remove the crops for sowing

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
RufinaRufina, 59 years old and living in Gil Sanchez, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte, is married but separated. For the past three years Rufina has owned a sari-sari store to earn a living, making a monthly income of about PHP 5000.

A member of PMPC for three years, she has requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy additional groceries to sell. In the future, Rufina hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell.

location.town: Liloy-Gil Sanchez, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children and all her children go to school. She has two additional family members (old parents). 

She sells second-hand clothes at the market. She sells her products on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last ten years. She works six days a week.

She has requested a loan of 200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy a bale of second-hand clothes. 

Her major business challenges are transportation, seasonality, and defaulters. Her goals and aspirations are to become a wholesaler and also to buy a plot of land and build her own house. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major expenses include rent, paying for utilities, and school fees.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes.

loans.name: Anvarjon

texts.en:
Anvarjon, a 42-year-old married father of three children for whom he tries to provide all the necessities of life, sells auto parts to earn a living. In business for six years, he has many customers and serves them perfectly.

Anvarjon is requesting a loan of 3000 USD to purchase batteries to expand his assortment of products. He dreams of further expanding his enterprise and becoming prosperous in the future. He will look for your help.

loans.use: to buy batteries to expand his assortment of products.

loans.name: Floridah

texts.en:
Floridah has been in farming for twenty years, besides running a retail business in the local market. She says farming caters to a bigger portion of her family’s needs. She is married, with two children aged twelve and fourteen years.

Floridah has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo for a venture into poultry farming. She says she will use the income to expand her farming business and buy more acres of land. Her focus is on making her farming business a lucrative one.

She compliments Juhudi Kilimo for the efficiency in disbursement of loans.

loans.use: to buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Johnny

texts.es:
Johnny es un hombre de 36 años de edad y vive con su familia, en una comunidad de la zona Sur de Costa Rica, ubicada en Concepción de Pilas, Puntarenas. La economía local está basada en actividades agropecuarias, donde destaca la siembra de tubérculos, café, maíz, frijoles y ganadería.
Johnny está solicitando un préstamo de doscientos mil colones exactos (¢200.000 ), para comprar fungicidas e insecticidas para darle mantenimiento a su siembra de maíz  y  proteger sus cultivos,  ya que esta  es una alternativa fiable y sostenible. Con estos abonos, Johnny evitará que aparezcan hongos en sus plantaciones y así brindara productos de calidad a sus clientes.
 Johnny es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de La Danta S.A, una de las 150 empresas de crédito comunal de Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Johnny is a 36-year-old man that lives with his family in an area of the south end of Costa Rica in Concepción de Pilas, Puntarenas. The local economy is based on farming, stockbreeding, and mainly the sowing of tubers, coffee, corn, beans, and livestock. 

Johnny is asking for a loan of 200,000 colones to buy fungicides and insecticides to maintain the sowing of corn and protect his crop since this is a sustainable and reliable alternative.  

With this loan, Johnny can avoid that fungus will appear on his crops and thus offer quality products to his customers. Johnny is a member of the “Empresa de Credito Comunal de la Danta S.A.” (Business of Community Credit of Danta, S.A.), one of the 150 community banks in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Yorn's Group

texts.en:
Aged 58, Yorn is a married mother of seven children. The rest of her family resides in a rural area of Dambae District, Cambodia. To strive for a good living, she manages three hectares of farmland for growing rice and two hectares for growing cassava; it is the business that she has been involved in for ages.

Her main challenge with the current business is the dropping price of her cash-crop. Yorn has never worked with Kiva's partner, VisionFund before. Her group composes of two members--her co-member is also a first-time borrower. 

Yorn is applying for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR whilst her co-member is seeking 600,000 KHR. Yorn, as the leader, will use her loan portion to pay for the plowing fee for the rice field and the weeding fee for the cassava plantation. She hopes to gain a high yield and make more income in order to maintain a good standard of living for her family.

loans.use: To pay for the plowing fee for the rice field and the weeding fee for the cassava plantation.

loans.name: Fransina

texts.en:
Fransina is a 42-year-old mother of 4 children: Lita, 22 and Lian, 20 - who are both attending university; Haris, 12, who is attending Junior High School Grade 1; and Adi, 3 years old. Fransina’s husband, Andri, is a 46-year-old entrepreneur. 

Fransina owns two businesses: poultry and pig breeding. One month ago, Fransina suffered a loss when the chickens were infected from disease. At the moment, she just relies on her pig breeding business. She is planning to continue her poultry business but she needs business capital to do so. 

Fransina has applied for a loan of IDR 4,500,000 from TLM. She would like to buy 2 boxes of chicks, the fodder, vaccine, and vitamins. She really hopes to restart her business so she is able to increase her family income.

loans.use: to buy 2 boxes of chicks, the fodder, vaccine, and vitamins.

loans.name: Sokuntheary's Group

texts.en:
Sokuntheary, a villager living in Kampong Cham province's Dambae district of Cambodia, is a 42-year-old mother of five children. 

To make a constant income for her family's sake, she has been running a small food stall for ten years. She has never taken any loan from VisionFund (Kiva's partner) before, the same as her co-member. She leads this group of two and both of them are seeking a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. 

Sokuntheary will use her portion to buy more food ingredients and canned food plus more grocery items to resell as an extra income. She expects to double her income from her current business to sustain a better living for her family.

loans.use: to buy more food ingredients and canned food plus more grocery items to resell.

loans.name: Robiina

texts.en:
Robiina, a 32-year-old resident of Kisekende, located in the Mubende region of Uganda, is married and has three children who are all currently in school. For the past four years, Robiina has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells cosmetics such as body lotions.

To help expand her business, Robiina has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more cosmetic lotions for resale and will help her to generate greater profits and stock more items. Robiina hopes that in the future she will be able to construct a residential house.

Robiina is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Robiina who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetic lotions for resale.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 40 years old and lives in Malintuboan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with 2 children.

Rebecca works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for 19 years. She has requested a loan of 5,000 to purchase kilos of fishes to sell.

Rebecca has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Rebecca hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase kilos of fishes to sell.

loans.name: Gelasia

texts.en:
Gelasia is a 61-year-old married woman and a mother of 12 grown up children. She is from Bohol, Philippines. She has owned a tricycle transportation business for more than six years now. This provides her the income that she needs for their sustenance.

Gelasia has been a member of CEVI for several years now. She likes the services offered by the organization because it really helped her in improving her livelihood. As of now, she is requesting a new loan worth 18,000 PHP to buy spare parts and fuel for the tricycle. With this, the working condition of the vehicle will be revived to its normal condition.

Gelasia believes that if she will be provided with financial support through a loan, she will be able to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and fuel for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy animal feed.

loans.name: Salah

texts.en:
Salah is from Iraq. He is a youth client, 24 years of age, married with one child. He is the only provider for the family.

Salah owns a small grocery store selling soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergents and snacks. He established his business in 2007 and now he has good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting a youth loan of $3000 to renovate his shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate his grocery store.

loans.name: Sam Eean's Group

texts.en:
Sam Eean, age 37, is a mother of three children who are students in the local public school. To provide daily decent food for her children, she needs to make a living through crop planting on 1 hectare of farmland (paddy rice) and a 3-hectare area (cassava). 

She has been with this business for 17 years and is challenged with the dwindling price of cassava. 

Sam Eean's group consists of two members; both are females and first-loan borrowers. She and her fellow group member are requesting 1,000,000 Cambodian riels (KHR) and 500,000 KHR, respectively. As the leader, her entire loan portion will be used to pay for the weeding fee for her cassava field.  She hopes to boost her crop production to multiply her income so as to improve her family's livelihood.

loans.use: To pay for the weeding of her cassava field.

loans.name: Yolán

texts.es:
Yolán  es un agricultor de 34 años  de edad,  vive con su esposa y su hijo  de tres años en la  comunidad de la zona Sur de Costa Rica, ubicada en Concepción de Pilas, Puntarenas. La economía local está basada en actividades agropecuarias, donde destaca la siembra de tubérculos, café, maíz, frijoles y ganadería, y otros productos.
Yolán desarrolla la actividad de la siembra de café desde hace varios años, lo que le genera una única fuente de ingreso familiar, por lo tanto desea expandirse más en cuanto a área de siembra y para ello necesita un  préstamo por  quinientos mil colones exactos (¢500.000) para comprar almácigo de café (Plantas pequeñas) y así lograr la producción de este producto y proveer de semilla a otros productores.
Yolán l es socio de la  Empresa de Crédito Comunal de La Danta S.A.  y manifiesta estar muy agradecido porque este es un medio de adquirir financiamiento de acceso rápido y a plazos aceptables para gente trabajadora y que desea superarse.
texts.en:
Yolán is a 34-year-old farmer. He lives with his wife and 3-year-old son in of the south zone of Costa Rica, located in Concepción de Pilas, Puntarenas. The local economy is based on farming activities, mainly the sowing of tubers, coffee, corn, beans, and livestock breeding, and other products. 

For several years Yolán has developed the sowing of coffee, which has allowed him to have a steady income. He desires to expand his sowing and therefore needs a loan of 500,000 colones to buy small coffee plants to accomplish the production of the product and provide seeds to other producers. 

Yolán is a member of the “Empresa de Credito Comunal de la Danta S.A.” (Business of Community Credit of Danta, S.A.). He is very grateful for the loan as a means of quick access to financing on credit available to hard working people who want to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy small coffee plants

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children and all her children go to school. She makes and sells bricks from home on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last eight years.  Maria gets additional income from teaching.  She works five days per week. She has requested a loan of Uganda Shillings 200,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy firewood for burning bricks. Her major business challenges are seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations are to buy a plot of land to expand the brick making business and to build a pre-primary and day care centre. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, food and rent.

loans.use: to buy more firewood to make bricks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more firewood

loans.name: Teymurkhan

texts.en: Teymurkhan is married and has two daughters and a son. Five years ago, he decided to set up a general store in order to contribute economically to the household and improve his family's quality of life. In his store, he sells food and personal products like tea, sugar, oil, chips and other snack foods. The shop is his main source of income. To expand his retailing, he took out this loan for 1,000 AZN  to purchase stock.  Teymurkhan hopes to further grow his general store and to increase his income.

loans.use: to purchase more stock

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es:
Luis Antonio tiene 45 años, Es casado vive con la esposa y tres hijos, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. LUCHANDO POR UNA MISMA CAUSA, se encuentra ubicada en el en el Recinto La primavera, perteneciente al Canton Ventans, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

Luis Antonio se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz  y frejol. Compra sus productos en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, urea, insecticidas, liquido mata maleza. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. El sueño es poder seguir incrementando las siembras.

En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar pelota y disfrutar de lo Le gusta jugar futbool.
texts.en:
Luis Antonio, 45, is married and lives with his wife and three children in the Ventanas canton, Los Rios province.

The members of V.R.C. LUCHANDO POR UNA MISMA CAUSA (Fighting for the Same Cause) are located in the La Primavera neighborhood, Ventanas canton. This communal bank dedicates itself to short cycle farm labor, sowing corn and rice. 

Luis Antonio works in agriculture, sowing corn, rice, and beans. He buys his products in Ventanas.

He is applying for the loan to buy seeds, urea, insecticide, and weedkiller. The support from the loan will help him meet his needs. His dream is to be able to keep increasing his planting.

In his free time, he likes to play soccer.

loans.use: to buy seeds, urea, insecticides, and weedkiller.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children and all her children go to school. She operates a restaurant at the market on a retail basis. She has been in business for the last six years.  She gets additional income from farming. She works five days in a week. She has requested a loan of Uganda Shillings 200,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy serving utensils, cooking oil, green bananas, and maize flour. Her major business challenges are seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations are to own a fully stocked restaurant and to buy a plot of land to build her own house .She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and but not piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more serving utensils, cooking oil, green bananas and maize flour

loans.name: Abdumanon

texts.en:
Abdumanon is an industrious person who is married and has three children. Their ages range from 12 to 18 years old. He has been busy with animal husbandry for more than 20 years. He sells his animal in the local market and has many customers. Many of his customers are local butchers who are glad for his work. 

Abdumanon is looking for a loan to buy young cattle. In this way, he will be able to offer his customers good animals and continue to make financial progress, providing his household with good earnings. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy young cattle

loans.name: Ele-Gbe Group

texts.fr: ELE-GBE est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Pauline Ibukun (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée 46 ans. Ne vivant plus avec son mari, Pauline Ibukun est mère de deux enfants dont un scolarisé, et tous à sa charge. Pauline Ibukun vit seule avec ses enfants et assure les différentes charges des enfants. Pauline Ibukun a arrêté l’école au cours secondaire. Pauline Ibukun est la coordonnatrice d’une ONG du Bénin. Il y a près de quinze ans que Pauline Ibukun vend des savons liquides qu'elle prépare elle même. Pauline Ibukun exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Pauline Ibukun s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Pauline Ibukun sollicite un premier crédit avec les membres du groupe ELE-GBE. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
ELE-GBE is a group made up of three members who live in the same neighborhood in Benin.  The group's representative, Pauline Ibukun (raising her hand in the photo), is 46 years old.

Although she no longer lives with her husband, Pauline Ibukun is the mother of two children, one of whom goes to school.  Both children are her dependents.  She lives alone with her children and covers the various expenses associated with raising them.

Pauline Ibukun left school at the secondary level.  She now coordinates a non governmental organization in Benin.

She has been making and selling liquid soap for almost fifteen years now, buying her supplies in Benin. She has a passion for her work, which allows her to meet her needs and those of her children.

In order to satisfy her customers' needs, she is requesting her first loan, along with the members of the ELE-GBE group.  This loan will allow them to better meet their customers' needs and to make more profits.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make liquid soap.

loans.name: Vannak's Group

texts.en:
Vannak, a 29-year-old mother originally from the Dambae district of Cambodia, is a small grocery store owner whose purpose is to support her two dependent daughters, as they are still in school. It is the only business that she has been in for nine years. 

In order to continue in expanding her business gradually, she leads a group of two to apply for a new loan. For this loan cycle, she and her fellow group member are first-time loan clients, and both of them are seeking the same loan amount, 1,000,000 Cambodian riels (KHR) each. For Vannak, her loan portion will be used to buy more grocery items including food ingredients, canned food, shampoo, etc. She hopes to earn a larger income to make her life better.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items including food ingredients, canned food, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is a 53-year-old married woman and a mother of three grown-up children from Bohol, Philippines. She has been in the fishing business for more than 25 years. Her husband works as a fisherman.

Milagros is in need of additional capital for the business. She is asking for a loan worth 25,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy new fishing nets and for the repair and maintenance of the fishing boat. With this, her husband will be able to enhance his daily catch, thus increasing her sales and profit.

Milagros dreams of making her business a success. Moreover, she wants to continue reinvesting in this venture and use some of the income for their daily needs and for savings purposes.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and for the repair and maintenance of the fishing boat.

loans.name: Ayidote 8 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe AYIDOTE 8 est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies et qui vivent dans le même quartier au Bénin. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Pierrette est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Pierrette est âgée de 36 ans et est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Denis. Le couple a cinq enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés, et tous à leur charge. Pierrette n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Pierrette vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les divers besoins du ménage. Pour assurer ses différentes charges, Pierrette mène comme activité la vente d'assiettes et de glacières depuis seize ans de façon ambulante. Pierrette s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Pierrette sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe AYIDOTE 8, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt leur servira à rehausser le stock de ses produits et à augmenter leur clientèle.
texts.en:
AYIDOTE 8 is a group made up of three members who are friends and live in the same neighborhood in Benin.  It is the first time that this group is requesting financial assistance from ALIDé, in order to raise its level of activity.

The group's representative, Pierrette, is raising her hand in the photo. She is 36 years old and married to a driver named Denis.

Pierrette and Denis have five children, some of whom attend school. All five children are their dependents.

Pierrette never attended school.  She lives with her husband and children.  The couple jointly takes care of the various household needs.

In order to cover her various expenses, Pierrette has been selling plates and ice boxes for the past 16 years.  She works as an itinerant seller and buys her goods in a town in Benin.

In order to satisfy her customers' needs and to increase her turnover and income, she is requesting her first loan from ALIDé, along with the other members of the AYIDOTE 8 group.

This loan will allow them to increase their inventory and customer base.

loans.use: to buy plates and ice boxes.

loans.name: Tito Mahuton Group

texts.fr: Le groupe TITO MAHUTON est formé de trois personnes qui sont des amies résidant dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Gbessouvègni Rose, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Gbessouvègni Rose est âgée de 27 ans et est mariée à un mécanicien du nom de Frédéric. Le couple a trois enfants dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Gbessouvègni Rose et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les diverses charges de la famille. Gbessouvègni Rose n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Depuis une douzaine d’année, Gbessouvègni Rose exerce l'activité de coiffure à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Gbessouvègni Rose vend du bois de chauffage et divers articles. Gbessouvègni Rose s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Cette activité lui permet d'assurer les besoins de sa famille sans grande difficulté. La demande de sa clientèle devient de plus en plus grande et compte tenu de ses moyens limités, Gbessouvègni Rose n'arrive plus à bien répondre à leurs exigences. Eu égard à cela et compte tenu de leurs ressources limitées, Gbessouvègni Rose et les autres membres du groupe TITO MAHUTON sollicitent ensemble un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
TITO MAHUTON is a group made up of three members who are friends living in the same neighborhood in Benin. The group's representative, Gbessouvègni Rose, is raising her hand in the photo. 

It is the first time that this group is requesting financial assistance from ALIDé, in order to raise its level of activity.

Gbessouvègni Rose is 27 years old and married to a mechanic named Frédéric.

The couple has three children, some of whom attend school.  All three children are the couple's dependents.

Gbessouvègni Rose and her husband live together with their children and jointly take care of the various family expenses. 
 
Gbessouvègni Rose never went to school. For the past twelve years or so, she has been working as a hairdresser, from her home. Additionally, she sells firewood and other various goods.  She buys her merchandise from a market in Benin. 

Thanks to this activity, she is able to meet her family's needs without much difficulty.  However, she is currently facing an increasing demand from her customers, and because of her limited means, she can no longer adequately meet her customers' needs.  

Because of this situation, and given their limited resources, she and the other members of the TITO MAHUTON group are jointly requesting a loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy hairdressing supplies and firewood.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is 36 years old and married. She is blessed with two children who are in school. For the past six years, Hannah has operated a kindergarten business and earns a monthly income of 50,000 KES. 

Hannah is requesting her second 14,000 KES loan from KADET LTD to purchase more books for her kindergarten and to pay for labor. She plans to use her anticipated profit to open another location. In the future, Hannah hopes to have a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase books for her kindergarten and to pay for labor

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is married with two children who go to school. She lives in Kampala, Uganda. For the past three years, she has operated a restaurant at the local market. Annet gets additional income from selling charcoal and she works five days in a week. Her major business challenges are seasonality and transportation. Annet lives in a rented house and her family does not have access to electricity or running water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

Annet is requesting a 200,000 UGX loan from MCDT SACCO to buy green bananas, Irish potatoes, and beef. Her goals and aspirations are to own a fully stocked restaurant and buy a plot of land to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy green bananas, Irish potatoes, and beef

loans.name: Miguel Alfonso

texts.es:
Don Miguel tiene 77 años de edad, vive con su compañera de vida. Él siempre se ha dedicado a realizar trabajos agrícolas, fue su padre quien le enseño. Compra los insumos agrícolas en una ciudad viajando en un pick up, por calles balastreadas. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar cuatro sacos de abono, fertilizantes y pago de mano de obra; para realizar sus cultivos. De los ingresos que obtenga de su cosecha los invertirá en la compra de alimento para su familia y para cubrir otras necesidades. Él desea cultivar más, mejorar su vivienda y sembrar otro tipo de cultivo como la yuca.
texts.en:
Miguel is 77 years old and lives with his life companion. He has always made his living doing farm work; it was his father who taught him. He buys his agricultural supplies in a city, traveling in a pick-up truck on gravel roads. 

The loan that he is requesting is to pay for labor and to purchase fertilizers and four sacks of manure to grow his crops. He will invest the income he earns from his harvest in the purchase of food for his family and to cover other necessities. He wishes to grow more, to improve his residence, and to plant another type of crop, like cassava.

loans.use: to pay for labor and to purchase fertilizers and four sacks of manure to grow his crops.

loans.name: Teofilo Eulogio

texts.es:
TEOFILO EULOGIO tiene 25 años de edad es casado tiene un hijo, vive con la esposa y con el hijo en Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la Vrc La Unión, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto aguas frías, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a Labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol.

TEOFILO EULOGIO se dedica a la siembra de maíz, además se dedica a la críanza de cerdos y pollos. Solicita el crédito para comprar urea, insecticidas, fertilizantes, Con la ayuda del crédito podra comprar los insecticidas, fertlizantes que tanto le hace falta para los cultivos. 

Las compras lo hace en Ventanas. El sueño es poder comprar más terreno. El desfío al que se enfrenta es podre trabajar y salir adelante.
En el tiempo libre le gusta ver el futbool y pasear con la familia.
texts.en:
Teofilo Eulogio is 25 years old, married, and has a son. He lives with his wife and son in Ventanas, in the province of Ríos. He is a member of the communal bank La Unión, which is located in the precinct of Aguas Frías, belonging to the village of Ventanas. This communal bank is dedicated to agricultural work of the short seasons, the sowing of corn, rice, and beans. 

Teofilo Eulogio makes a living sowing corn. Furthermore, he makes a living raising pigs and chickens. He is requesting a loan to buy urea, insecticides, and fertilizers. With the help of the loan, he will be able to buy the insecticides and fertilizers that he lacks for his crops. 

He makes his purchases in Ventanas. His dream is to be able to buy more land. The challenge that he is facing is being able to work and move forward. In his free time he likes to watch soccer and spend time with his family.

loans.use: to buy urea, insecticides, and fertilizers

loans.name: Denis

texts.en:
Denis is 36 years old and lives in the town of Kisekende in the Mubende region of Uganda. He is married and has two children, with one of them currently in school. For the past six years, Denis has been working hard to manage his small produce business, which sells produce like dry maize cassava flour. 

To help expand his business, Denis has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more produce like maize and cassava flour for resale, and will help Denis to generate greater profits and improve his family’s standard of living. Denis hopes that in the future, he will be able to own another milling machine business. 

Denis is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Denis who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more produce like maize and cassava flour for resale.

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor is 37 years old and is married with six children. For the past six years, he has been a successful livestock seller in Mariakani and he also runs a shop where he sells a variety of goods such as slippers, flashlights, knives, and other items to supplement his income. 

Victor is requesting his fourth loan from KADET LTD to buy more goats, sheep, and cows to resell to his customers. He will use the proceeds from his loan to buy more livestock and pay school fees for his children. Victor hopes to have a successful business and a financially stable life.

loans.use: to buy goats, sheep, and cows

loans.name: Susen

texts.en:
Susen is a 36-year-old married woman with two children. For the past four years, Susen has been operating a green-grocery business. She sells fruits and vegetables such as potatoes, cucumbers, apples, pears, pomegranates. This business allows her to generate the income that she needs. Her husband helps her in this business. 

Susen will use her profits to improve her quality of life, since she supports her entire family with this business. Susen and her husband are responsible and hardworking people who are thankful to the institution for their support. In order to achieve his objective she has decided to ask for a loan from Aqroinvest and Kiva in amount of 1000 AZN. Susen plans to buy goods for developing her business.

loans.use: to buy goods for developing her business.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has ten children. Two of her children go to school. 

Joyce sells second hand clothes at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 20 years. Joyce works seven days a week. She has requested for a loan of Uganda Shillings 200,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy a bale of second hand clothes. Besides this business, she generates additional income through frying cassava chips, to make snacks. Her major business challenges are seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations are to buy a fridge so that she can start selling cold drinks. She lives in rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy  a  bale of used clothes.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is a 41 year old dairy farmer in Kilifi. She keeps poultry to supplement her income. Riziki is a married mother of three children. She has been rearing dairy cattle and keeping poultry for the past eleven years. Her business is doing great. 

This marks her second loan from KADET LTD to finance her business. She plans to use the loan to purchase more feed for her dairy cattle and to buy more chicks, as well as chicken feed for her poultry. She will use the proceeds to expand her business further and to repay her loan. 

Riziki hopes to educate her children who are all pursuing their high school and college education.

loans.use: to purchase more feed for her dairy cattle and to buy more chicks, as well as chicken feed.

loans.name: Restituta

texts.en:
Restituta is a 49 year old married woman and a mother of four teenage children. She resides in Bohol, Philippines together with her family. Restituta has been in the fish vending business for more than 10 years now. This is the source of her income. 

Restituta works hard to earn a living in order to support her husband in meeting the needs of the family, especially for the education of their children.
Restituta lacks capital for the business. She is asking for a loan worth PHP18000 to buy additional fish stock to sell and to pay for the school expenses of her children. With this loan, she will be able to sell more fish to people in their area, thus increasing her sales and profit. 

Restituta dreams of expanding her business so that it will generate the revenue that is necessary to sustain their daily expenses and needs. Any additional income will be used for the reinvestment of the same business and for savings purposes.

loans.use: to buy additional fish stock to sell and to pay for the school expense of her children.

loans.name: Yovanna

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de artesania,la socia vende collares,pulseras y aretes,la socia tiene una joyeria la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio,en sus tiempos libres la socia le gusta salir a pasear al campo,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de artesania.La socia solicita el credito para comprar collares,pulseras y aretes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member continues to work in her business of selling handicrafts. She has a jewelry shop; she sells necklaces, bracelets, and earrings. She works from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. She has already had this business for five years. 

In her free time, she likes to go out for walks in the country. Her dream is to grow her handicrafts business. She is requesting the loan to buy necklaces, bracelets, and earrings.

The member is happy about the loan and she promises to make her loan payments.

loans.use: to purchase necklaces, bracelets, and earrings.

loans.name: Thoeurn's Group

texts.en:
Thoeurn, 50, is a citizen from a rural village located in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. She is a married mother with one daughter and one son, both of whom attend the local public school. Thoeurn is a farmer who manages a 1.5 hectare rice plot and a 1.5 hectare cassava plantation. She has been a farmer for 30 years and her major business challenge is the decreasing price of her cash crops. Thoeurn took her first loan with the Kiva partner VisionFund in 2011. After successfully paying back her previous loan, she feels confident in upgrading her standard of living better than before. 

Thoeurn is the leader of a two-person loan group. Both members are second-time borrowers and are requesting a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. Thoeurn will use her portion of the loan to pay for weeding her cassava plantation. In the future, she expects to improve her cash crop and increase her yields to make her family’s condition better off.

loans.use: to pay for weeding her cassava plantation

loans.name: Carlos Alfredo

texts.es:
Carlos es un hombre soltero de 30 años, él vive junto con su madre en Latacunga que es la ciudad capital de la provincia de Cotopaxi en Ecuador. Esta ciudad se encuentra a unos 2750 cm sobre el nivel del mar y tiene en promedio una temperatura de 12 grados centígrados. En Latacunga hay muchos atributos históricos, arquitectónicos, y culturales lo que le han constituido como patrimonio nacional. El Cotopaxi, el volcán activo más alto del mundo se encuentra pocos kilómetros al norte de la ciudad y por la calidad de su tierra y las características climáticas. Latacunga también se sustenta económicamente a través de la agricultura y la floricultura. 
Para Carlos uno de sus principales retos ha sido poder salir adelante sin haber completado sus estudios secundarios. Sin embargo ejercer como taxista profesional le ha proporcionado una oportunidad de vida. Carlos trabaja alrededor de 10 horas diarias y está solicitando este crédito para poder pagar los saldos de deuda que tiene pendiente por la comprar de su carro. Espera con esto mejorar su estilo de vida al tener una deuda a menor interés y al pagarla espera tener mayores ingresos y quizás prepararse para otra inversión
texts.en:
Carlos is a single man who is 30 years old. He lives with his mother in Latacunga, which is the capital city of the province of Cotopaxi in Ecuador. This city is about 2750 centimeters above sea level, and has an average temperature of 12 degrees Celsius. In Latacunga there are many historical, architectural, and cultural attributes that it represents the national heritage. In Cotopaxi, the tallest active volcano in the world is only a few kilometers to the north of the city because of the quality of its land and its climactic characteristics. Latacunga is also sustained economically through agriculture and flower-growing. 

For Carlos, one of his principle challenges has been being able to move forward without having completed his high school studies. However, working as a professional taxi driver has provided him with an opportunity in life. Carlos works about 10 hours a day and is requesting this loan to be able to pay off the unpaid debts from the purchase of his taxi car. He hopes to be able to improve his way of life upon having a debt with less interest and upon paying it, he hopes to have greater income and perhaps prepare for another investment.

loans.use: to pay off the debts from the purchase of his taxi.

loans.name: Cruz Rocio

texts.es:
Cruz Rocio tiene 27 años de estado civil actual casada tiene tres hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos de 11, 9 y  1 año de edad en Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC LA UNION, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas Frías, Perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol.

Cruz Rocio se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, cacao, además se dedica a la cría de cerdos, gallinas, patos. Las compras y las ventas de los productos agrícolas lo hace en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para  comprar semillas, urea, ranger, líquido mata maleza. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para los cultivos.

El sueño es tener terrenos propio y salir adelante con la siembra. En el tiempo libre le gusta salir los domingos y pasear con los hijos y tambien ir de compras.
texts.en:
Cruz Rocio is 27 years old. She is married and has three children. She lives with her husband and her children, aged 11, 9 and 1, in Ventanas, Province of Los Ríos.

She is a member of "LA UNION" communal bank, located in the district of Aguas Frías, which belongs to the canton of Ventanas. The members of this group work in short-cycle agriculture, planting crops such as corn, rice and beans. 

Cruz Rocio works in agriculture, growing corn, rice and cacao. She also works raising pigs, chickens and ducks. She makes her purchases and sells her agricultural products in Ventanas.

She is requesting the loan to buy seeds, urea, Ranger herbicide, and weedkilling liquid. With the help of the loan, she will be able to buy what she needs for her crops. 

Her dream is to have her own lands and to get ahead with her plantings. In her free time, she likes to go out on Sundays with her children and also go shopping.

loans.use: to buy seeds, urea, herbicide and weedkilling liquid

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct a zero-grazing unit

loans.name: Makhliyo

texts.en:
Makhliyo is 20 years old. She is not married yet and lives with mother. Makhliyo’s mother works at a printing house and earns a small salary. Her brother went to Russia to find a job and that’s why Makhliyo decided to start a new barber shop business to generate an income to contribute to her home’s finances. Makhliyo studied a course called “To Get Ahead,” at a women’s organization and learned business skills. She will be a very successful businesswoman as she is hardworking and smart. 

Makhliyo is requesting a 1,400 TJS loan to buy equipment for her barber shop. She hopes that her new business will become a source of income to provide her family with a good quality of life and better financial opportunities to progress. Makhliyo awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy equipment for her new barber shop

loans.name: Baluki Plus Group

texts.en:
Roger, age 43, is the leader of the Community Bank named “Baluki Plus” which is composed of 14 members united in solidarity for receiving Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses. Roger has been part of the micro-enterprise since 2004. He runs a restaurant and a general store. He has many customers.

Roger is a loyal client of IMF HOPE RDC and has already received four different loans and repaid them properly. His business has prospered thanks to accumulated profit and good management. The loan he will obtain next will be used to increase the store’s stock by buying a larger quantity of items such as soaps, sacks of rice, sugar and toilet paper to meet his customers' demand and increase his profits. This business generates a profit of about US$100 per week. Roger’s ambition is to expand both of his businesses. He is married and is the father of three children between the ages of 3 and 12 years old. Two of them attend school.

loans.use: to increase his store’s stock by buying soaps, sacks of rice, sugar and toilet paper in bulk to meet his customers' demand and increase his profits.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Sophai's Group

texts.en:
Sophai is 27 years old and the married mother of a daughter and a son, both of whom are dependent on her. She lives in a rural village of Banteay Meanchey province’s Mongkul Borey district. Sophai earns a living as a rice farmer and she supplements her income by weaving mats, which she has done for several years. She is able to earn about 20,000 KHR per day to meet her family’s needs. The lack of a water supply is Sophai’s main business challenge for her rice farm. 

Sophai is the leader of a four-member group loan. She is in her second cycle with the Kiva partner, VisionFund, and she fully repaid her previous loan which helped her relieve family’s burden and improve her livelihood. Sophai will use her portion of this loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes her loan will enable her to increase her income to fulfill her dream to have a decent house to live in.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Sokeng's Group

texts.en:
A citizen of the Ou Reang Ov district of Kampong Cham, Sokeng is a 45-year-old widow whose main source of income is rice farming on one hectare of farmland. In this business for 20 years, Sokeng is able to earn about KHR 20,000 per day, saving KHR 10,000 each day after expenses. Drought is her main challenge.

The head of a two-member group requesting a loan with VisionFund, Sokeng will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and pay for labor costs. She hopes to earn more income from her business so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Cinforosa

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta en la comida,ella vende sopas,pollo al horno y huevos fritos,al socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio de venta de comida,la socia vende en el mercado,el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant.La socia solicita el credito para comprar arroz,carne,pollo y verduras.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member continues working in her food-sales business. She sells soups, roast chicken, and fried eggs in the market. She works from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. and she already has had her food-sales business for seven years. Her dream is to have a restaurant. 

The member is requesting this loan to purchase rice, meat, chicken, and vegetables. She is happy about the loan and she promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to purchase rice, meat, chicken, and vegetables.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is a 23-year-old married woman and the mother of a two-year-old daughter. She is from Bohol, Philippines. For some time, Jenelyn has run a cell phone reloading business that provides her with the income that she needs. She is a hardworking woman willing to give her best for her family.

Jenelyn is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to buy additional electronic reloads for her cell phone business. She will use her loan to cater to more clients and thus increase her income. She dreams of expanding her business to make it a success. Jenelyn also wants to save for the future schooling of her child.

loans.use: to buy electronic reloads for her cell phone business

loans.name: Gbassay

texts.en:
This is 56 year-old Gbassay. She is married and has four children ages 24, 18, 14, and 12. Gbassay has one additional dependent who lives with her as a result of the death of the girl’s mother.  In 1991, Gbassay established her raw fish business. She began her business because she wanted to assist her husband to run their home and she learned her job through an apprenticeship. Gbassay works seven days a week and 11 hours a day to earn about 570,000 SLL each month.

Gbassay is requesting a 3,000,000 SLL loan to buy raw fish. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 230,000 SLL. In the future, Gbassay plans to have her own house and to continue to assist her children until they are all independent. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy raw fish to sell

loans.name: Mubaris

texts.en:
Mubaris is 52 years old and lives in a small village of the Bolnisi district. He is married and has three grown children. Mubaris earns his living through an agricultural business. In particular, he owns a plot of land where potatoes, cucumbers, tomatoes, and maize are grown. He sells his products locally. Besides this business, he works as a welder and gets a monthly income. Mubaris is a very hard-working man with a lot of experience in his work. 

Mubaris requested a loan to purchase potato seeds. He will sow potatoes in his plot of land. The family will work hard during the spring and summer seasons, and after the seasonal work is properly done, they hope to get a good harvest. With great trust in his work, Mubaris hopes to have an abundant harvest that he can sell. As a result, he will increase his income to cover household necessities and improve the living conditions of his family. Mubaris will be able to realize his dream of giving his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase potato seeds

loans.name: Mario Anibal

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “UNIDOS PARA EL TRIUNFO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr.Mario;el socio continua con su negocio de estudio fotografico,el socio lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,el socio trabaja conjuntamente con su esposa siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia,el socio desea poder seguir trabajando y uno de sus sueños es poder agrandar su negocio.


El socio solicita el préstamo para realizar el mantenimiento de sus camaras.

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "Unidos Para El Triunfo" ["United for Victory"]. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

The member is Mario; he continues with his photographic studio business. He has had this business for a good deal of time, and it is going well, thanks to the effort that he puts into it every day. Mario works together with his wife, and that's how he supports his family. 

Mario is requesting the loan to carry out the maintenance of his cameras. Mario wishes to be able to continue working; one of his dreams is to be able to increase the size of his business.

Mario thanks those who play a part in this dream through this medium, and he promises to repay his loan in the established timeframe.

loans.use: to carry out the maintenance of his cameras.

loans.name: Florencia Rocio

texts.es:
FLORENCIA ROCIO tiene 37 años de edad estado civil actual unión libre tiene dos hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos en Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC UNIÒN esta ubicada en el recinto Aguas frías, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta Ventanilla se dedica labores agricolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol.

FLORENCIA ROCIO se dedica a la siembras de maíz y arroz además se dedica a la crianza de gallinas y cerdos.
Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas de maíz, urea, insecticidas, ranger. Con la ayuda del crédito podra comprar lo necesario para los cultivos.
Las compras lo hra en ventanas. El sueño es poder tener más tierra para poder sembrar. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas porque debe combatirlas antes que acaben con los cultivos.  En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar con los hijos y ver televisi{on.
texts.en:
Florencia Rocio is 37 years old, currently in a committed relationship, and has two children. She lives with her partner and children in Ventanas Province of Los Ríos. 

She is a member of the Communal Bank "Unión" located in the rural community of Aguas Frías, belonging to the Ventanas Canton. This bank devotes itself to short-cycle agricultural labors planting corn, rice and beans. 

Florencia Rocio earns a living planting corn and rice, as well as raising chickens and pigs. She is seeking the loan for the purchase of seed corn, urea, insecticides and herbicides. With the loan's help she will be able to purchase what she needs for the crops. She will make her purchases in Ventanas. Her dream is to have more land for planting. The challenges she faces are crop infestations because she must fight them off before they consume the crops. In her free time she likes to play with her children and watch television.

loans.use: to purchase seed corn, urea, insecticides and herbicides.

loans.name: Milicent

texts.en:
Milicent is a 41-year-old married woman with three children ranging from three to12 years old. For the past ten years, she has been operating a retail store where she sells cereals such as maize, beans, and green grams. She is also a farmer. Milicent describes herself as an honest and faithful woman. Her business is located in a viable business environment and she employs one staff member. Milicent’s primary customers are local residents from the surrounding areas and her biggest business challenge is insufficient funds to expand. 

Milicent is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to buy more cereals to sell. Her business goal is to run three similar retail businesses in nearby towns within the next five years. In the future, she hopes to run a big store.

loans.use: to buy cereals to sell

loans.name: Sreyny's Group

texts.en: Sreyny is a 30-year-old married mother of three dependent children. She has two daughters and one son, all of whom are still in school. The main sources of the family’s income are from rice farming and pig raising. She and her husband have been in these businesses for several years. Their current businesses earn them about 20,000 KHR per day, and they manage to save about 10,000 KHR each day after paying for their daily expenses. This is Sreyny's group's first microloan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Her group consists of two members. They are all females who live in the village of Ou Reang in the Ov district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. Sreyny, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. Moreover, some portion of her loan will be used to purchase pig feed and to build a piggery. She hopes this loan will help her raise and feed her pigs to where they are fat and healthy. She also hopes to expand her current business so as to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and feed and to build a piggery

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Latifa

texts.en: Latifa is a 55-year-old married woman. She has three children. Five years ago, together with her husband, Latifa decided to open a general store. This business allows them to generate the income that they need. This is her first loan from Aqroinvest and Kiva, and she requested a loan in amount of 1000 AZN to buy a range of new products, such as foods and beverages, to restock her general store with. She hopes that this loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and sales. It will also help her to improve her living conditions. This business allows her to generate the income that she needs. Latifa gives her thanks in advance for the support given.

loans.use: To buy a range of new products to sell

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.es:
Jeannette esta divorciada y tiene dos hijos los cuales están en etapa escolar, viven en casa propia ocupando solo dos habitaciones pequeñas con paredes de ladrillo y el piso de tierra, la casa esta ubicada en la zona Pedro Domingo Murillo en la ciudad de El Alto.
Actualmente percibe ingresos ya que se dedica a la venta de material de escritorio y papelería  en su mismo domicilio ya que con lo poco que gana trabajando por más de diez horas al día debe cubrir los gastos de educación, alimentación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para refacción de las habitaciones de su vivienda ya que desea dar más seguridad a su familia por que las paredes se encuentran muy deterioradas.
El sueño de Jeannette, es mejorar sus ingresos y construir más habitaciones para su familia de esta forma mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la segunda vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Jeannette is divorced and has two school-aged children. They live in their own house, occupying only two small rooms with brick walls and earth floor. The house is located in the Pedro Domingo Murillo area in the city of El Alto.

Currently she earns income, as she sells office supplies and stationery in her own home. With the little she earns working for more than ten hours a day, she must cover her family's costs for education, food, and payment of basic services. 

She needs the loan to repair the rooms in her house. She wishes to provide more security for her family, because the walls are in very poor condition. 

Jeannette's dream is to improve her income and build more rooms for her family, this way improving their quality of life.

It is the second time she has applied for a loan with IMPRO and the first time with Kiva.

loans.use: To repair the walls of the rooms in her house.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en: Annet lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, and three of her children go to school. She sells second-hand clothes at the market. She has been in this business for the last 20 years. She works seven days each week. She has requested a loan in the amount of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy a bale of second-hand clothes. Her major business challenges are seasonality and transportation. Her goals are to import used clothes and to buy a plot of land for building rental houses. She lives in her own house, and the family has access to electricity but no piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used clothes to sell

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en:
Abraham is 28 years old and married.  He works as a carpenter in Mombasa.  He has done carpentry for the past eight years, and he is doing great. 

This is his first business loan from KADET LTD to finance his business. He plans to purchase new hammers, nails, timber, and chisels. He will use the anticipated profit to plough back into the business and repay his loan. 

He hopes to gradually expand his business and be able to support his family with ease.

loans.use: to purchase new hammers, nails, timber, and chisels

loans.name: Chansorn's Group

texts.en:
Chansorn lives in a village of the Ou Reang Ov district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia.  She is 42 years old and married, with two dependent sons, both still in school. 

To make a living, she and her husband have been in rice farming on two hectares of farmland.  They supplement the family’s income by planting cassavas on three hectares of farmland, which they have been in for 20 years. The current business earns her 25,000 KHR per day and manages to clear about 13,000 KHR each day after daily expenses.  The low price of cassavas in the market is still the main challenge for her business.

This is the first microloan for Chansorn’s group of three, who are all female and live in the same village.  Now she is requesting a loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. 

As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use some of it to buy more cassava for planting. She hopes to increase her income so as to expand her current business and make her daily living better.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Juan Leonard

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “UNIDOS PARA EL TRIUNFO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Juan; el socio continua con su negocio crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas,el socio cria a estos animalitos para luego venderlo a sus clientes que mas le solicitan,el socio tambien lo distribuye a quienes le solicitan,el socio a la vez continua trabajando para el sector privado ,siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia,el socio desea agrandar su negocio de crianza de animales para de esta forma brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

 El socio solicita el préstamo para la compra de mas animales para su negocio como cuyes.

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "Unidos Para El Triunfo" [United for Triumph]. The bank is located in the district of Cusco belonging to the province and department of Cusco. 

The member, Juan, continues to run his business raising small animals such as guinea pigs and chickens. He cares for these critters in order to sell them later to his customers who are asking him for more. The member also distributes to those who request it. At the same time he continues to work in the private sector, and in this way he gets his family ahead. The member wishes to expand his animal husbandry business in order to bring a better quality of life to his family. 

The member is requesting the loan to purchase more animals for his business such as guinea pigs. He is grateful to those who join in on this dream by these means, and commits to making his payments within the established time frame.

loans.use: to purchase more animals for his business, such as guinea pigs.

loans.name: Mavzuna

texts.en:
Mavzuna is married.  Her husband is a taxi driver. They have no children.   Her husband’s income is small, and that’s why Mavzuna helps him to improve their living conditions. 

Mavzuna sold fruits and vegetables, but it wasn’t profitable so she  decided to start new business selling of stationery in order to generate an income and contribute to her home’s finances. She studied the course "To get ahead," which was offered for women, and got enough skills about business. 

She is asking for a loan of 1,500 TJS to buy stationery for her new business. She awaits your support. 

Please help her if it's possible because you are the only one who can support her.

loans.use: To buy stationery for her new business

loans.name: Hamisi

texts.en:
Hamisi is a 34-year-old livestock seller in Mariakani. He is single. He has been selling livestock for the past twelve years successfully. 

This is Hamisi’s first loan from KADET LTD to finance his business. He plans to buy more goats, sheep and cows to resell to his customers. He will use the proceeds to buy more livestock and use the rest of his income to invest back into his business. 

He hopes to have a successful business and a financially stable life.

loans.use: to buy more goats, sheep and cows.

loans.name: Rizalina

texts.en:
Rizalina is a 37-year-old woman and mother of a three-year-old daughter. She lives in Bohol, Philippines. She runs a bakery in her place. This is the source of her income.

Rizalina is asking for a loan worth 26,000PHP to buy additional ingredients and materials for baking. With this, she will be able to increase the amount of products she sells, thus adding to her profit and income. Rizalina dreams of expanding her business and making it a success.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients and materials for baking.

loans.name: Ganimete

texts.en:
Ganimete is a 38-year-old married woman, with children.  For more than two years now, she has been running a second-hand business selling used shoes.  Ganimete and her husband buy shoes from Germany, and then they sell them in a big market outlet in Kosovo. 

This is how they provide income for their living needs and family. According to her, this has been a profitable business, and she likes what she does. 

Ganimete is in need of a loan to buy more used shoes in order to sell them. The loan will facilitate this process and generate a larger income. 

Her goal is to open a shop, which she hopes will offer an opportunity for a better education for her children. 

They appreciate this support!

loans.use: To buy used shoes to sell.

loans.name: Saroun's Group

texts.en:
Saroun is 38 years old and lives in a rural area of the Ou Reang Ov district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia.  She has two dependent children who have their own employment in a garment factory. 

To make a living, she and her husband have been involved in rice farming and sometimes worked for others for a fee for 15 years. The current business earns them about KHR 20,000 per day to meet the family’s needs and allows them to save about KHR 10,000 each day. 

This is the first loan for Saroun’s group with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund.  Saroun, as the group's leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizer and to spend on pumping water for her farmland.  She hopes to increase the income from the rice paddy so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to spend on pumping water for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Hawah

texts.en:
Hawah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has five children, all attending school. For the last 5 years, Hawah has operated a restaurant at the market. She works seven days a week and earns additional income from selling charcoal.

Hawah has requested a loan of 200,000 Uganda Shillings (UGX) from MCDT SACCO to buy bunches of bananas, cassava, beef and sweet potatoes. Her major business challenges are seasonality and transportation. Hawah's goals and hopes are to own a fully stocked restaurant, to educate her children up to university and to build a house. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Hawah's major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bananas, cassava, beef and sweet potatoes

loans.name: Vakhtangi

texts.en:
Vakhtangi is 68 years old and lives in Kareli district. He is married and has a daughter. Vakhtangi and his wife have been provided with a retirement pension. His daughter works at City Council and gets a monthly salary. Vakhtangi runs an agricultural business; in particular, he has a plot of land where barley, wheat and beans are grown. Vakhtangi works hard during the spring and summer seasons to ensure a good harvest. He sells his agricultural products locally.

Vakhtangi has requested a loan to purchase 4 hectares of agricultural land. With this loan, he will be able to cultivate more land and expand his agricultural business. The family will work hard and after the seasonal work is properly done, they hope to get a good harvest. The harvested products will be sold and the family's income will significantly increase. Vakhtangi and his family members will improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural land

loans.name: Babirye

texts.en:
Babirye lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has three children, all attending school. She also takes care of additional family members (grandmother). For the last 4 years, Babirye has sold secondhand clothes at the market on a retail basis. She works seven days a week.

Babirye has requested a loan of 200,000 Uganda Shillings (UGX) from MCDT SACCO to buy a bale of secondhand clothes. Her major business challenges are seasonality and transportation. Babirye's goals and hopes are to expand her business into wholesale and to build her own house. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not to to piped water. Babirye's major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used clothing

loans.name: Ulugbek

texts.en:
Ulugbek is one of the smart members of his family who lives happily. He is 21 years old and has a lovely wife who helps him with business. Also, his brother helps him with the business. 

Ulugbek brings up one child. Ulugbek and his wife try to provide him with a high quality of living conditions. With this aim, six years ago, he began his own business of selling perfume products. He sells his goods at the local market. 

Ulugbek wants to widen the assortment of his goods, but his income is small, and he can’t do it. He is asking for a loan of $3,000 USD to buy perfumes for widening his assortment of products. Each month, he will make his payment on time. He will happy if you support him.

loans.use: To buy perfumes for widening his assortment of products.

loans.name: C7988 Dufatanye Group

texts.en:
Assoumpta, 34 years old, is married and has three children aged between 3 and 8 years old. She is the leader of a group called "C7988 DUFATANYE" in the local language, which means "BEING TOGETHER". This group is known for selling rice and they have been in this business for three years. The business operates from 6 a.m. to 1 p.m. every day except for weekends.

Assoumpta has requested the Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company s.a. in order to expand her rice farming by cultivating large quantities of rice for resale. With this loan, Assoumpta will be able to save for her future, to pay school fees for her children and to provide food for her family. In the photo, Assoumpta is holding a book in her hands.

loans.use: To expand her rice farming business

loans.name: Allen

texts.en:
Allen lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has three children, two of whom attend school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. For the last 7 years, Allen has sold green bananas at the market on a retail basis. She works seven days a week.

Allen has requested a loan of 200,000 Uganda Shillings (UGX) from MCDT SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas. Her major business challenges are seasonality and transportation. Allen's goals and hopes are to build a house and to become a wholesaler. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Allen's major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of green bananas

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, and two of her children go to school. She operates a beauty salon at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last six years. She works seven days in a week. 

She has requested a loan of 200,000 Uganda Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy weaves, treatments, relaxers and oils. Her major business challenges are seasonality, thieves and transportation. Her goals and aspirations are to own a fully stocked house and to buy a plot of land to build her own house. 

She lives in a rented house, and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more weaves, treatments, relaxers and hair oils.

loans.name: Amer

texts.en:
Amer is from Iraq. He is 32 years old, married and has one child. He is the only provider for the family.

Amer owns a small factory for tubes and pumps. He established his business in 2007, and he has now five employees. He has good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting $3,000 for a youth loan to buy a machine specialized for his work. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a machine specialized for his work.

loans.name: Justina
