texts.es: Doña Justina tiene 68 años de edad, casada, vive con su esposo y un hijo mayor en el municipio de Morazan, Yoro. Tiene 12 años de tener su propio negocio y que es su fuente de ingresos, vende azúcar, arroz, frijoles, huevos, refrescos, churros, etc. este negocio lo ha mantenido mediante la inversión de varios préstamos. el que está solicitando de 10,000 Lempiras es el treceavo préstamo, con el cual va comprar lácteos, carnes y embutidos ya que quiere satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes y tener siempre surtido su negocio. Su meta es mantener siempre activo su negocio ya que es su fuente de ingreso familiar.
texts.en:
Justina is 68 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and an adult son, in the town of Morazan, Yoro department. She has had her own business for 12 years, and it is her source of income. She sells sugar, rice, beans, eggs, soft drinks, churros (treat made from fried dough), etc. 

She has kept this business going through the investment of several loans. The one for 10,000 lempiras that she is applying for is the thirteenth loan. With it she is going to buy dairy products, meats and cold cuts, as she wishes to satisfy the demand from her customers, and always keep her store  well-stocked. 

Her goal is to always keep her business brisk, as it is the source of income for her family.

loans.use: To buy cold cuts, dairy products and meats for stocking her store.

loans.name: Xoshbaxt

texts.en:
Xoshbaxt is a 44-year-old woman and the lovely mother of two children. Her husband earns an income as a taxi driver. For the past four years, Xoshbaxt has been working hard to manage her retail shop.  

She requested a loan in the amount of 1,200 Azerbaijani New Manat (AZN) to buy everyday products like oil, tea, soap, detergent, sugar, bread and other items. This purchase helps her to better meet the needs of her customers. 

Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. Xoshbaxt hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to enable her to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy everyday products like oil, tea, soap, detergent, sugar, bread, etc.

loans.name: Mercedes Del Rosario

texts.es: Mercedes del Rosario de cincuenta y nueve años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y calzado, para damas, caballeros y niños, comercia de forma ambulante y tiene varios años con el negocio se  ha hecho de experiencia en las ventas por lo que ha adquirido mucha clientela fija que la prefieren porque tiene producto de primera calidad y a precios accesibles además de un buen servicio; Mercedes es una mujer decidida, dispuesta a cumplir sus metas, piensa que luchar hasta el final con esfuerzo y dedicación la llevara al éxito, en los últimos meses ha aumenta la demanda de su producto y quiere aprovechar para invertir y aumentar al mismo tiempo las ganancias por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar pantalones, camisas, faldas, zapatos, etc. Mercedes tiene buen record de pago, asegura que podrá pagar la deuda y  a la vez espera poder llevar a su hogar seguridad económica para una mejor calidad de vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Mercedes del Rosario is 59 years old. She lives with her life partner and their children. She sells clothing and footwear for women, men and children. 

She sells door-to-door, and has several years in the business. She has gotten experience in sales, and has acquired a large base of steady customers. They prefer her because she has first-quality product, at affordable prices, and provides good service as well. 

Mercedes is a decisive woman, determined to fulfill her goals. She believes that striving until the end with effort and dedication will lead her to success. 

In the last months she has increased the demand for her product, and wants to take advantage of this in order to invest, and at the same time increase earnings. That is why she is applying to Integral for a loan that will allow her to buy pants, shirts, skirts, shoes, etc. 

Mercedes has a good payment record. She says that she will be able to pay the debt, and at the same time hopes to be able to bring financial security to her household, so that her family can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy pants, shirts, skirts and shoes.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al trabajo como profesora de clases particulares,la socia trabaja desde las 3:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este trabajo la socia quiere salira adelante,la socia ya tiene 5 años en este trabajo,el sueño de la socia es teenr un nido jardin para niños.La socia solicita el credito para comprar un televisor para su casa.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member continues to earn a living as an instructor giving lessons to individuals. She works from 3 a.m. until 6 p.m. and wants to make progress in life through this work. She has been working in this field for five years. The member's dream is to have a playschool for children. She is seeking the loan to buy a television set for her home. 

The member is happy about the loan and commits to making her installments.

loans.use: to purchase a television for her home.

loans.name: Bassam

texts.en:
Bassam is from Iraq. He is a youth client aged 30 years old, married and has three children. He is the only provider for the family.

Bassam owns a shop, a computer center, where he repairs computers and sells CDs and DVDs. He established his business in 2008 and he now has one employee. He has good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting a Youth loan of  $3000 to increase his inventory. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better life conditions.

loans.use: to increase his inventory

loans.name: Ekaterine

texts.en:
Ekaterine is 40 years old and lives in a small village of the Kareli district. She is married and has two children (3 and 14 years old). Her husband has a combine harvester and harvests grain crops. 

The family makes their living through an agricultural business. In particular, they own a plot of land where apples, potatoes and haricots are grown. Ekaterine is also involved in an animal husbandry business. She has two milking cows and five calves. Ekaterine milks the cows every day and produces cheese. The cheese is sold locally. Ekaterine runs a general store near her house as well. Ekaterine and her husband work hard from early morning till late evening to improve the living conditions of the family.

Ekaterine requested a loan to expand her general store by buying a greater variety of products, foods and beverages in particular, to stock her store and better satisfy her customers. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase stock, including food and beverages, for her general store.

loans.name: Marina Lizbeth

texts.es: Marina es dueña de un negocio de abarrotes llamado" Abarrotes Mary", ella en compañía de su esposo Vicente decidieron solicitar un credito e invertirlo en la compra de mercancia  ya que hace algunos meses logró ampliar el lugar donde lo tiene y hoy requiere ampliar la variedad de mercancias que vende; su expectativa es mejorar las ganancias pues sus dos hijos aunque pequeños "ya van a la escuela y necesitan material escolar y uniformes ademas que estan creciendo muy rapido y asi crecen sus necesidades" .
texts.en: Marina is the owner of a small grocery business called “Abarrotes Mary” (Mary’s Groceries). Together with her husband Vicente, they decided to request a loan and invest it in the purchase of merchandise, since a few months ago they managed to expand her local, and now she needs to increase the variety of merchandise that she sells. Her expectation is to improve her earnings, since her two children, though small, “already go to school and need school supplies and uniforms, and additionally are growing very fast and thus their needs are growing.”

loans.use: to purchase refreshing beverages, canned foods and dairy products in general.

loans.name: Elsevar

texts.en:
Elsevar lives in Agsu, Azerbaijan. He is a 27-year-old single man. He is very hardworking.  One year ago, he decided to begin selling groceries in an effort to earn an income. Nowadays, he has his own general store. 

In order to offer his customers a wider variety of products, Elsevar requested  a loan in the amount of 1,000 (Azerbaijani New Manat) AZN to buy basic staple items.  Elsevar's greatest dreams are to have a great business, a house of his own and to marry his girlfriend. He gives his thanks in advance for the support given.

loans.use: to buy basic staple items in order to offer his customers a wider variety of products.

loans.name: Kavumbi

texts.en:
Kavumbi is 62 years old, married and the mother of four children. For the last ten years, she has earned a living by selling fish in Malindi. She earns a monthly profit of KES 10,000. 


She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and is applying for her first loan of KES 30,000, to buy additional fish for her business to sell to her customers as well as to purchase more wooden boxes for her business. 


She will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay school fees for some of her children who are still in school as well as expand her business. Her goal for the future is to continue with her business with the possibility of owning a fish depot in the area.

loans.use: to buy additional fish and more wooden boxes for stocking fish.

loans.name: Tarek

texts.en:
Tarek is from Iraq. He is 47 years old, married and has five children. His wife works and contributes to the family income.

Tarek is a blacksmith. He established his business in 1990 and now he has two employees. He has good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting $2800 as a loan to buy a generator. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a generator

loans.name: Hadi

texts.en:
Hadi is from Iraq. He is 50 years old, married and has three children. He is the only provider for the family.

Hadi owns a small grocery store selling soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergents and snacks. He established his business in 2005 and now he has good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting a $3000 loan to renovate the shop and to increase his inventory. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate the shop and to increase his inventory

loans.name: Arlette

texts.fr: Arlette est âgée de 37 ans et est mariée à un certain Jacob. Arlette est mère de trois enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés et tous à la charge du couple. Arlette vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants et assure ensemble avec son mari, les divers besoins du ménage. Pour contribuer aux différents besoins, Arlette exerce l'activité de coiffure depuis plus de dix ans. De façon secondaire, Arlette vend des produits de cheveux et des boissons. Cette activité lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins. Arlette s’approvisionne au Bénin, mais aussi au Nigeria. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Arlette sollicite pour la deuxième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt lui permettra de rehausser le niveau de son activité et d’accroître sa clientèle et son revenu.
texts.en: Arlette is 37 years old. Her husband’s name is Jacob. Arlette is the mother of three dependent children, some of whom are in school. Arlette lives together with her husband and children and, jointly with her husband, provides for various household needs. In order to support herself, Arlette has been working as a hairdresser for over 10 years. As a secondary activity, Arlette sells hair care supplies and beverages. This business allows her to provide for her needs without great difficulty. Arlette stocks up in Benin and also in Nigeria. With the goal of meeting customer demand and increasing her sales volume and her revenues, Arlette is seeking  a second loan from ALIDé. This loan will allow her to expand her business, increasing her customer base and her revenues.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions, hair care products and beverages.

loans.name: Jose Candelario

texts.es: Jose desde hace varios años se dedica a la elaboración y venta de ladrillos, empezó esta actividad ya que quería hacer algo diferente a otras personas. Hizo esto porque quería tener menos competencia, el trabajo lo realiza solo desde muy temprano hasta el medio día ya que es un trabajo muy pesado y termina cansado. Su esposa le ayuda en la economía ya que se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catalogo mientras su hijo asiste a la escuela fiscal. El trabajo que realiza es pagado por bloque si este se daña al momento de la transportación se va al gasto por lo que se debe tener cuidado. El préstamo que está solicitando es para comprar la materia prima como la arcilla, sílice, aluminia, agua y otros materiales esenciales para la elaboración del ladrillo. A futuro espera poder mejorar un poco su casa y el negocio para aumentar su producción así como ampliar su clientela.
texts.en: For several years, Jose has been making and selling bricks. He started this activity since he wanted to do something different from other people. He did this, because he wanted to have less competition. He does the work alone, starting very early and working until mid day, since it is hard work and he finishes tired. His wife helps him financially since she sells beauty products from a catalogue, while their child attends public school. His work is paid by the block, and if it is harmed during transport, it becomes an expense, so one has to be careful. The loan that he is requesting is to buy raw materials such as clay, silica, alumina, water and other essential materials for brick making. In the future, he hopes to be able to improve his house and business a bit in order to increase his production and thus expand his customer base.

loans.use: to purchase clay, silica, alumina, water and other materials for brick making.

loans.name: Veronicah

texts.en: Veronicah is a 26-year-old single woman. She has a daughter who is 3 years old. She describes herself to be a reliable woman. She operates a retail store where she sells soft drinks such as soda etc and food. She has been involved in this business for 4 years and employs 2 staff members. Her business is located within a densely populated area  and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy soft drinks for resell. Her business goal is to run a bigger retail store within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks for resale

loans.name: Ana Maricruz

texts.es: Ana Maricruz de cuarenta y dos años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida, su hija y su madre, ella posee una tienda donde vende productos de primera necesidad granos básicos, huevos, leche, jabones, etc. tiene varios años con el negocio y ya tiene mucha experiencia en las ventas, esta ubicado en una zona muy concurrida de personas y ya tiene mucha clientela, las personas la prefieren porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan, su tienda es la mas surtida con productos de primera calidad y a precios accesibles además el servicio es inigualable; Ana es una mujer enérgica, dedicada a su labor, y siempre esta buscando alternativas para alcanzar sus sueños, una de ellas es acrecentar su tienda pero necesita de capital para la inversión por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, pan, huevos, bebidas, jabones, etc. Ana Maricruz tiene buenas referencias de pago, es responsable, asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda en el periodo establecido y a la vez tiene fe que podrá llevar a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en: Ana Maricruz is 42 years old and lives with her life partner, daughter and mother. She has a store where she sells staple grains, eggs, milk, soap etc. She has been in this business for several years and already has a lot of experience in sales. She is located in a busy area, and she already has a lot of customers. People prefer her, because she always has what they need. Her store is the best stocked with products of the highest quality and at accessible prices. In addition, the service is unmatched. Ana is an energetic woman, dedicated to her work and always looking for alternatives to reach her dreams. One of them is to add to her store, but she needs investment capital. This is why she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL, a loan that will allow her to buy staple grains, sweets, bread, eggs, drinks, soaps etc. Ana Maricruz has good payment references, is responsible, and assures that she will be able to pay off the debt in the established period. At the same time, she has faith that she will be able to bring financial security to her household.

loans.use: to buy staple grains, sweets, bread, eggs, drinks and soaps.

loans.name: Celine

texts.en:
Celine is a 27-year-old single mother of one child who is 8 years old. She runs an M-PESA shop known as the place for local money transfers both in rural and urban areas. She has been in this business for the last two years and earns a monthly income of 50,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). 

She has requested a second loan of KES 60,000 to open up another branch so that she will be able to serve her customers well.

The profit she earns from this business will aid her in repaying her loan and expanding her business. Her dream is to see her business prosper as well as be able to support her family financially.

loans.use: to open another branch of an M-PESA  call center.

loans.name: Bahlul

texts.en:
Bahlul is 47 years old. He is married and lives with his children and wife in the town of Agsu. Bahlul has had a general store for 10 years that he opened because he needed to generate income for his family to offer a better quality of life for his four children. 

To improve his income from the store, Bahlul requested a loan of 1,500 Azerbaijani New Manat (AZN) to purchase additional stock of items such as tea, cooking oil, soft drinks, sugar and other ingredients to resell.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of items such as tea, cooking oil, soft drinks, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 54 years old and married with 13 children. She practices livestock and crop farming to earn a living. She has been engaged in this business for seven years. Through Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to save because she has been trained in financial management. She dreams of increasing her farm yields and selling them in bulk in the future. Esther is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy seedlings.

loans.use: To buy seedlings.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 41 years old, married and has four children. He does garbage collection to earn a living.  He collects garbage, which he disposes of, and some items such as plastic bags are recycled. He has employed three people in the business. He likes this business because it is a way of keeping the environment clean. He has been engaged in the business for six years.

Peter hopes to expand the business in the future. He needs 80,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy garbage-collection tools such as a wheelbarrow and rake.

loans.use: To buy a wheelbarrow and rake.

loans.name: Albanus

texts.en:
Albanus is a hardworking 28-year-old man who practices livestock keeping to earn a living. He has engaged himself in this business for three years. Besides this he does crop farming to supplement his income. Since he became a client of Faulu Kenya, he has become financially knowledgeable because he has been trained on financial management. He dreams of owning a pickup for easy transportation of his yields. 

Albanus has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to buy goats.

loans.use: to buy goats.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Manuel Silvino

texts.es: Manuel aprendió desde los 15 años el trabajo de mecánico, empezó como ayudante en un taller el cual le dio la oportunidad de aprender y ganar confianza. Hace 4 años atrás decidió empezar su propio taller ya que le gusta el trabajo y lo más importante que es ser independiente. El trabajo lo realiza con un ayudante desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde. Como el taller lo abrió hace poco tiempo tiene necesidad de adquirir herramientas para mejorar su servicio y eso es lo que va adquirir con el préstamo que está solicitando. Su meta a futuro es poder comprar un carro para dar servicio de taxi y poner el negocio en su domicilio mejorando de esta manera su economía ya que no gastaría en alquiler.
texts.en: Manuel learned to work as a mechanic from the age of 15, beginning as an assistant in a shop where he had the opportunity to learn and gain confidence. Four years ago he decided to open his own shop because he enjoys the work and the most important thing for him is to be independent. He works together with an assistant from 8 o'clock int the morning until 6 o'clock in the evening. Because the shop is still rather new, he needs to acquire tools to improve his service. This is how he will use the loan for which he has applied. His goal for the future is to purchase a car to start a taxi service and to move his shop to his home, thereby improving his economic situation as he will no longer be renting.

loans.use: to buy tools.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is a thirty-two-year old man, married to Dorcas, and they are blessed with two children. He sells new clothes in the Kangemi area of Nairobi and has been in this business for three years now. He gets a monthly income of twelve thousands shillings only.

This will be Wilson's first loan with KADET LTD, and he plans to buy more clothes for resale. With the profit that he will get he wants to improve his living standard and also plough back some money into his business.

In the future he wants to improve his family's living standard and also to be a successful business man.

loans.use: to buy more for stock of new clothes for sale.

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en:
Kenneth is 42 years old and married to Everlyne. They are blessed with four children aged 15, 11, nine and four years. He provides transport services through his motorbike; a business he ventured in 11 years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 20,000. 

He wants to start a grocery shop and has requested a second loan of KES 45,000 to purchase fruits, vegetables, beans, and maize. The profit he makes from his business will help him educate his children. His dream is to see his business grow and to open a wholesale shop for grocery goods in the future.

loans.use: To purchase fruits, vegetables, beans, and maize for his new line of business.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace owns a beauty salon, a business she started eight years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 55,000. She wants to purchase hair weaves, braids, shampoos, and conditioners for use in her business and has requested a second loan of KES 50,000. Her profit will aid her to purchase a motorbike for a new line of business. She dreams of being a great entrepreneur in the future.

loans.use: To purchase items to be used in her salon.

loans.name: Tsiala

texts.en:
Tsiala is 58 years old and lives in the Akhmeta district. She is married and has two grown sons. Tsiala’s husband is a pensioner. Her sons help Tsiala to run their dairy and poultry business. Tsiala has three milking cows. She milks the cows every day and produces cheese. The cheese is sold locally. The family owns 25 turkeys and 125 turkey poults. Tsiala plans to raise them and sell during the winter season. All family members work hard, but they still don’t have enough income to make some savings and improve their living condition.

Tsiala requested a loan to purchase food for turkeys. She will be able to buy maize and wheat for feeding them properly. She will sell turkeys and increase the income of the family. With the increase income, Tsiala will purchase additional milking cows. She will expand her dairy business and improve the living conditions of the family. Tsiala awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase food for turkeys.

loans.name: Hiram

texts.en:
Hiram is 23 years old and single with no dependents. He sells second-hand clothes, a business he started four years ago. He earns a monthly income of KES 50,000; he will use the loan amount to purchase shoes and more clothes for sale and has requested a second loan of KES 50,000.

The profit he makes from his businesses will help him open his own shop for displaying shoes and clothes. His dream is to own his own business empire.

loans.use: To purchase bales of clothes and shoes for sale.

loans.name: Luis Alejandro

texts.es: Luis tiene 40 años viviendo en la hermosa ciudad de Quevedo, aquí vive junto a su familia. El siempre a sido un hombre trabajador ya que desde muy joven empezó vendiendo mango y ciruelas con sal pero como no ganaba mucho dinero decidió buscar otro trabajo. Fue así como su esposa le enseño el negocio de empanada de verde, desde ese entonces realiza el negocio trabajando todos los días desde las 17:00 de la tarde hasta las 20:00 de la noche ya que en la mañana continúan con su venta de mangos porque aprovecha la época estudiantil. El préstamo la va a solicitar para la compra de una hielera, carpa para su negocio y arreglar la moto en la que se transporta para poner la venta así como tener capital de trabajo para la compra de los ingredientes. Su sueño a futuro es poder salir adelante y poder comprar su propia casa siguiendo adelante con el negocio para mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Luis is 40 years old and lives in the beautiful city of Quevedo. He lives with his family. He has always been a hard-working man and from a young age he has sold mangos and salty prunes. As he was not earning much money, he decided to look for another job. It was in these circumstances that his wife taught him the business of empanadas de verde (plantain empanadas). Since then he has been carrying out this business working every day from 17:00 to 20:00, since during the morning he continues to sell mangos, taking advantage of the student season. 

He will use the loan to buy a refrigerator, a tarpaulin-roof for his business and to fix the motorbike which he uses for transport to his stall as well as to have capital to buy the igredients. His dream for the future is to be able to buy his own house, to continue to move forward with his business to improve his income.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and a tarpaulin-roof, to fix the motorbike which he uses for transport to his stall and to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Cecilia Juana

texts.es: Cecilia se dedica a la confección de ropa para toda ocasión, a sus 52 años tiene mucho tiempo de experiencia en esta área. Entre sus trabajos ella realiza vestidos de novia, uniformes, ternos de hombres etc. le gusta mucho su trabajo por lo que le gustaría tener un taller más grande, por el momento cuenta solo con una máquina de coser por lo que no tiene ayudante y hay ocasiones en que las necesita. Realiza la labor de lunes a domingos cuando tiene trabajo por terminar pero por lo general trabajo todos los días. El préstamo lo empleara para la compra de telas, hilos, elásticos es decir capital de trabajo, espera que su negocio siga creciendo ya que su meta es ponerse un taller de costura.
texts.en:
Cecilia earns her living making clothes for all occasions. At 52 years she has a lot of experience in this field. She makes items such as wedding dresses, uniforms and suits amongst others. She likes her work very much and for this reason she would like to have a larger workshop. At the moment she only has one sewing machine and for this reason she is unable to have an assistant, whereas there are times when she needs one.
 
She carries out her work from Monday to Sunday when she has work to finish but usually she works every day. She will use the loan to buy fabrics, thread, elastics, that is for her businesses’ capital expenses. She hopes her business will continue to grow since her goal is to open a tailor’s workshop.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread and elastic.

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru: Рустам родился 1985 году в Дангаре. Он живет с женой. У них маленький ребенок. Жена Рустама домохозяйка. Рустам занимается торговлей. Он рядом с домом открыл свой продуктовый магазин. Торговлей он занимается два года. Рустам хочет увеличить ассортимент своего товара, чтобы клиенты могли с легкостью найти и купить необходимые продукты. Он просит кредит для покупки продуктов.
texts.en:
Rustam was born in 1985 in Dangara. He is married to a homemaker and they have one small child. 

Rustam has been working in trade for two years and has opened his own grocery store near his house. He is seeking a loan in order to purchase a greater variety of products for his shop. This expansion of the range of goods he can offer will enable Rustam to more easily meet the needs of his customers.

loans.use: to purchase a greater variety of food products for his business

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with seven children, four of whom go to school. She operates a restaurant from home on a retail basis. She has been in business for the last 4 years. Jane works six days in a week. She has requested a loan of 200,000 Uganda Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy rice, beef, cooking oil, green bananas and flour. Her major business challenges are seasonality, thieves and transportation. Her goals and aspirations are to buy a plot of land .She lives in her own house and the family has no access to electricity and piped water. Jane's major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more rice, beef, cooking oil, green bananas and maize flour

loans.name: Jipar

texts.ru:
Жыпар 42 года, замужем, воспитывает 3 детей. Жыпар работает учителем в местной школе и в качестве дополнительного источника дохода для своей семьи, на протяжении 13 лет занимается полеводством  и животноводством, начав этот бизнес с 3,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Жыпар в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется 2 коровы с приплодом, 10 голов мелкого рогатого скота, 2 лошади, ежемесячная прибыль от хозяйства составляет около 4,000 сом (KGS). Также, Жыпар возделывает 3,4 га земли с ячменем, картошкой и многолетними травами. 
Так как осенний период является особенно активным, что связано с сезонностью в агросекторе, Жыпар также, как и многие жители сел, нуждается в финансовой поддержке для развития своего бизнеса. В связи с этим, Жыпар обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку кобыл на откорм на летнем пастбище. Доходы от кредита Жыпар планирует вкладывать в развитие бизнеса, а в следующем году планирует провести свадьбу сына.
texts.en:
Jipar is 42 years old, married, and raising 3 children. She works as a teacher at a local school. Furthermore, as a source of additional income for her family, Jipar has been growing crops and raising livestock for the past 13 years, having started her business with 3,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her hard work, Jipar's herd presently includes 2 cows with offspring, 10 goats and sheep, and 2 horses, while her monthly profits amount to roughly 4,000 som (KGS). Additionally, Jipar works 3.4 hectares of land with barley, potatoes and perennial grasses.

As the fall season is particularly active in agriculture, Jipar, like many other countryside residents, needs financial support in order to develop her business. In light of this, she has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to purchase mares for fattening at a summer pasture. Jipar intends to invest her profits from this loan into further expansion of her business, and also plans to hold her son's wedding next year.

loans.use: to purchase horses for fattening

loans.name: Bobokhon

texts.ru:
Бобохон проживает в районе Дж. Руми. Ему 66 лет. Бобохон вдовец, он живет вместе с дочерью. Образование у него средне-специальное. Он более четырех лет работает таксистом. Бобохон в основном развозит пассажиров по маршруту Дж. Руми-Джиликуль. 
Бобохон просит кредит для приобретения запчастей для автомашины. Также он намерен провести свадьбу своей дочери.
texts.en:
Bobokhon lives in the J. Rumy region. He is a 66-year-old widower and lives together with his daughter. Bobokhon has a vocational degree and has been working as a taxi driver for over four years. Mainly, he transports passengers along the J. Rumy-Dzhilikul route.

Bobokhon is requesting a loan to purchase spare parts for his automobile. He is also planning to hold his daughter's wedding.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his taxi and to hold his daughter's wedding

loans.name: Abanyamurava Group

texts.en: Marie Claudine is a mother of three children aged between one month and 10 years old. She is 30 years old. Marie Claudine sells foodstuffs and she has been in the business for the past three years. She is group leader of a group called "Abanyamurava" meaning "People with determination" in English. The group members operate different types of businesses but they are all determined to change their lives through doing business. With the loan Marie Claudine will buy more foodstuffs to sell such as bananas, rice and maize flour. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for the family. In the picture, the group leader holds a blue book.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for sale.

loans.name: Johnsthan

texts.en:
Johnsthan is a 51-year-old restaurant owner in Mombasa. He is married with two children. He has been operating the restaurant for the past six years with great success. 

This is Johnsthan's second business loan from KADET LTD to finance his business. He plans to buy more food stuffs and assorted drinks. He will use the anticipated profits to open another restaurant and educate his children. 

He hopes to excel in the business and to have a happy family.

loans.use: to buy more food stuffs and assorted drinks

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en: Olivia is widowed with three children and two of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (grandchildren). She operates a retail shop and has been in this business for 13 years. She works seven days a week. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy cooking oil, bags of sugar, cartons of salt, flour and rice. She works from home and sells to all categories of people but on retail. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She aspires to become a wholesaler and also to build rental houses. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and paying for electricity bills.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, rice and maize flour

loans.name: Davlyatkhon

texts.ru: Давлятхон проживает в районе Дж. Руми. Она замужем. Ей 41 год. У нее трое детей. Муж Давлятхон уехал на заработки за границу. Сама Давлятхон портниха. Она в основном занимается шитьем национальных платьев. Этим видом деятельности она занимается у себя дома. Давлятхон просит кредит для приобретения швейной машинки.
texts.en: Davlyatkhon lives in the J. Rumy region. She is 41 years old, married, and has three children. Davlyatkhon's husband has left to find employment abroad, while she works as a seamstress. Davlyatkhon works at home and mainly makes traditional dresses. She is requesting a loan to purchase a new sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a 35-year-old business lady who sells second hand clothes in Mombasa. She is a married mother of two children. Amina has been running a second hand clothes retail stall for the last twelve years and she is doing great. 

This will be Amina's second business loan from KADET LTD to finance her business. She plans to purchase more second hand shirts, skirts, blouses, and trousers to sell to her customers. 

She will use the anticipated profits to repay her loan and educate her children. She hopes to succeed and to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase more second hand shirts, skirts, blouses, and trousers to sell to her customers

loans.name: Prudence

texts.en:
Prudence is a 31-year-old business lady who sells cloth materials and shoes in Mombasa. She is a married mother of two children. She has been running a retail stall which deals with cloth materials and shoes for the last ten years and she is doing great. 

This will be Prudence's fourth business loan from KADET LTD to finance her business. She plans to purchase more materials and shoes to sell to her customers.

She will use the anticipated profits to repay her loan and educate her children. She hopes to succeed and to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase more materials and shoes

loans.name: Ziyovadin

texts.ru: Зиёвадину 31 лет. Его жена очень красивая женщина. Ее зовут Наргиза и она всегда старается помочь своему мужу. На воспитании Зиёвадин и Наргиза имеют двоих детей. Дети еще нетрудоспособные, старшему 4 года, а младшему 2 года. Он   занимается скотоводством и земледелием  уже 6 лет. В основном он выращивает пшеницу, картофель, и другие сельхоз продукты. В настоящее время он выращивает 3 голов коровы и 6 голов барана.  В ведении бизнеса жена помогает ему. На полученный доход от реализации скота он намерен расширить свой бизнес. Он запрашивает кредит на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки 3 голов коровы. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Ziyovadin is 31 years old. His beautiful wife Nargiza always tries to help her husband. Together, they are raising two young children 4 and 2 years of age. Ziyovadin has been farming and raising livestock for the past 6 years. He mainly cultivates wheat, potatoes and other crops. Presently, he also keeps 3 cows and 6 sheep. Ziyovadin's wife helps him with the business.

Ziyovadin is planning to expand his business with the profits from the sale of his livestock. He is requesting a loan of 5000 somoni to purchase 3 cows and is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy 3 cows

loans.name: Ozoda

texts.ru: Озода трудолюбивая женщина. Она воспитывает двоих детей. Совместно с мужем занимается выращиванием картофеля на площади 0,40 га  и каждый сезон получает около 8 тонн урожая. Она имеет дополнительный доход от скотоводство. Она запрашивает кредит на сумму 4000 сомони для покупки скота. Если вы поможете ей развивать бизнес, она с дохода улучшит свое жилищное условие. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Ozoda is a hard-working woman who is raising two children. Together with her husband, Ozoda cultivates potatoes on 0.4 hectares of land and harvests nearly 8 tons of this crop every season. She supplements her income by raising cattle.

Ozoda is requesting a loan of 4000 somoni to purchase cattle. With your help, she will use her additional profits to improve her living conditions. Ozoda is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Flomena

texts.en:
Flomena is 38 years old and a single mother of one child who is 10 years. She sells cereals, a business she started 12 years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 16,000. 

She has requested her fifth loan of KES. 100,000 to purchase sacks of maize and beans for sale. 

Her profit will help her pay fees for her child. She hopes to continue with this business as well as educate her child to higher levels of education.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of maize and beans for sale.

loans.name: Nawire

texts.en:
Nawire is a 52-year-old firewood seller in Mombasa. She is a married mother of four. Her business has been in operation for the past four years with great success. 

This is her third loan with KADET LTD to finance her business. She plans to use the loan to purchase more firewood to supply to her customers. 

She will use the proceeds from her business to educate her children and repay her loan. She hopes to have a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase more firewood

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy large quantities of meat for resale.

loans.name: Radhames

texts.en:
Radhames makes his home in a simple structure with his three children. This entrepreneurial man is dedicated to selling clothes. He has been running this business for eight years and this is his second loan with Esperanza International. He plans to use this loan to purchase clothes.

Radhames is excited to be taking out this loan from Esperanza after successfully repaying his previous loans and growing his business. All through the years since starting his business, his life and the lives of his family members have experienced change. He will use his profits to support his children and to improve his business. Radhames thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Shqipe

texts.en:
Shqipe is thirty-three years old. She lives in Kosovo. She is a married woman and has three children ranging from six to ten years old. Shqipe is a housewife, taking care of her children and their home in the small town that they live in. 

Shqipe's husband works as an auto mechanic. His job is the family’s main source of income but he doesn’t earn enough to support the needs of his family. A while back they had started to renovate their home, but the money he makes is not enough to finish the work that needs to be completed on the house. There is one more room left that has not been finished.

Now Shqipe is requesting a loan to pay for the renovation of her room, which will fulfill her goal of completing her home and giving a better life and more security to her children. 
Renovation of this room will bring comfort to the members of the family, because they will have more space  and her children can have their own room so they don't have to be as cramped as they have been so far.

She is very thankful to KIVA lenders and promises to make her payments punctually!

loans.use: To pay for the renovation of her room

loans.name: Walter

texts.en:
Walter is a Peruvian artisan who specializes in ceramic Inca replicas. He would like to invest in the purchase of such raw materials as pigments and clay in order to increase production.

Walter has been selling through NOVICA since 2010. This is his story:

"Our ancestors crafted beautiful and complex pieces with only their hands as tools, without the kind of technology we have nowadays. Through their work they expressed all that they saw and wondered about, their thoughts and beliefs. I feel that Peruvian ceramic art is a way to communicate with our ancestors and to keep them alive. Believe it or not, some archeologists have been fooled by my work! That's because of the aging process I use with my pieces."

"When times are hard it is amazing to know there are people like you willing to show your support by way of this microcredit. It makes us very happy. Many thanks, and may God bless you." 

Use the link below to view Walter's museum-quality ceramic replicas on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=7284

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of such raw materials as pigments and clay in order to increase production.

loans.name: Igball

texts.en:
Igball is a fifty-five-year old woman. She is married with two children, living in a small town. Her husband is not working but he does receive a social pension, although it is very low. Igballe is very hardworking woman, as she takes care of her home and also works in the traditional agricultural manner. 

She works on her land plowing for her family's needs in order to provide and to not buy food and other things such as wheat and other vegetables. She has a stable as well, and she needs a loan to buy a milk cow. At this time they do not have a cow, as they family needed to sell it six months ago. 

They will use the cow for both providing the milk for her family, and if the cow is capable of producing more milk than that, she can sell it to others for extra income. Her family is very happy for this support and appreciates all the lenders.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice, beans, canned food, sugar, flour, and others.

loans.name: Anas

texts.en:
Anas is a 20-year-old single young man. His father is a construction worker who gets a low salary, which is not enough to cover the family's needs.

For the past three years, Anas has had a grocery store where he sells different types of groceries.  It has been a profitable project, but not enough to cover the costs.

Anas is requesting a $2,000 youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing needed stock of basic groceries that customers often request such as rice, sugar, and canned food. This will increase his sales and income.

Anas is photographed in his grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase different types of groceries to resell, such as rice, sugar, and canned food.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase new living room furniture

loans.name: Ghaleb

texts.en:
Ghaleb is a 40-year-old man. He is married and a father of two sons and three daughters.

Ghaleb is a construction worker who gets a low salary, which is not enough to cover the family's expenses.

Ghaleb is requesting a US $1,500 loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of completing his house, including painting and installing tiles. Taking this loan will offer Ghaleb and his family comfortable home conditions so that they can enjoy living in their house.

Ghaleb is photographed in his house.

loans.use: To finish his house, including painting and installing tiles.

loans.name: Tafo Group

texts.en:
This is Tafo Group and they are made up of 11 members, all of whom are traders. They have been together as a group for three years and they meet every Wednesday to discuss their businesses. Six of the women are married with children, three are not married, and two are single parents. Their ages range between 23 and 65 years old. They sell electrical accessories, underwear, secondhand clothing, sewing accessories, fish, fruit, drinks, plastic products, and cosmetics.

Isaac is an electrical accessories salesman who is married to a trader and has two children. All the members of the family work in the sale of electrical accessories. This is his fourth loan cycle with ID Ghana and he needs 1,500 Ghana cedis to be able to buy more TV antennae, electrical wires, bulbs, and extension boards. He took 1,000 Ghana cedis in his third loan cycle and he finished payment on 18/07/2012. His monthly profit is 140 Ghana cedis, which he uses in part for family upkeep and in part for reinvestment. Isaac buys his goods from the electrical depot and supplies customers in Teshie and Tema. 

Tafo Group needs a total loan of 6,100 Ghana cedis to be able to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy more electrical accessories to sell to customers.

loans.name: Izzeddeen

texts.en:
IzzEddeen is a 51-year-old man. He is married and a father to three sons and three daughters. His elder son is a carpenter and gets a low salary, which is not enough to cover his needs.
For more than ten years, IzzEddeen has been making craft items from olive wood and selling to customers and visitors who come for tourism to the Holy Land.
IzzEddeen is requesting a 3,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing a new carving kit to provide better quality to his customers. This will increase sales and improve IzzEddeen's income.
IzzEddeen is photographed in his workshop.

loans.use: To purchase a new carving kit

loans.name: Honey Center Group

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 33 years old and lives in Tuburan, Pagadian City Zamboanga del Sur Phillippines. She is married  with three children.

Jocelyn sells Avon products to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns PHP 10,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 23,900 to purchase cosmetics for sale such as Avon products.

Jocelyn has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. In the future, she hopes to open her own shop.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics for sale such as Avon products

location.town: Pagadian-Tuburan, Pagadian City Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is married with 3 children. She is 52 years old and lives in Poblacion Titay, Zamboanga Sibugay.
Adelaida sells food for snacks to earn a living and has had this business for 6 years. She has requested a loan of 5,000 to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business.
Adelaida is a new member of PMPC. In the future, Adelaida hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business

loans.name: Hanchel

texts.en:
Hanchel is married with one child. He is 38 years old and lives in Fatima, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.
Hanchel sells rice and corn to earn a living and has had this business for 4 years. Each month, he earns 40,000 doing this type of work. He has requested a loan of 50,000 to purchase more sacks of rice and corn to sell.
Hanchel has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Hanchel hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice and corn to sell

loans.name: Agblezaa Group

texts.en:
Agblezaa is a group made up of 9 members with the average age of 40 years and average number of children of 2. 6 are married and the rest are single. They are into the sale of plastic items, fishing nets, firewood, jewelry, and sauce pans. They buy their goods from the central market and sell in their community. They are in their 1st loan cycle with ID-Ghana and they meet on Mondays to discuss their business. They have been meeting for one and half years. 
 
Setina is a 22-year-old married woman with one child. She is married to a businessman whiles her daughter is a school boy. She sells plastic items. She buys from a wholesale shop and supplies to customers in Teshie. She needs this loan to be able to meet customer demand. She makes a profit of 100 Ghana cedis monthly. 

They need a total sum of 2,750 Ghana cedis to be able to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy more plastics bucket, bowls, and chairs to sell.

loans.name: Everlita

texts.en:
Everlita is single. Everlita is 56 years old and lives in Comunal, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

Everlita sells Fern-C vitamin C (vitamin C in sodium ascorbate form) to earn a living and has had this business for seven years. Each month, she earns 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase more vitamins for her retail business.

Everlita has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Everlita hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more vitamins for her retail business.

loans.name: Sampaguita

texts.en:
Sampaguita is 54 years old and lives in San Pedro District, Pagadian City. She is married with three children.

She has a mini retail outlet that sells ready-to-wear products. She has had this business for almost 15 years. She has requested a loan amounting 14,900 PHP to purchase more clothes for her ready-to-wear products business.

She has been a member of PMPC for almost five years. In the future, she hopes to be a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for ready-to-wear products business

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is married with 2 children. Liezel is 28 years old and lives in Banigan, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

Liezel owns a general store to earn a living and has had this business for 1 year. Each month, she earns 3,500 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store such as shampoo, toothpaste and beverages.

Liezel has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, Liezel hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store such as shampoo, toothpaste and beverages

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is married with five children. Lolita is 55 years old and lives in Barra, Tudela.

Lolita is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. Lolita has been doing this for three years. Lolita has requested a loan of 30,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to purchase additional feeds for her pigs.

Lolita has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, Lolita hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds for her pigs.

loans.name: Sweet Rose Center Group

texts.en:
Patricia is married with three children. Patricia is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Patricia is a farmer and grows vegetables, rice grains and corn bits to earn a living. She has been doing this for 20 years. She has requested a loan of 8,000 Philippines pesos to purchase more fertilizer for her farm business.

Patricia has been a member of PMPC for almost one year. In the future, Patricia hopes to expand her farmland.

loans.use: to purchase more fertilizer for her farm business.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan is married with 3 children. Jonathan is 52 years old and lives in Causwagan, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

Jonathan buys and sells charcoal to earn a living and has had this business for 12 years. Each month, he earns 10,000 PHP doing this type of work. He has requested a loan for 40,000 PHP to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell at retail.

Jonathan has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Jonathan hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell at retail

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is married with 3 children. Lorna is 58 years old and lives in Poblacio, Salug, Zamboanga del Norte.

Lorna sells school supplies to earn a living and has had this business for 30 years. Each month she earns 15,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase more school supplies to sell at retail.

Lorna has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, Lorna hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more school supplies to sell at retail

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is married with 4 children. She is 34 years old and lives in Dansalan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.
Carmen sells snack food to earn a living and has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan of 8,500 to purchase raw foods to cook for her snack vending business.
Carmen has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Carmen hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw foods to cook for her snack vending business

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet is 39 years old and lives in Bagacay, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She is married with five school-aged children. Juliet has a general store that sells canned goods, soap, toothpaste, noodles and etc. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan of 12,000 to purchase soft drinks, sacks of rice, noodles, alcoholic beverages, shampoo, soaps, and junk food. Juliet has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Juliet hopes to start another business.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, sacks of rice, noodles, alcoholic beverages, shampoo, soaps, and junk foods.

loans.name: Ayidote 3 Group

texts.fr: AYIDOTE 3 est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres sont des amies et qui s’approvisionnent au même endroit. La représentante du groupe, Joséphine (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 62 ans et est mariée à un marchand du nom de Simon. Le couple a cinq enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Joséphine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Joséphine vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari, les différentes charges de la maison. Depuis près de trente ans, Joséphine vend divers articles à son domicile. Joséphine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. C’est la troisième fois que Joséphine et les autres membres du groupe AYIDOTE 3 sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Les deux premiers crédits ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
AYIDOTE 3 is a group of three friends who stock up at the same place. Joséphine, the group's representative, is the one who is raising her hand in the photo. She is 62 years old and married to a merchant named Simon. The couple has five children, all of whom live in their care. Some of their children have received schooling. Joséphine did not go to school. She lives with her children and her husband, and she and her husband both cover the various household expenses.

Joséphine has been selling various items from her home for almost thirty years now. She stocks up at a market in Benin.

This is the third time that Joséphine and the other members of the AYIDOTE 3 group are seeking the financial support of ALIDé, in view of strengthening their working capital and their business, and better responding to the demand of their clients. The two previous loans were paid back correctly.

loans.use: to buy various products

loans.name: Edcie's Group

texts.en:
Edcie is 40 years old and lives in Dicoloc, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 4 children. 
Edcie has a general store that sells consumable products. She has had this business for one year.  She requested a loan of 14,900 to purchase more stocks for her general store such as shampoo, toothpaste, and beverages.
Edcie has been a member of PMPC for 1 year.  In the future, she hopes to expand her business. Edcie is the leader of a 3-person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store such as shampoo, toothpaste and beverages

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.en:
Asuncion is 50 years old and lives in Sumasap, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with four children.
 
To earn a living, Asuncion has a business selling snacks. She earns about 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. Asuncion has requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase more raw ingredients for her snack-vending business.

Asuncion has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Asuncion would like to engage in another type of business.

loans.use: to purchase more raw ingredients for her snack-vending business

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 59 years old and lives in Butuay, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with five children.
 
Corazon has a direct-selling business, particularly selling Avon and Natasha products, and earns approximately 6,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan of 40,000 PHP to purchase more cosmetics products such as Avon and Natasha products.

Corazon has been a member of PMPC for almost seven years. In the future, Corazon hopes to travel abroad.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics products such as Avon and Natasha products.

loans.name: Warlita's Group

texts.en:
Warlita is 69 years old and lives in Butuay, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with nine children.
 
Warlita has a hog-fattening business and earns approximately 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to be used in purchasing feeds for her hog-fattening business. 

Warlita has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, Warlita hopes to engage in another type of business. Warlita is the leader of a two-person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: To purchase feeds for her hog-fattening business.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is 59 years old and lives in Canibungan Proper, Tudela. Pacita is widowed with three children.
 
Pacita has a store that sells a variety of products. Pacita has had this business for seven years.

Pacita requested a loan of 11,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

Pacita has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, Pacita hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 45 years old and lives in Dela Paz, Clarin. Marilou is married with three children.
 
Marilou works in the fishing industry and catches fish for a living. Marilou has been doing this for 10 years. Marilou has requested a loan of 14,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to purchase additional fishing materials.

Marilou has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Marilou hopes to financially support her family members.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing materials.

loans.name: Conrado

texts.en: Conrado, married with 3 kids, is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. To earn a living, Conrado is operating a service-based business providing transportation services to local community members. He has been doing this for 3 years and every month he earns 10,000 PHP from this work. He has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to repair his existing vehicle for better service. Conrado has been a member of GDMPC since 2011. In the future, Conrado hopes to gain double income from his business.

loans.use: to repair his existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Nelie

texts.en:
Nelie is married with 3 children. She is 40 years old and lives in Locsoon, Tudela.

Nelie is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for 3 years. Nelie has requested a loan of 13,000 PHP to purchase additional feed for her pigs. Nelie has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. 

In the future, Nelie hopes to financially support her family members.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for her pigs

loans.name: Esteria  Group

texts.en:
Esteria is 51 years old and lives in Bliss Cabol-anonan, Tudela. She is married with 5 children. 

Esteria has a general store that sells a variety of products. Esteria has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.. Esteria has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

Esteria is the leader of a 2 person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Dexie

texts.en:
Dexie is 51 years old and lives in Poblacion, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 2 children. 

Dexie has a hog-fattening business and earns approximately 5,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to be used in purchasing feeds for her business. Dexie has been a member of PMPC for 7 years. In the future, Dexie hopes to engage in other types of business.

loans.use: To purchase feeds for her business

loans.name: Enriqueta

texts.en:
Enriqueta is 54 years old and lives in Ibabao, Aloran Mis Occ. She is a widow with one adult child and one school-age child.

Enriqueta has a dried fish retail business and earns approximately 6,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to use for her business. Enriqueta has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, Enriqueta hopes to improve her living conditions

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish for her retail business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy plastic slippers.

loans.name: Ave Maria Group

texts.fr: AVE MARIA est un groupe de deux personnes, dont les membres sont des amies. La représentante du groupe, Olga Metounkpon(dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 40 ans et est mariée à un certain Alban. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Olga Metounkpon et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les différentes charges des enfants. Olga Metounkpon a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire. Il y a près de cinq ans que Olga Metounkpon mène comme activité la vente de produits de cafétéria à son domicile. Olga Metounkpon exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Olga Metounkpon s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Olga Metounkpon sollicite un premier crédit avec les autres membres du groupe AVE MARIA. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
AVE MARIA is a group of two persons whose members are friends. The group's representative, Olga Metounkpon (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 40 years old and married to a man named Alban. The couple have four children, not all in school but all in their care. She and her husband live together with their children and jointly ensure that the different expenses are covered for the children. 

Olga Metounkpon dropped out of secondary school. For five years, she has had a business selling cafeteria products out of her home. She works at it with passion, and this enables her to meet her needs and those of her children. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin.

Seeking to satisfy her customers, Olga Metounkpon is requesting, along with the other member of the group AVE MARIA, is requesting  an initial loan. This loan will be used to respond better to the demands of their customers and to make more profit.

loans.use: to purchase cafeteria products to sell from home

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 46 years old and lives in Gango, Ozamiz City. She is widow, with three adult children.

Delia has an Internet cafe business and earns about PHP 10,000 each month doing this type of business. She has requested a loan to pay for a house extension.

Delia has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, she hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To pay for a house extension.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 48 years old and lives in Lapasan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is widow with three school-age children.

Delia has a dried fish retail business and earns approximately 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of business. She has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase more stock of dried fish for her retail business.

Delia has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Delia hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of dried fish for her retail business.

loans.name: Rosalita

texts.en:
Rosalita is 65 years old and lives in Dela Paz, Clarin. Rosalita is married with two children.
 
Rosalita has a general store that sells a variety of products. Rosalita has had this business for eight years. Rosalita requested a loan to purchase additional products, such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

Rosalita has been a member of PMPC for eight years. In the future, Rosalita hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products, such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Mande 2 Group

texts.fr:
Mme ABIBATA est la représentante du groupe MANDE 2. ABIBATA se porte bien. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Le plus  âgée 15ans et le moins âgée a 07ans. Tous  vont  à l’école et elle a 03 personnes à sa charge.

Mme vend des légumes depuis 02ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de  pissy .Ses clients sont les  hommes et femmes. Elle est très contente du bon déroulement  de son prêt passé. 

Mme veut  s’acheter  01 sac de gombo sec ; 01 sac de choux et 01 sac d’aubergine et autres légumes.

Elle épargne ses bénéfices pour  agrandir son hangar. Mme tient toujours ses ambitions qui est  d’ouvrir une boutique de stockage pour les légumes et de scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Ms. ABIBATA is the representative of the group MANDE 2. She is doing well. She is married and the mother of three children. The oldest is 15 years old, and the youngest is 7. They all go to school. She has three persons to support.

Ms. ABIBATA has been selling vegetables for two years. She gets her supplies from the Pissy market. Her customers include men and women. She is very happy with how nicely her past loan went. 

She wants to purchase a sack of okra, a sack of cabbage, a sack of eggplant, and other vegetables.

She saves her profits in order to expand her stall. She also has ambitions to open a warehouse for vegetables and to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase a sack of okra, a sack of cabbage, a sack of eggplant, and other vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
This is 45-year-old Hawa.  She is married, with three children, ages 7, 12, and 22 years. She has three additional dependents, who live with her to help with the household chores.  

In 2007, Hawa established her provisions, drinks, toiletries, and textiles business. The business started to help her husband manage the family's affairs. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about SLL 2,051,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan of SLL 3,000,000.  Hawa requires a loan in order to expand her stock and increase her sales. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by some SLL 250,000. 

In the future, Hawa plans to improve on the business and expand to trading in imported rice. She thinks the loan can improve the stock and maximize the profit.  

She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for more provisions, drinks, toiletries, and textiles to sell.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Delia is 46 years old and lives in Gango, Ozamiz City. She is widow, with three adult children.

Delia has running an Internet cafe business and earns approximately PHP 10,000 each month doing this type of business. She has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase additional equipment for her Internet cafe.

Delia has been a member of PMPC for five years.   In the future, Delia hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional equipment for her Internet cafe

loans.name: Bozor

texts.ru: Бозор трудолюбивый человек, он женат и на воспитании имеет двоих детей. Дети еще маленькие. Для обеспечении семьи со всеми не обходимыми средствами,он начал свой бизнес выращиванием сельхоз продуктов. В основном он выращивает ячмень и картофель на площади 1,7 га земли  уже более 12-и лет. Его заботливая жена, Курбаной помогает ему в ведении бизнеса. Полученный урожай он  продает местным жителям и реализует на рынках в соседних городах.  Он хочет развивать свой бизнес, но не имеет достаточного средства и поэтому он запрашивает кредит на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки семена и скота. Дополнительный доход от скотоводства поможет ему улучшить уровень жизни. Давайте вместе поможем этому доброму человеку!
texts.en:
Bozor is a hard working man. He is married and raising two children. The children are still young. To provide his family with all necessary means, he started his business of growing agricultural products. For more than 12 years, he has mainly been growing barley and potatoes in an area of 1.7 hectares. His caring wife, Kurbanoj, helps him in running the business. He sells the resulting crop to the local inhabitants and at markets in the neighboring towns. 

Bozor would like to expand his business, but does not have sufficient means. Therefore he requests a loan in the amount of 5,000 somoni for the purchase of seeds and cattle. The additional income from livestock breeding helps him improve their living standards. 

Let's help this good man!

loans.use: to purchase seeds and cattle

loans.name: Sang De Jesus 1 Group

texts.fr: SANG DE JESUS 1 est un groupe de deux personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Irène Assiba (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 34 ans et est mariée à un magasinier du nom de Magloire. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Irène Assiba a arrêté l'école au niveau secondaire. Irène Assiba vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari, les différentes charges de la maison. Depuis une dizaine d'année, Irène Assiba vend des fournitures scolaires, divers produits et du charbon de bois de façon secondaire à son domicile. Irène Assiba s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. C’est la troisième fois que Irène Assiba et les autres membres du groupe SANG DE JESUS 1 sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Les deux premiers crédits ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
SANG DE JESUS 1 is a group  of two persons whose members reside in the same district. The group's representative, Irène Assiba (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 34 years old and married to a warehouse keeper named Magloire. The couple have three children, not all in school but all in their care. She dropped out of secondary school. She lives together with her children and husband and, along with him, ensures that the different household expenses are covered. 

For about ten years, Irène Assiba has been selling school supplies and various products, and charcoal secondarily, out of her home. She gets her supplies  from a market in Benin. 

This is the third time that Irène Assiba and the other members of the group SANG DE JESUS 1 have requested financial support from ALIDé with the aim of bolstering their working capital and their business and responding better to the requirements of their customers. The first two loans were indeed repaid.

loans.use: to purchase school supplies and charcoal to sell from home

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Doña Alicia, tiene 60 años de edad, soltera, tiene tres hijos mayores de edad, vive en el municipio de Tela, Atlántida.
Hace 4 años que doña Alicia se dedica a vender mercadería por medio de catalogo, por pedidos y entrega a domicilio. Ella vende cortinas, sabanas, toallas, cortinas de baño, alfombras, almohadas etc. el préstamo que ha solicitado es para comprar más productos para surtir el negocio y cumplir con los pedidos hechos. Este préstamo le ayudara a capitalizarse y continuar trabajando. Su meta es hacer crecer el negocio para lograr construir su vivienda y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Alicia is 60 years old. She is single, has three adult children, and lives in the municipality of Tela, in Atlántida department.

Alicia has been selling catalog merchandise for four years, through orders and home delivery. She sells sheets, curtains, bath curtains, towels, rugs, pillows, etc.  

The loan she has applied for is to buy more products for supplying her business and filling orders placed with her. This loan will help her to capitalize herself and continue working. Her goal is to make her business grow, so that she can manage to build her house and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: To buy sheets, curtains, bath curtains, towels, rugs, pillows, etc. for supplying her business.

loans.name: Jevalyn

texts.en:
Jevalyn is 28 years old and lives in Gotocan Daku, Ozamiz City.  She is married, with one son. 

Jevalyn has a store that sells a variety of products.  Jevalyn has had this business for two years.

Jevalyn requested a loan of PHP 10,000  to purchase additional products, such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, and firewood.

Jevalyn has been a member of PMPC for one year.  In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products, such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, and firewood.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is from Poblacion, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old and married, with four children. 

To make a living, Eva operates a business weaving and selling nipa (palm).  She has had this business for five years and earns PHP 2,000 a month. 
 
In 2008, Eva joined GDMPC.   She is requesting a loan of PHP 2,000 that will be used to purchase more nipa leaves to weave in order to expand her product offerings. 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase more raw materials, nipa leaves, to weave.

loans.name: Laura Elizabeth

texts.es: Laura continúa con la tienda de víveres la cual abrió hace 9 años, está ubicada en Bastión Popular sector del norte de Guayaquil. Cuando inicio su negocio su barrio estaba en pleno crecimiento por lo que tiene clientes que los conoce de mucho tiempo. Ella inicio su tienda para ayudar a su esposo cuando recién se casaron ya que tenían muchos planes de futuros los cuales poco a poco se han ido materializando. El negocio lo atiende sola desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche todos los días, vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, colas, víveres, etc., productos que desea aumentar con el crédito que está solicitando. A futuro su sueño es arreglar su casa ya que no está enlucida en su totalidad.
texts.en: Laura has operated a corner grocery in Bastion Popular, a northern neighborhood of Guayaquil, for 9 years.  The neighborhood was just developing when she started the business and she has known many of her customers for all the years since then.  She started the business after she married because she and her husband had big plans for the future and she wanted to do her part to carry them out.  Laura works every day from 6:00 in the morning until 10:00 at night.  She sells everyday products--rice, sugar, cold drinks, etc.--and she is applying for a loan that she will use to stock her business.  For the future, she wants to improve her house, plastering the parts of the house that haven't been plastered.

loans.use: to stock her grocery business.

loans.name: Yom's Group

texts.en:
Yom is 58 years old, and she has seven children, living in a rural village of Ou Reang Ov district, Kampong Cham province. Of her seven children, she still has one son who is dependent on her and helps the family’s business. 

She has been a rice farmer on one hectare of farmland for 30 years.   The current business earns her about 20,000 KHR per day.   She is challenged by drought, which lowers her yields.

This is the first loan for Yom’s group, consisting of four members, with VisionFund (Kiva partner). For this new loan, Yom is requesting 400,000 KHR, while her three fellow group members are seeking 1,000,000 KHR each.

As the leader, Yom will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and some of it to pay labor costs. She hopes this loan will help her to earn more income from the current business so as to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Suyatnik

texts.en:
