Suyatnik is a 42-year-old fishmonger; she has been running the business for years. She sells cob fish at the traditional market. 

Suyatnik is living with her husband, Muh Yappi, who is 50 years old, and four children, who are all attending school. She usually works from 6 a.m. to 3 p.m. 

At the moment, Suyatnik can only sell one kind of fish. She dreams of purchasing and selling eggs and various fish; unfortunately, she does not have enough capital to improve her business as she dreamed. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of 7,500,000 Indonesian rupiah (IDR) from TLM. She would like to use the loan to purchase more kinds of fish, such as yellow fin tuna, tuna, bonito, etc., as well as to buy eggs.

loans.use: to purchase more kinds of fish, such as yellow fin tuna, tuna, bonito, etc., as well as to buy eggs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cosmetics, creams, deodorants, shampoo, lotions, etc. (Avon products) to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to complete her kiosk business inventory with other stock, i.e. shampoo, cooking ingredients, bath soap, biscuits, snacks, etc.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is widowed with one child. Lilia is 65 years old and lives in Lutao, Panaon, Misamis Occidental.

Lilia sells dried fish to earn a living and has had this business for four years. She has requested a loan of 14,900 Philippines pesos to be used in purchasing additional dried fish to sell.

Lilia has been a member of PMPC for eight years. In the future, Lilia hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Cruz

texts.es: Cruz de cuarenta y cuatro años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida, sus hijos y su madre, ella se dedica a la venta de tostadas, yuca, plátano, entre otros, tiene varios años de tener el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, tiene mucha clientela pues las personas lo prefieren porque su producto es de primera calidad y a precios accesibles además de un buen servicio; Cruz es una mujer enérgica, trabajadora y soñadora siempre esta a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades que le permitan obtener el éxito, aunque sabe que desde ya es una triunfadora porque sigue el camino correcto; como toda buena comerciante quiere acrecentar su negocio para así aumentar sus ganancias pero no posee de suficiente capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar tostadas por mayor, Cruz tiene buenas referencias de pago, asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda y a la vez ofrece darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Cruz, age 44, lives with her life partner, their children, and her mother.  Cruz sells tostadas, yucca, and bananas, among others.  She has had her business for several years.  This has gifted her with a lot of experience that allows her to get better income and to have a lot of customers.  People prefer her because her product is first quality, the prices are accessible, and she provides good service.

Cruz is an energetic and hard-working.person, and she is a dreamer.  She is always anticipating new opportunities that allow her to be successful.   She knows that she is now a winner because she continues on the right path to success.

Like all good merchants, she wants to increase her business in order to increase her income.  However, she does not have enough capital.  That is why she is requesting a loan from Integral to buy tostadas wholesale.  Cruz has good payment references.  She is certain that she will be able to repay the loan and also give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy tostadas wholesale.

loans.name: Genaro

texts.es:
El señor Genaro desea ampliar su casa para mejorar el espacio que necesitan sus dos hijas. 
Solicitas el préstamo para empezar la construcción de un cuarto al frente de su vivienda ya que necesita construir un cuarto para acondicionarlo como estudio y que sus hijas tengan su propio espacio para poder estudiar y puedan ser unas excelentes estudiantes.
El señor Genaro es el gerente de una compañía desde hace ya más diez años, y su esposa la señora Socorro se dedica a la atención y cuidado de sus hijas, con este ingreso planea pagar el crédito.
Desea la seguridad y el patrimonio de sus familia este en las mejores condiciones. 
El señor Genaro anterior mente a tenido créditos con KIVA los cuales han sido para mejorar su vivienda, espera contar con su cooperación en este crédito ya que sea utilizado para mejora la casa de su familia.
texts.en:
Genaro wants to add on to his house to improve the space that his two daughters need.  He is requesting the loan to begin construction of a room in the front of his house since he needs to to build a room and make it ready as a study so that his daughters can have their own space to study and to be excellent students.  

Genaro is the director of a company for more than ten years and his wife Socorro works caring for their daughters.  With this income he plans to repay the loan.  He hopes for security and a good legacy for his family.

Genaro has previously had loans with Kiva that he has used to improve his house.  He hopes for Kiva's cooperation in this loan since it will be used to improve his family's house.

loans.use: to begin construction of a room in front of his house.

loans.name: Nubia Jeaneth

texts.es: Nubia Jeaneth de veintiséis años de edad vive junto a su familia en casa propia, ella posee una librería donde vende cuadernos, libros, lápices, cromos, calcomanías, entre otros, tiene varios años con el negocio y se ha hecho de mucha clientela que la prefieren porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan, a precios accesibles y además con un excelente servicio; Nubia es una mujer dedicada a su labor, emprendedora, luchadora y dispuesta a lograr cada uno de sus sueños, pero antes de todo primero esta su familia que es lo mas importante para ella, trabaja duro todo el día para poder en las noches convivir con su familia en la comodidad de su hogar pero su casa ha tenido algunos desperfectos necesita cambio de techo y piso y desea repararlos para seguridad de todos,  no posee de suficiente de capital para las reparaciones por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar tejas, piso, sementó, polines, etc. Nubia Jeaneth tiene excelentes referencias de pago y es muy responsable, asegura que con las ganancias de su negocio podrá cancelar la deuda y a la vez llevar seguridad económica para su hogar.
texts.en: Nubia Jeaneth, 26, lives with her family in a house that she owns.  She operates a book and paper supply business.  She sells books, notebooks, pencils, stickers, decals and general paper supplies.  She has operated the business for several years and says that it is a success because her customers know that they can get what they need from her at a reasonable price.  Nubia is a hard-working woman, enterprising and determined to fulfill her dreams.  Her family takes precedent, though, and she makes sure that she is home in the evenings to spend time with them.  She is applying for a loan to improve her house.  She has to replace the roof and make other repairs that will make the house safer.  She doesn't have the funds to carry out the work so she is applying to INTEGRAL for a loan that she will use to buy construction materials--tiles, flooring, cement, etc.--for the project.  Nubia Jeaneth is very responsible and has excellent references.  She is confident that her income from her book and paper supply business are enough to both provide for her family and repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for house improvements.

loans.name: Agricultores De Capellania Xiv Group

texts.es:
El señor Antonio Romulo Fermin esta casado tiene 24 años de edad, cursó los 6 años de educacion primaria, tiene un hijos, se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de papas, inicio este negocio sembrando en el terreno de su padre, hasta el momento lleva 6 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicitan un préstamo que lo utilizaran para la compra de insumos necesarios para el  cultivo: Semillas, abonos orgánico, y mano de obra para los trabajadores que tiene, espera adquirir mas terreno para siembre de mas papas y genera mas ganancias, los demás integrantes se d3edican a la siembra de papas y habas.
texts.en:
Antonio Romulo Fermin is 24 years old, married, and has children.  He went to elementary school for six years.

He is a farmer, and he grows potatoes.  He started this business planting on his father’s land.  He has six years of experience so far.
He organized a group, and they a requesting a loan that they will use to buy the supplies they need for farming.  They will buy seeds and organic fertilizers, and they will pay the workers they have for their labor.  

He hopes to get more land to plant potatoes and generate more income.  The other members grow potatoes and beans.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies like seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Maria De La Luz

texts.es: La Sra. Maria de la Luz de 68 años de edad es viuda, además de estar pensionada ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda mano. Ella ha logrado salir adelante a pesar de que fue hace poco que perdió a su marido. Maria no tiene dependientes económicos puesto que todos sus hijos ya están casados, nunca se ha dado por vencida y le gusta luchar por siempre estar mejor. En esta ocasión Maria solicita de nuestra ayuda para terminar de colocar el techo de su recamara, ya que quiere darse una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria de la Luz is 68 years old. She is a widow. 

Although retired she works selling second hand clothes. She has managed to get ahead despite losing her husband recently. 

Maria does not have anyone financially dependent on her because all her children are married. She has never given up and she likes the battle of always improving. 

At this time Maria is asking for help in order to finish putting in her bedroom ceiling as she wants to give herself a higher quality of life.

loans.use: to finish putting in her bedroom ceiling

loans.name: Altinbek

texts.en:
Mr. Altinbek lives with a wife and four childeren in a small house in Bayan-Olgy province. He is 52 years old, and he was drawing-master in the secondary school from 1980 to 2003. Then, with his friend, he began buying livestock in 2005. They sell it in the center of the province and Ulaanbaatar city. The working capital is 1,000,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT). 

Now, he starting his own painting business, because his major is painting. Also, he plants organic vegetables such as potatoes, cabbages, tomatoes, cucumbers, etc., in his own greenhouse, which is located within his property fence. He will paint illustrations by order. Now, Mr. Altinbek is requesting 1,500,000 MNT to purchase painting materials for his new business. He is a public and reticent man.

loans.use: To purchase painting materials for his new business of painting illustrations to order.

loans.name: Passyam Group

texts.fr:
Mme SABINE représente le groupe PASS YAM. Mariée, elle est mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 10ans et le moins âgé a 04ans. 02vont à l’école et elle a 04 personnes en charge.

Mme est restauratrice depuis 04ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché deToecin. Ses clients sont les hommes et les femmes.

Elle veut s’acheter 10litres d’huile, 02sacs de rig, 01boite de nescafé et 05boites de lait.

Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut agrandir son activité. Mme ambitionne s’acheter une moto et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ms. SABINE represents the group PASS YAM. She is married and the mother of four children. The oldest is 10 years old, and the youngest is 4. Two go to school. She has 4 persons to support.

Ms. SABINE has been a restauranteur for four years. She gets her supplies from the Toecin market. Her customers include men and women.

She wants to purchase 10 liters of oil, 2 sacks of   rice, a box of Nescafé, and 5 boxes of milk.

With the profits, she wants to expand her business. Her ambition is to purchase a motorbike and to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase 10 liters of oil, 2 sacks of rice, a box of Nescafé, and 5 box of milk for her restaurant

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is married with three children. She is 62 years old and lives in Lutao, Panaon, Misamis Occidental.

Cecilia sells dried fish to earn a living and has had this business for four years. She has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to be used in purchasing additional dried fish for sale.

Cecilia has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, she hopes to engage in another type of business.

loans.use: To be used in purchasing additional dried fish for sale

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is widowed with children. She is 48 years old and lives in Upper Centro, Tudela.

Imelda is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. Imelda has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase additional feed. 

Imelda has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, she hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed

loans.name: Mahule Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHULE est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Élisée est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Élisée est âgée de 30 ans et ne vit plus avec son mari. Élisée a un enfant qui est scolarisé et qui vit avec elle. Élisée assure les diverses charges de son enfant. Pour faire face à ses diverses charges, Élisée vend de la bouillie (faite à base de maïs) et des boissons locales de façon secondaire à son domicile. Cette activité lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins. Élisée s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Élisée sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHULE, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt leur permettra de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu. Le premier crédit a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The group MAHULE comprises three persons who reside in the same district. The group's representative, Élisée, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. She is 30 years old and lives with her husband. She has one child, who is in school and living with her, and she ensures that the diverse expenses are covered for her child.

To cope with her diverse expenses, Élisée has been selling porridge (made with corn), and local beverages secondarily, out of her home. This business enables her to meet her needs without much problem. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin.

Seeking to satisfy her customers and to increase her sales and revenues, Élisée is requesting, along with the other members of the group MAHULE, a second loan from ALIDé. This loan will enable them to raise the level of their business and to grow their customer base and their income. The first loan was indeed repaid.

loans.use: to purchase corn and local beverages

loans.name: Bartolo Teodoro

texts.es: Bartolo tiene 54 años y se dedica a la elaboración de ladrillos en su natal Libertad, empezó desde joven ya que quería probar suerte en una actividad en la que se invierta poco y gane mucho, lamentablemente este tipo de oficio es muy pesado, se gana pero también se trabaja. Realiza solo el trabajo desde muy temprano hasta el medio día en el que toma un descanso, prefiere así porque el sol es fuerte y se cansa más rápido, pasa en la cantera 5 días a la semana sin interrupciones. El trabajo que realiza Bartolo es pesado pero su aliciente diario son sus 5 hijos a quienes le gustaría dar un futuro estable, es viudo por lo que su responsabilidad está con ellos. Con el préstamo que solicita espera comprar aserrín, leña y agua, para la elaboración de los ladrillos. Le gustaría en un futuro formar un gremio con sus compañeros para mejorar sus condiciones de trabajo.
texts.en: Bartolo is 54 years old. He makes bricks in his hometown of Libertad. He started at a young age and wants to try his luck in a business where he invests a little and earns a lot. Unfortunately this kind of trade is very difficult. He only works from very early in the day until midday when he then takes a rest. He prefers this way because the sun is strong and he tires very quickly. He spends five days a week in the quarry without interruptions. Bartolo’s work is difficult but his incentive is his five children who he would like to give a stable future. He is a widower, so they are his responsibility. With this loan he is requesting, he hopes to purchase sawdust, wood and water for the production of bricks. In the future, he would like to form a guild with his workmates in order to improve their work conditions.

loans.use: purchase sawdust, wood and water.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es: La Sra. Verónica de 27 años de edad es casada y tiene dos hijos que aun dependen económicamente de ella. Su esposo se dedica a conducir un taxi el cual es propiedad de Verónica. Ella se dedica a la venta de comida y tiene un negocio por ahora lo tiene ubicado en el domicilio de su mama ya que el terreno de su casa no está parejo es por eso que está solicitando de nuestra  ayuda para emparejar el terreno de su casa ya que quiere reubicar su negocio en su domicilio. Verónica agradecerá la ayuda que se pueda brindar.
texts.en:
Verónica is 27 years old. She is married and has 2 children who still depend on her financially. Her husband drives a taxi which Verónica owns. 

She works selling food and she has a business which for now she has located in her mother’s home because the yard around her home is not level and this is why she is asking for help as she wants to level out her yard and relocate her business to her own home. 

Verónica appreciates the help you are able to give.

loans.use: to level out the yard around her house so she can relocate her business selling food to her own home

loans.name: Tito

texts.es:
Tito tiene 29 años, convive con su pareja hace muchos años y junto a ella tiene dos pequeños hijos de 6 y 3 años. Vive con toda su familia en la casa que ha logrado construir como resultado de su trabajo constante donde también habitan sus padres.
Él se dedica a la venta de artículos de papel y otros productos de plásticos descartables, como servilletas, platos, cucharas, tenedores, etc. Tiene un puesto que alquila en uno de los principales mercados más concurridos de la ciudad. Lleva en este negocio más de 12 años y trabaja siempre solo. Considera que es una actividad muy rentable por la facilidad con la que los clientes llegan hasta su puesto y lo que más les gusta es que puede generar los ingresos para su familia muy cómodamente y sin descuidar a su hijos.

Este es su segundo préstamo individual que tiene con MFP, es por eso que agradece a todas las personas que hacen posible su financiamiento y confían en él. Además está muy contento con el asesor que tiene y espera continuar trabajando de la mano con la institución. 
Con el préstamo solicitado, de 3000 soles, comprará más mercadería conformada por paquetes de papel higiénico, servilletas, bolsas y platos descartables.
texts.en:
Tito, age 29, has lived with his life partner for many years.  They have two small children, ages six and three.  He lives with his family in the house he managed to build as a result of his constant work.  His parents also live there.

He sells disposable paper and plastic products like napkins, spoons, and forks, etc.  He has a stand that he rents in one of the main markets, which is the busiest in the city.  He has been in this business for over 12 years, and he always works alone.  He considers this business activity to be very profitable because of the ease with which his customers arrive at his stand.  What he likes the most is that he is able to very comfortably generate income for his family without neglecting his children.

This is his second individual loan with MFP.  He is grateful to all of the people who make his loan possible and trust in him.  Also, he is very happy with the advisor that he has, and he hopes to continue working hand in hand with the institution.

He will use the requested 3,000 soles to buy more merchandise like packages of toilet paper, napkins, bags, and disposable plates.

loans.use: to buy more plastic items in order to continue selling.

loans.name: Yamileth Del Carmen

texts.es:
Yamilet tiene 29 años de edad, tiene tres hijos varones se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas en la calle principal de la ciudad  en la acera la alcaldía municipal la cual le proporciono un puesto para que ella pueda vender sus tortillas en horarios de 6.00 a.m. a 2.00 p.m.  
Los fines de semana en su casa de habitación tiene el negocio de venta de pupusas y también una mini tienda es una señora muy luchadora de muy buenos principios. Emprendedora.
Antes de dedicarse ha este negocio estaba estudiando.

La materia prima para la elaboración de las tortillas y las pupusas las compra en una comercial de granos básicos en la misma ciudad a unas cuatro cuadras de donde ella tiene. Para la venta de las tortillas otro producto muy importante de mencionar  es el gas que ella utiliza para el cocimiento de sus productos este lo compra a los distribuidores de gas, ellos se encargan de llevarselo a su negocio. 

El financiamiento será invertido en la compra de 6 quintales de maíz, 9 chimbos de gas   (pagara el depósito para que solo se lo llegar a dejar), nn silo para el almacenamiento del maíz. Toda esta materia prima que comprara será para la producción de tortillas de un mes.
En cambio para la elaboración de las pupusas sera para el fin de semana 4 libras de chicharon, 4 libras de quesillo. Etc.

Al comprar  toda esta materia prima podrá producir las tortillas para un mes completo (también en el tiempo de escases de maíz) como comprara un granero podrá almacenar maíz. Estas serán las necesidades que serán satisfechas con el préstamo.

Con la compra de estos productos se incrementaran los inventarios por ende los  niveles de venta ya que la demanda es bastante fuerte y se podrá tener mayores volúmenes de productos terminados para la comercialización.
  
ella desea comprar un lote (terreno) ya que donde ella vive es alquilado;  según sea la venta y las ganancias de las tortillas. Posteriormente quiere comenzar a construir una pequeña vivienda para ellas y sus hijos.
texts.en:
Yamilet, 29, is the mother of three sons.  She operates a food business, making and selling tortillas and pupusas.  She operates the business from a spot on the city's main street.  During the week, she works from 6:00 in the morning until 2:00 in the afternoon.  On weekends, she operates a corner grocery from a space in her house.  She is a woman of strong principles, enterprising and hard-working.

She buys the basic ingredients that she needs to make tortillas and pupusas at a market just four blocks from her business.  In addition to the basic ingredients she needs to make the food she sells, she needs gas canisters for firing her oven, gas that she buys from a local distributor who can deliver the canisters to her.  

Yamilet will use part of this loan to cover the costs of making tortillas for one month: 6 quintales--300 kilos?--of maize, (the required deposit for) 9 gas canisters and a "silo" for storing the maize.  She will use the rest to cover the costs of making pupusas: 4 pounds of crackling, 4 pounds of cheese, etc.

The investment, then, will pay for everything she needs to make tortillas for one month (even during times when maize is hard to find) and a "granero" (not sure, but some kind of appropriate space for storing maize).

Yamilet says that the investment will allow her to increase her output and meet the strong demand for her products.
  
Yamilet rents a house now and says that she wants to buy a lot where she can build a house one day.  The business is her means for earning enough money to make that happen.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her food business.

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
Luz María tiene 50 años y desde hace 18 años viene desempeñando una gran labor social que es la atención de un centro de cuidado infantil donde atiende a aproximadamente 80 niños y les brinda un buen cuidado y una buena educación mientras sus padres, la gran mayoría con muy pocos recursos económicos, se encuentran en sus trabajos. Desde que montó su c centro de cuidado infantil ha logrado crecer mucho y esto le ha permitido atender cada vez a un mayor número de niños, lo que permite brindar a su sociedad una muy buena calidad de vida. Gracias a la gran cantidad de niños que atiende, su hija de 20 años le colabora para que su centro de cuidado infantil pueda ofrecer la mayor calidad de educación posible. A pesar de que cuida una gran cantidad de niños, Luz María realiza una labor casi social con los habitantes del sector, por lo que no cuenta con un gran capital disponible; es por esto que busca un préstamo para reparar el techo de su centro de cuidado infantil.

Su sueño es que este hogar crezca y les permita salir adelante a estos niños que provienen de familias tan golpeadas por grandes dificultades. Además espera mejorar poco a poco para que cada vez los niños se sientan más a gusto allí.
texts.en:
Luz Maria is 50 years old and has been performing a great social work for 18 years: operating a child care center where she cares for approximately 80 children. She gives them good care and a good education while their parents, the majority of whom have few economic resources, are at work. Since she started her child care center, it has grown a lot and this has allowed her to attend to more and more children. It allows her to provide society with a good quality of life. Because of the large number of children who attend, her 20-year-old daughter works with her so that her child care center can offer the highest-quality education possible. Despite the fact that she looks after a large number of children, Luz Maria performs a kind of community assistance with the area residents, so she doesn't have a lot of capital available. This is why she is looking for a loan to repair the roof of her child care center.

Her dream is that this home grows and allows these children to move forward, given that they come from families affected by great difficulties. She also hope to improve bit by bit so that bit by bit the children feel more comfortable there.

loans.use: to repair the roof of her child care center.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 53 years old and lives in Corrales, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with four children. 

Elizabeth has a general store where she sells consumable products. She has had this business for 29 years. She has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to be used in purchasing stock for her store, such as shampoo, toothpaste, beverages and other consumable products.

Elizabeth has been a member of PMPC for 8 years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Nerie

texts.en:
Nerie is married with one child. She is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. 

Nerie is a farmer and she also manages a copra (dried coconut) producing business to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years, and every month she earns 3,000 PHP from this work. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer. 

Nerie been a member of GDMPC since 2005. In the future, Nerie hopes to help her child finish their education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Abake Group

texts.fr: Le groupe ABAKE est composé de trois personnes qui vivent dans la même maison au Bénin. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Laurinda est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Laurinda est âgée de 27 ans et est mariée à un certain Dine. Le couple a un enfant, scolarisé, et à leur charge. Laurinda a peu fréquenté l’école. Laurinda vit ensemble avec son mari et son enfant. Le couple assure ensemble les divers besoins du ménage. Pour assurer ses différentes charges, Laurinda mène comme activité la vente des plateaux d’oeufs à son domicile. Laurinda exerce cette activité depuis cinq ans. Laurinda s’approvisionne dans sa région. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Laurinda sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe ABAKE, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt leur servira à rehausser le stock de ses produits et à augmenter leur clientèle.
texts.en:
The group ABAKE comprises three persons who live in the same house in Benin. This is the first time this group has requested financial aid from ALIDé to raise the level of their work. The group's representative, Laurinda, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. She is 27 years old and married to a man named Dine. The couple have one child in school and in their care. She has had little schooling. She lives together with her husband and child. The couple jointly ensure that the diverse household needs are met. 

To cover her different expenses, Laurinda has a business selling trays of eggs from home. She has been in this business for five years. She gets her supplies from her region.

Seeking to satisfy her customers and to increase her sales and revenues, Laurinda is requesting, along with the other members of the group ABAKE, an initial loan from ALIDé. This loan will be used to boost her stock of products and to grow her customer base.

loans.use: to purchase trays of eggs to sell from home

loans.name: Leydi Crystal

texts.es:
La señora Leydi solicita un crédito para los gastos escolares de sus dos hijos que empezaran el siclo escolar. Les esta haciendo falta los uniformes y útiles escolares, comprende que la educación es lo mas importante para que sus hijos puedan triunfar en la vida.
La señora Leydi y su esposo trabajan en una maquiladora desde has ya mas de ocho años, siendo este el ingreso y con el cual planean pagar el crédito.
Desean que sus hijos tengan la educación necesaria, ya que es lo que les puede ofrecer para que tengan una vida mejor en el futuro.
texts.en:
Sra. Leydi is applying for a loan that she will use to pay her children's school expenses.  The new school year is about to start and her two children need uniforms, school supplies, etc.  She knows that a good education is key to getting ahead in life.
Sra. Leydi and her husband have worked at local factories for more than eight years.  They will repay the loan with income from their jobs.  
They want their children to have a good education because providing one is how they can best ensure that their childen have bright futures.

loans.use: to pay her children's school expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies in order to deliver his orders with good quality products

loans.name: Huathan

texts.en:
Mr. Huathan is 55 years old. He lives with his wife and youngest son in a small house in the western province of Mongolia. His wife is unemployed and stays at home. His youngest son helps in his father's business. 

Mr. Huathan manages two kinds of business. First, he exports ready-made clothes to Kazakstan. The working capital of the business is 3,000,000 MNT. He conducts only the financial management of this business; his son manages sales. For the second business, he has been planting organic vegetables since this year. He successfully plants organic cucumbers and organic tomatoes in a greenhouse. Now he wants to improve his planting by expanding his fields. 

He requests a 5,000,000 MNT loan. With 3,000,000 MNT he will buy a new field. With the rest of the loan he will purchase more clothes. Mr Huathan is a very sensitive businessman. He says, "I am happy to my son is starting to manage the business now that he is becoming an adult."

loans.use: To buy a new field and to purchase more clothes

loans.name: Missimahu Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MISSIMAHU est composé de trois personnes qui vivent dans la même maison au Bénin. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Emilienne est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Emilienne est âgée de 37 ans et est mariée à un menuisier du nom de Calixte. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains scolarisés, et dont restent à leur charge. Emilienne n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Emilienne vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les divers besoins du ménage. Pour assurer ses différentes charges, Emilienne mène comme activité la vente des jus de citron et de bouillie à son domicile. Emilienne exerce cette activité depuis une dizaine d’années. Emilienne s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Emilienne sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MISSIMAHU, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt leur servira à rehausser le stock de ses produits et à augmenter leur clientèle
texts.en:
The group MISSIMAHU comprises three persons who live in the same house in Benin. This is the first time this group has requested financial aid from ALIDé to raise the level of their work. The group's representative, Emilienne, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. She is 37 years old and married to a furniture maker named Calixte. The couple have four children, not all in school but all remain in their care. She did not attend school. She lives together with her husband and children. The couple jointly ensure that the diverse household needs are met. 

To cover her different expenses, Emilienne has a business selling lime juice and porridge out of her home. She has been in this business for about ten years. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin.

Seeking to satisfy her customers and to increase her sales and revenues, Emilienne is requesting, along with the other members of the group MISSIMAHU, an initial loan from ALIDé. This loan will be used to boost her stock of products and to grow her customer base.

loans.use: to purchase lime juice, sugar, and corn

loans.name: Dieu Peut Tout Group

texts.fr: Le groupe DIEU PEUT TOUT est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans la même agglomération et exercent des activités génératrices de revenus. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Rollande Akuevi est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Rollande Akuevi est mariée à un maçon du nom de Bienvenu et est mère de deux enfants. Parmi les deux enfants, un est scolarisé. Tous les deux enfants vivent avec leurs parents. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges du ménage. Rollande Akuevi n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Il y a huit ans environs que Rollande Akuevi mène comme activité la vente de nourriture (pâte de maïs fermenté accompagné de sauce) de façon ambulante. Rollande Akuevi s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. La demande de sa clientèle devient de plus en plus grande et compte tenu de ses moyens limités, Rollande Akuevi n'arrive plus à bien répondre à leurs exigences. Eu égard à cela et compte tenu de leurs ressources limitées, Rollande Akuevi et les autres membres du groupe DIEU PEUT TOUT sollicitent ensemble un  deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The group DIEU PEUT TOUT comprises three persons who reside in the same 'agglomération' and who have revenue-generating businesses. The group's representative, Rollande Akuevi, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. This is the second time this group has requested financial support from ALIDé with the aim of raising the level of their business. 

Rollande Akuevi is married to a mason named Bienvenu and is the mother of two children, of whom one is in school. Both live with their parents. The couple jointly ensure that the diverse household expenses are covered.

Rollande Akuevi did not attend school. For about eight years, she has had a business selling food (fermented polenta served with sauce) from door to door. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. 

Customer demand is larger and larger, and given her limited means, Rollande Akuevi can no longer respond well to their requirements. In this regard and due to their limited resources, Rollande Akuevi and the other members of the group DIEU PEUT TOUT are requesting a second loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to purchase corn and condiments

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies like zippers, thread, plastic, and leather, among other things and to fill the large orders that she has.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing like pajamas, blouses, and jeans, among others, and to respond to a large order that she has from a customer.

loans.name: Yury Fernanda

texts.es:
Yury se encuentra casada y tiene un hijo de 7 años de edad, y debido a que los ingresos que generaba su esposo no eran suficientes para poder sostener los gastos de su hogar, decidió comenzar a generar ingresos para su hogar para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Fue buscando oportunidades de generar ingresos que se encontró con un distribuidor de productos de panadería que le enseñó la actividad y ahora ella tiene su propio negocio de distribución de dulces y galletería. Gracias a este negocio, ahora su hijo puede acceder a una educación de buena calidad y las dificultades económicas en su hogar se han venido superando poco a poco. Hace ya 3 años que tiene su negocio y gracias al esfuerzo que hace diariamente ha logrado crecer considerablemente, tanto que ahora tiene la oportunidad de distribuir sus productos hacia diferentes municipios, y esto le da la oportunidad de mejorar las condiciones económicas en su hogar. Debido a que su negocio ha crecido tanto, Yury ahora requiere de una estantería para ubicar sus productos, pero como no cuenta con el capital suficiente para esto, busca un préstamo que le permita comprar una estantería y poder ubicar sus productos de manera más adecuada.

Su sueño es que su familia logre salir adelante y pueda superar todas las adversidades que se le han presentado en la vida.
texts.en:
Yury is married and has a seven-year-old son. Because the income her husband generated wasn't enough to support their household expenses, she decided to start to generate income for their household, in order to improve her family's quality of life. 

She started looking for opportunities to generate income, which she found with a distributor of bakery products who taught her the business. Now she has her own business distributing sweets and cookies. 

Thanks to this business, her son can now have access to good quality education, and the financial difficulties in her home have been overcome, little by little. 

She has had her business for three years now, and thanks to the effort she makes every day, has seen it grow considerably. It has grown so much that now she has the chance to distribute her products to various towns. This gives her the opportunity to improve the financial circumstances of her household.

Because her business has grown so much, Yury now needs shelves for her products, but as she doesn't have enough working capital for this, she is seeking a loan that will allow her to buy shelves so that she can store her products in a more organized way. 

Her dream is for her family to achieve success, and be able to overcome all the hardships that have arisen for them in life.

loans.use: To buy shelves so that she can store her products in a more organized way.

loans.name: Luisa Fernanda

texts.es:
Luisa Fernanda es una joven emprendedora que al ver que en su hogar tenían grandes dificultades económicas decidió busca una manera de generar ingresos para su hogar, pero ya que no encontraba oportunidades laborales donde emplearse y generar ingresos decidió comenzar a comercializar productos de uso personal. Fue así como con un pequeño préstamo de un amigo suyo consiguió el capital para surtir unas primeras unidades de perfumes y con las ganancias de estas ventas reinvirtió para aumentar su capital y así poco a poco fue creciendo su negocio. Actualmente cuenta con una gran cantidad de clientes que le permiten tener ventas con las que genera ingresos para contribuir económicamente en su hogar, y esto le ha permitido brindarles a sus padres la posibilidad de gozar de una mejor calidad de vida. Buscando seguir creciendo con su negocio, Luisa Fernanda busca un préstamo para comprar productos de uso personal y seguir satisfaciendo los pedidos de sus clientes.

Su mayor sueño es que este negocio le permita contribuir aún más para que en su hogar las condiciones económicas mejoren y así sus padres puedan salir de tantas dificultades que tienen. Además aspira a que esta fuente de ingresos le permita seguir pagando sus estudios y en un futuro pueda progresar económicamente.
texts.en:
Luisa Fernanda is a young entrepreneur, who upon seeing that there were great financial difficulties in her home, decided to look for a way to generate income for her household. But as she wasn't finding opportunities for employment and generating income, she decided to begin selling personal products. 

This was how, with a small loan from a friend of hers, she secured the the working capital to stock a first few units of perfume. With the earnings from these, she reinvested in order to increase her working capital. In this way her business began to grow little by little. 

Currently she has a great number of customers; which allows her to have sales, through which she generates income to contribute financially to her household. This has allowed her to offer her parents the opportunity to enjoy a better quality of life. 

Looking to have her business keep growing, Luisa Fernanda is seeking a loan to buy personal products and continue satisfying her customers' orders.

Her greatest dream is that this business will allow her to contribute even more; so that the financial circumstances in her home improve, and her parents can overcome the many difficulties they have. In addition, her intention is that this source of income will allow her to keep paying for her studies, and in  the future progress financially.

loans.use: To buy personal products and continue satisfying her customers' orders.

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.en:
Lorenzo is married with four children. Lorenzo is 37 years old and lives in Namnama, Titay, Zambonaga Sibugay.

Lorenzo is a rubber broker to earn a living. He has been doing this for five years. He has requested a loan of 50,000 Philippines pesos to purchase rubber for his business.

Lorenzo is a new member of PMPC. In the future, Lorenzo hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase rubber for his business.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is 52 years old and lives in Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with eight children.

Rosie works in the fish industry and sells/catches fish for a living. She has been doing this for 14 years. She has requested a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos to purchase more fish to sell.

Rosie has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Rosie hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

location.town: Liloy - Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Geogette

texts.en:
Geogette is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

NWTF is relisting Geogette's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anatalia

texts.en: Anatalia is 59 years old and married with six children. She is from Katipunan, Sinacaban. For 17 years, Anatalia has owned and operated a general store where she sells a variety of products to earn a living. Each month, she earns 10,000. Anatalia been a member of GDMPC since 2007. Anatalia is requesting a 30,000 loan to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee. In the future, she wants to improve her credit and support her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee

loans.name: Mamello

texts.en:
Mamello is applying for a loan to support her studies for a year at the Maharishi Institute. This is her story:

My name is Mamello, I am 21 years old and I am studying towards my Bachelor of Business Administration. My family consists of six members, including my daughter who is one year old. We live in Molapo, Soweto, and my mother is the only breadwinner in the family. I also live with my two cousins and my grandmother. 

Through getting a Kiva loan, I hope to realize my dreams of running my own business. I have a passion for marketing and communications, and I would love to open up my own public relations or consulting firm after graduation. I enjoy public speaking and reading motivational books and novels, and I also love exploring and traveling. I wish to be a role model for young girls, and give them an opportunity to liberate themselves and unleash their full potential.

video.title: Kiva Borrower Mamello from South Africa

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Hermenigilda

texts.en:
Hermenigilda is 54 years old and lives in Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with 9 children.
Hermenigilda works in the fish industry and sells/catches fish for living. She has been doing this for 30 years. She has requested a loan of 14900 to purchase more fish to sell.
Hermenigilda has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Hermenigilda hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

location.town: Liloy - Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Maria Lolita

texts.en:
Maria Lolita is married with 4 children. Maria Lolita is 40 years old and lives in Camul, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte.
Maria Lolita owns a general store to earn a living and had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns 4000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 7000 to purchase more stocks for her general store business such as shampoo, toothpaste and beverages.
Maria Lolita has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, Maria Lolita hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks for her general store business such as shampoo, toothpaste and beverages

loans.name: Manuela

texts.en:
Manuela is 59 years old and lives in Overview, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with 3 children.
To earn a living, Manuela has a business selling a variety of foods for snacks. She earns about 500 each month doing this type of work. Manuela has  requested a loan of 3000 to purchase more raw ingredients for her snack vending business.
Manuela has been a new member of PMPC. In the future, Manuela would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more raw ingredients for her snack vending business

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en: Francisca is 52 years old and lives in Dicoloc, Jimenez. She is married. Francisca has a snack vending business, she sells snacks, banana cue for a living. She's engaged in business for 3 years. She earns 3,300 each month from this work. She has requested a loan of 5,000 at GDMPC to purchase raw ingredients for snack preparation. Francisca is a new member of GDMPC. In the future, Francisca hopes to have more products to sell and have her own snack store.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for snack preparation.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is married with 1 child. Joy is 50 years old and lives in Mialen,Clarin.
Joy is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. Joy has been doing this for 5 years. Joy has requested a loan of 7000 to purchase additional feeds. 
Joy has been a member of PMPC for 6 mos. In the future, Joy hopes to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds fo her pigs

loans.name: Marita

texts.en:
Marita is 55 years old and lives in Dolores,Clarin. Marita is married with 5 children. 
Marita has a store that sells variety of products. Marita has had this business for 7 years. Marita requested a loan of 14900 to purchase additional products such as canned goods,noodles,beverages,detergents,etc.
Marita has been a member of PMPC for 7 years.  In the future, Marita hopes to save in case of emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods,noodles,beverages,detergents,etc.

loans.name: Ma.maida

texts.en:
Ma.Maida works hard to support her family. She is married and has a Fish Vending business in the Philippines.

Ma.Maida requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

She has been in this business for 4 years.

In the future, Ma.Maida would like to save enough to expand her business and renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 40 years old and married with 6 children.

Emma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell.

Emma has borrowed and paid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from food vending and tailoring.

Emma aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell at her general store.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda, a hardworking entrepreneur who has had a restaurant in the Philippines for five years, earns additional income from food vending. Erlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF, and is now requesting a loan of  PHP 10000 to buy additional ingredients for her restaurant. She dreams of saving money to expand her enterprise in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Portia

texts.en:
Portia is applying for a loan to support her studies for a year at the Maharishi Institute. This is her story:

My name is Portia and I am 21 years old. I am studying towards a Bachelor of Business Administration at The Maharishi Institute, and I am from a small township called Emzinoni in Bethal. 

My father, who was the sole breadwinner in our family, passed away two years ago. I now live with my mother and sister and I am the first person in my family to attend University. My sister has completed her high school certificate. However she cannot pursue further studies due to financial constraints. My hobbies are writing, reciting poems and watching current affairs and talk shows.
 
I plan to graduate in 2014 and my dream is to obtain a PhD in Economics, to pay tuition fees for children who come from poor backgrounds and to build a shelter for orphans in my hometown. A Kiva loan will help to ensure my education continues uninterrupted, allowing me to achieve my goals.

video.title: Kiva Borrower Portia from South Africa

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en: Felipa is married and a mother of 6 dependent children. She is 56 years old and lives in Sinara Bajo, Jimenez. Felipa makes and sells snack items for sell to earn a living and has had this business for 3 years. She earns 3,500 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 5,000 from GDMPC to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Felipa joined GDMPC last 2011. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make snacks for sale

loans.name: Nellie

texts.en:
Nellie is 63 years old and lives in Libertad Bajo,Sinacaban. Nellie is married with 4 children. 
Nellie has a store that sells variety of products. Nellie has had this business for 30 years. Nellie requested a loan of 14900 to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc. 
Nellie has been a member of PMPC for 6 years.  In the future, Nellie hopes to save in case of emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents,etc. to sell at her General Store.

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia is 70 years old and married with 5 children.

Cresencia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store.

Cresencia has borrowed and paid 23 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 19 years and also earns an income from gasoline retail.

Cresencia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Cristine

texts.en:
Cristine is 45 years old and married with 5 children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Cristine is borrowing PHP 22000 through NWTF to buy additional feeds for her pigs.

Cristine has been raising pigs for 20 years and also earns additional income from general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy additional feeds for her pigs

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester is 65 years old and lives in Poblacion, Sinacaban. Ester is widowed with 4 children. 
To earn a living, Ester has a business selling snacks in the community. Ester earns about PHP 1600 each month doing this type of work. Ester has requested a loan of 8000 to purchase additional ingredients such as flour, sugar, oil, etc.  
Ester has been a member of PMPC for 4 years.  In the future, Ester would like to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients such as flour, sugar, oil, etc. for her snack business.

loans.name: Dinna

texts.en:
Dinna is married with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Dinna is 37 years old and has 4 children who are in school.

Dinna has a fishing business in the Philippines. Dinna requested a PHP 14500 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish net and a battery for fishing.

Dinna has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, Dinna would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish net and a battery for fishing

loans.name: Charlita

texts.en:
Charlita is 69 years old and lives in San Vicente, Sinacaban. Charlita is widowed with 4 children. 
To earn a living, Charlita has a business selling snacks in the local community. Charlita earns about PHP 3000 each month doing this type of work. Charlita has requested a loan of 5000 to purchase additional ingredients such as flour, sugar, oil, etc.  
Charlita has been a member of PMPC for 9 mos.  In the future, Charlita would like to save in case of emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients such as flour, sugar, oil, etc. for her snack selling business.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma works hard to support her family. Elma is married and has a buying and selling of fish business in the Philippines.

Elma requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy fish to sell in her business.

Elma has been in this business for 3 years now.

In the future, Elma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell in her business

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 41 years old and married with 7 children.

Elsie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a selling of nipa (woven palm mats used for the repair and construction of houses) in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of nipa to sell.

Elsie has borrowed and paid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the selling of nipa (woven palm mats used for the repair and construction of houses) for 20 years and also earns an income from fish vending.

Elsie aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of nipa palm mats to sell for the construction and repair of houses

loans.name: Benie

texts.en:
Benie, 23 years old and married, resides in Sinara Bajo, Jimenez where he owns farmland, planting and harvesting bananas for sale to earn a living. In this business for five years, he earns about PHP 3,000 each month.

In 2011, Benie joined GDMPC and is now requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. In the future, Benie wants to make improvements to his house and the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 66 years old and lives in Silongon, Tudela. Lolita is married with four children. 

Lolita has a general store that sells a variety of products. Lolita has had this business for 40 years. Lolita requested a loan of 14,900 Philippines pesos to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.
 
Lolita has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Lolita hopes to save money in case of emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is married with four children. Lydia is 64 years old and lives in Gango, Ozamiz City. Lydia sells house decor like flowers, maps, rags, etc., to earn a living, and has had this business for 23 years. Each month, she earns 33,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase materials for rag-making and materials for flower decor.

Lydia has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Lydia hope to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase materials for rag making and materials for flower decor.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda, a 59-year-old married mother of six, lives in Situbo, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte where she has been selling fish to earn a living for the past four years. A member of PMPC for two years, she has requested a loan of PHP 7000 to purchase more fish to sell. In the future, Erlinda hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.es: Mildred es una joven de 22 años vive con su  conviviente el señor Jhery, viven en la casa de sus padres en la comunidad de la Maica central de la ciudad de Cochabamba, viven muy incomodos en una sola habitación donde duermen y cocinan, actualmente no tienen hijos pero viene un hijo en camino. Su principal actividad de Mildred es la producción de la leche cruda, donde el producto entrega a otra persona para su elaboración de quesillo así mismo se dedica a la cría y venta de cerdos a pesar de su embarazo  trabaja muy duro para poder sobrevivir ya que no cuenta con el apoyo de sus padres, el esposo trabaja prestando servicios de chapería. El destino del crédito es para la compra de una cabeza de ganado lechero, con lo cual incrementara la cantidad de leche y por lo tanto mejorara sus ingresos. Entre sus sueños y mentas de Mildred es reunir dinero para poder comprar un lote de terreno y construir su propia casa y de esa manera ofrecer un mejor nivel de vida a su hijo que viene en camino.
texts.en:
Mildred is a young woman of 22, and lives with her partner Jhery. They live in his parents house in the community of Maica Central, near the city of Cochabamba.

They live very inconveniently in a single room where they sleep and cook. Currently they don't have children, but a child is on the way. Mildred's main livelihood is the production of raw milk, where she delivers the product to another person, for the making of quesillo (soft cheese). As well, she raises and sells pigs. 

Despite her pregnancy, she works very hard to be able to survive, as she doesn't have the support of her parents. Her husband does auto body work.

The loan is earmarked for the purchase of a dairy cow, through which she will increase the amount of milk and therefore improve her income. 

One of Mildred's dreams is to save up the money to buy a piece of land and build their own house, and in that way offer a better standard of living to their child who is on the way.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 43 years old and married with four children.

Erlinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a dry goods retail business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of dry goods to sell.

Erlinda has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the dry goods store for seven years and earns additional income from raising pigs.

Erlinda aspires to save enough money to send her children to college

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of dry goods to sell

loans.name: 040133 Giang Sơn - Hoằng Trường-Hoằng Hoá Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hương, a 30-year-old married mother of two residing in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province, is the leader of a five-member group, the 040133 Giang Sơn - Hoằng Trường-Hoằng Hoá solidarity group. For more than 10 years, Hương has operated a fishing enterprise that supports two dependents. Her main business hardships are natural disasters and droughts.

In 2006, Hương joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business, and has borrowed and repaid six loans thus far. She is now requesting a loan to purchase a new fishing net.

In the future, Hương hopes to buy land of her own, earn enough money to provide for her children, and enable her business to continue to do well.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing net.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is married with six children. Evelyn is 33 years old and lives in Situbo, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte.

Evelyn sells dresses to earn a living and has had this business for two years. Each month, she earns 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase more dresses to sell/retail.

Evelyn has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Evelyn hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more dresses to sell.

loans.name: Cecilio

texts.en:
Cecilio is married with 2 children. Cecilio is 39 years old and lives in Causwagan, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.
Cecilio buys and sells charcoals to earn a living and had this business for 1 year. Each month, he earns 10000 doing this type of work. He has requested a loan for 20000 to purchase more sacks of charcoals to sell/retail.
Cecilio has been a new member of PMPC. In the future, Cecilio hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoals to sell/retail

loans.name: Shiela

texts.en: Shiela is a married who has three children. Shiela is 29 years old, and resides at Tabo-o, Jimenez. Shiela owns and operate a farm land, planting & harvesting rice for sale to earn a living and she's been 3 years in this business. Each month, she earns 7,000 doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 15,000 to purchase fertilizers such as manure. In 20090, Shiela joined GDMPC. In the future, Shiela wants to make improvements of her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 59 years old and lives in Becor Taboo, Jimenez. Virginia is married with 4 children. 
Virginia works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. Virginia has been doing this for 6 years. Virginia has requested a loan of 8000 to purchase additional fish to sell.
Virginia has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. In the future,Virginia hopes to save in case of emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Gantsetseg

texts.en: Mrs.Gantsetseg aged 30, lives with her husband and a son in a small state apartment  in Govisumber province. Her husband has been working as a repairman in the state department of Mongolian railway for 5 years.  Her son is 7 years old and goes to the secondary school. Before Mrs.Gantsetseg worked as a teacher in a kindergarden of the World Vision INGO. In this year, she is started her first own business to sell silver articles. But her income was  insufficient. Therefore, she also sells bed linens and her income increased two times. Now she is requesting a 2.000.000 MNT to improve the working capital and to increase a range of goods. Her next plan is to build her private shop.

loans.use: To improve the working capital and to increase a range of goods

loans.name: Alijon

texts.en: Alijon is a very clever boy. He graduated school with excellence and good marks. He was one of the best pupils of his school. He likes math, computers, geography and other subjects. His hobby is playing football. His classmates like him very much. This year he has entered to the Economic University.  His parents are workers. Their income is small to pay for Alijon’s study at the university. Alijon wants to be one of the best economists in his town. He is purposeful and hardworking. Please, help him to realize his dream. He is asking for a loan of 950 USD to pay for study at the university. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To pay for study at the university

loans.name: Maria Marleny

texts.es:
Maria se encuentra casada y tiene 1 hijo de 17 años de edad, y debido a que los ingresos que genera su esposo no son suficientes para poder sostener todos los gastos de su hogar y también brindarle una educación de buena calidad a su hijo, decidió montar una tienda general donde ofrece productos de la canasta familiar y gracias a la cual puede contribuir económicamente en su hogar para que puedan tener una mejor calidad de vida. Desde hace 6 años que montó su tienda las condiciones económicas en su hogar han mejorado y las dificultades que constantemente presentaban se han venido superando poco a poco, y a pesar de que su negocio le brinda estas ventajas, aún no cuenta con el capital suficiente para poderle ofrecer a su hijo el acceso a una educación universitaria; es por esto que sigue trabajando fuertemente todos los días para que su negocio crezca y le permita obtener mayores ingresos y así brindarle esta oportunidad a su hijo. Su mayor dificultad es que no cuenta con un gran capital para mantener surtida su tienda, por esto Maria busca un préstamo para comprar productos de la canasta familiar y surtir su tienda con productos que ya se han ido agotando.

Su sueño es tener un negocio grande y próspero donde pueda generar empleo para las personas más necesitadas y con el cual tenga la oportunidad de brindar a su esposo y su hijo una mejor calidad de vida y mejores oportunidades económicas para progresar.
texts.en: Maria is married and has a seventeen year old son.  Since the income her husband earns is not sufficient to pay for the household expenses and also provide their son with a good quality education, she decided to open a general store where she sells staple goods.  Thanks to her business, she is able to contribute financially to the home so that they can have a better quality of life.  Since she opened her store six years ago, the economic situation in her home has improved and she has gradually overcome the constant difficulties that she had.  However, even though her business provides these advantages, she still doesn’t have enough resources to be able to offer her son access to a college education.  In order to provide her son with his opportunity, she continues working hard every day so that her business grows and allows her to earn higher income.  Her greatest difficulty is she doesn’t have enough capital to keep her store stocked.  For this reason, Maria is requesting a loan to purchase staple goods and stock her store with products that have been depleted.

loans.use: to purchase staple goods and stock her store with products that have been depleted.

loans.name: Omar

texts.es:
El señor Omar esta recién casado y por medio de una familiar le otorgo una vivienda el cual le están haciendo falta varias mejorar, es por eso que solicita el préstamo y realizar los acabados del exterior.
El señor Omar es maestro de Ingles de una primaria  del gobierno y su esposa  también es maestrea de un colegio particular, son los ingresos que tiene para formar su patrimonio juntos y mejor la calidad de vida, ya que pronto se unirá un miembro mas a la familia, pronto llegara un bebe a la familia.
Desea mejorar el patrimonio donde llagara su pequeño hijo.
texts.en:
Omar married recently and through a relative he was provided housing which he is improving in many ways, and this is why he is asking for a loan to finish the exterior. 

Omar is an English teacher at a government primary school and his wife is also a teacher at a private school. They are putting their incomes together so their assets will provide a better quality of life, as soon they will be joined by another member to their family, as a new baby is on the way.

He wants to improve the home as his son will be arriving,

loans.use: to finish work on the outside of his home

loans.name: Alberta

texts.es:
La señora Alberta y su esposo tienen dos hijas a quienes les quieren dar los estudios necesarios para que puedan ser unas triunfadoras y tengan un prometedor futuro.
Solicitan el préstamo para poder pagar las colegiaturas y comprar los útiles escolares ya que por el momento no cuentan con el dinero necesario para cubrir esta necesidad escolar que sus hijas necesitan. 
La señora Alberto y su esposo son empleados de una maquiladora en el aria de producción, son los ingresos que tiene para solventar los gastos y con el cual cubrirán el pago del crédito.
texts.en: Alberta and her husband have two daughters to whom they want to provide the necessary education so that they can be successful and have a promising future. They request the loan to pay for tuition fees and school supplies, since at the moment they don't have the amount of money to cover this need their daughters have. Alberta and her husband are employees of an assembly plant, and they work in the production area. That is the income they have to pay expenses and to repay the loan.

loans.use: to pay for school expenses

loans.name: Joeperlie

texts.en:
Joeperlie is 47 years old and married with three children.

Joeperlie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store.

Joeperlie has borrowed and repaid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and earns additional income from farming rice.

Joeperlie aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Genevie

texts.en:
Genevie is married with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Genevie is 36 years old. Both of her children are in school.

Genevie has a food vending business in the Philippines. Genevie requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business.

Genevie has been in this business for seven years.  In the future, Genevie would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Honorata

texts.en:
Honorata is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a variety store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell.

NWTF is posting this new loan request for Honorata's business in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell.

loans.name: 040124 Giang Sơn - Hoằng Trường-Hoằng Hoá Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tươi operates a business catching fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase net to catch fish.

Tươi is 37 years old and she is married with two children.

She is the leader of a four-member group, the 040124 Giang Sơn - Hoằng Trường-Hoằng Hoá solidarity group. Tươi supports two dependents with her business in the Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2012, Tươi joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Tươi has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Tươi has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Tươi faces in her business is the lack of labor help.

In the future, Tươi hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase net to catch fish.

loans.name: Edgar Marino

texts.es:
Edgar anteriormente vivía en su municipio natal y allí trabajó durante 8 años para una empresa de fotografía. Cuando conoció a la que hoy es su esposa, decidió trasladarse para la ciudad a vivir con ella y quiso aprovechar los conocimientos que ya tenía en la actividad y así montó su propio negocio donde ofrece el servicio de fotografía y también tiene una venta de productos de uso personal. Gracias a este negocio, la calidad de vida en su hogar ha venido mejorando y cada vez más sus hijos pueden tener mejores oportunidades. Buscando incrementar sus ventas, Edgar busca un préstamo para comprar una estantería donde pueda ubicar sus productos y así aumentar la variedad de productos que ofrece a sus clientes.

Su sueño es que este negocio siga creciendo y este le de las condiciones económicas para que sus hijos puedan acceder a una educación universitaria, además de que les permita seguir teniendo una buena calidad de vida en su hogar y tener mejores oportunidades económicas para progresar.
texts.en: Edgar was previously living in his hometown municipality, and worked there for eight years for a photography company. When he met who is now his wife, he decided to move to the city to live with her and wanted to take advantage of the knowledge he already had in the activity, so he set up his own business where he offers photography services, and also sells personal use products. Thanks to this business, the quality of life at his home has been improving, and his children have better opportunities. Looking to increase his sales, Edgar is requesting a loan to buy a display cabinet where he can place his products and therefore increase the variety of products he can offer to his customers. His dream is for this business to continue growing and provide him with the financial conditions to allow his children to access a college education, apart from allowing them to keep enjoying a good standard of living at home and better financial opportunities to progress.

loans.use: to buy a display cabinet where he can place his products and therefore increase the variety of products he can offer to his customers

loans.name: Marrieta

texts.en:
Marrieta is married with three children. Marrieta is 53 years old and lives in Poblacion, Sinacaban.

Marrieta is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. Marrieta has been doing this for eight years. Marrieta has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase additional feeds.

Marrieta has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Marrieta hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for her pigs

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
For over three years in Dicoloc, Jimenez, Rosita, a 47-year-old married mother of three children, has made a living through the operation of a general store selling a variety of food and home use products. She earns 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Rosita joined GDMPC. She is now requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps etc. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps etc.

loans.name: Hafiza

texts.ru: Хафизе 34 лет. Она  трудолюбивая женщина, но семейное счастье не открыла свои двери для нее. Она в разводе с мужем и сама воспитывает  двоих детей. Дети еще маленькие. В основном она  занимается скотоводством. Уже более 6 лет он занимается этим бизнесом, так как, после развода у нее не было поддержки. Ее отец  Ахмад  помогает советами  в ведении бизнеса. В дальнейшем она хочет, расширит свой бизнес и поэтому запросила кредит для покупки скота.   Доход от бизнеса она хочет  потратить на  учебу своих детей. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Hafiza is 34 years old. She is a hardworking woman, but family happiness has not opened its doors to her. She is divorced from her husband and raises two children by herself. The children are still young. 

Hafiza mainly works with livestock breeding. She has been engaged in this business for more than six years, since she after the divorce did not have any support. Her father, Akhmad, helps with advice on running the business.

Hafiza would like to expand her business in the future, and therefore requested a loan for the purchase of livestock. She wants to save the income from the business for her children's education. She hopes for your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Futuro Y Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Futuro y Esfuerzo” está conformado por 17 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; bazar, venta de juguetes, repostería, librería, venta de verduras, venta de ropa, costuras, venta de fruta seca, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Osorno.
Romina delegada del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pies, ocupando el segundo lugar de izquierda a derecha, viste una polera de color café y encima lleva puesto un chaleco de color negro, su cabello es de color oscuro y lo usa suelto.
Ella se dedica al rubro de venta de ropa usada y venta de accesorios varios como pinches, peluches, desde hace 7 años. Comenta que trabaja los días sábados en una feria de 10ºº a 14ºº horas, los demás días se dedica a vender productos de belleza por catalogo.
La mercadería que va necesitando para la venta de su negocio se la envían por encomienda desde la ciudad de Santiago, ya que en Santiago tiene la posibilidad de comprar en gran cantidad a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará ropa de casa como cubrecamas y sabanas y artículos para la temporada del mes de  septiembre como volantines.
Una de las metas de Romina es seguir creciendo y tener un local, donde atienda de manera más cálida a su clientela, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Romina vive junto a su madre y su hijo de 4 años de edad. Sus sueños son agrandar su negocio ya que tiene la necesidad de contar con más recursos en el hogar, porque los hijos van creciendo y al mismo tiempo crece la necesidad de darles un buen pasar y un buen futuro.
Ella se encuentra muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Respecto al grupo del Banco Comunal del cual forma parte, comenta que en éste existe muy buena comunicación.
