Adriana vive junto a su esposo y una nieta de 9 años de edad. Sus sueños a nivel familiar es poder terminar de arreglar su casa, para brindarle un buen pasar a su familia, y a nivel laboral crecer y vender cada vez más para seguir comprando mercadería surtida.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio. Además se siente muy cómoda con la compañía de las demás emprendedoras del grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que comparten diferentes actividades, intereses, lo cual también le ha servido como un momento de distracción. Respecto a la s capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones, ha aprendido administrar su negocio de mejor manera.
Renca es una comuna ubicada en el sector norponiente del Santiago (capital de Chile), región metropolitana. Es una comuna con un fuerte trabajo comunitario, entre lo que se destaca el canal de televisión comunitario “Renca TV”, creado con el fin de promover las actividades culturales y artísticas de la comuna.
texts.en:
The Norte Grande communal bank is comprised of 18 entrepreneurs who carry out various lines of work among which are a bazaar store, stalls at fairs, selling salads, selling juices, making curtains, a bakery, a store, and providing services, among others.  All of the members belong to the Renca commune in the city of Santiago.

In the photo Adriana, a member of the communal bank, is standing in the first row, and she is the first person on the right.  She is wearing a green sweater, her hair is dark brown, and she wears it down.

She has a variety store, and she has been working in this business for one year.  She says that she works alone at her house.  She works from Monday through Sunday from 3:00 p.m. until 12:00 a.m.  She does not work in the morning because it is very slow, and she does not get much income.

She buys the merchandise she needs from distributors, grocery stores, and supermarkets.  She buys at a low cost, which is financially desirable.  She will use the loan to buy batteries, tapes, cardboard, soap, room fresheners, cologne, shampoo, and diapers.

One of Adriana’s goals is to continue with her business, to continue advancing, and to have her business stocked as much as possible.  She also wants to buy a photocopier to be able to get more customers.  She will do this to generate greater income and to have a better quality of life.

Adriana lives with her husband and a nine year old granddaughter.  Her dream on a family level is to be able to finish fixing up her house in order to give her family a good life.  On a work level her dream is to grow and to sell more each day in order to continue buying merchandise to stock.

She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity that Fondo Esperanza has given her.  It has allowed her to invest in her business.  She feels very comfortable in the company of the other entrepreneurs in her communal bank.  They share different activities and interests, which have served to pass the time pleasantly.  In regards to the trainings at the meetings, she has learned to run her business in a different manner.

Renca is a commune (municipality) located in the northwest area of the Santiago Metropolitan Region (Santiago is Chile's capital). It is a commune with a strong community focus, highlighted by the community television channel, Renca TV, created with the aim of promoting the commune's cultural and artistic activities.

loans.use: to buy batteries, tapes, cardboard, soap, room fresheners, cologne, shampoo, and diapers.

loans.name: Jahir Wladimir

texts.es:
Jahir Wladimir  tiene 19 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con la mamá y el papá en ventanas provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC LA UNION, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas Frías, Perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol.

Jahir Wladimir  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y fréjol, además tiene animales como pollos de campo. Las compras y las ventas de los productos agrícolas lo hace en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, fertilizantes, urea, abonos para poder trabajar mejor en el campo. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los abonos para trabajar en los cultivos.

El sueño es poder comprar tierras para poder trabajar en la siembra de maíz. En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Jahir Wladimir is 19 years old, single and has no children. He lives with his mother and father in the city of Ventanas, in the province of Rios. 
He is a member of “La Union” Communal Bank which is located in Recinto Aguas Frias. This is in the Ventanas Cantón in Ventanilla. He works in agriculture. During the short growing season he grows rice and beans. He also has farm animals such as chickens. He buys and sells his items his items in Ventanas.
He is asking for this loan in order to buy seeds, fertilizer, urea and manure in order to improve his farm. With the help of this credit he will buy fertilizer to apply to his crops. 
His dream is to buy a piece of land in order to grow corn. In his free time he likes to play sports.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, urea and manure in order to improve his farm.

loans.name: Chhorn's Group

texts.en:
Chhorn is the 61-year-old widowed mother of one child and also a rural villager from Sa Ang district, Cambodia. 

She strives for a living through one hectare of rice-cropping farmland. For last 38 years with her rice-planting business, she is able to earn about 11,000 KHR per day. 

Chhorn's group consists of four members.  All four are female and are seventh-time borrowers with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. With success, Chhorn  has managed to pay back all her loans consecutively, and they have made a better living for her household.  Moreover, she also can save some money for the future's needs. 

Leading her group to seek a new loan, Chhorn as the group leader will use her loan portion to buy seeds and fertilizer and to pay for plowing. 

She hopes to boost more crop yields, so she can multiply her income.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer and to pay for plowing.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es:
María Auxiliadora tiene 36 años de edad de estado civil casada tiene 4 hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos de 14, 12, 7 y 5 años de edad en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC LA UNION, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas Frías, Perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol.

María Auxiliadora se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, urea, fertilizantes, abonos, insecticidas, ranger. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá seguir sembrando.

El sueño es darles el estudio a los hijos, ir de paseo a la playa con toda la familia. No se le ha presentado ningún tipo de problema en la producción.
En el tiempo libre le gusta salir a pasear con la familia.
texts.en:
María Auxiliadora is 36 years old and is married. She lives with her husband and with her  4 children, ages 14,12, 7, and 5 in the canton of Ventanas, in Los Ríos province. 

She is a member of "LA UNION" communal bank, which is located in the Aguas Frías district, which belongs to the canton Ventanas. The members of this communal bank work in short-cycle agriculture planting corn, rice, and beans. 

María Auxiliadora works in farming, planting corn and beans. She makes her purchases and sales in Ventanas. 

She requests the loan to purchase seeds, urea, fertilizers, compost, insecticides, and Ranger. With the help of the loan, she will be able to continue planting. 

Her dream is to offer an education to her children, and to go for a walk on the beach with the whole family. She has not had any type of problem in production. In her free time she likes to go out for walks with the family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, urea, fertilizers, compost, insecticides, and Ranger

loans.name: Perfecto

texts.es:
Perfecto es un señor de 71  años de edad,  vive con su esposa y su madre quien es de edad avanzada en una comunidad llamada Osa, localizada en Caña Blancal , en la provincia de Puntarenas. Está comunidad se  destaca por ser una zona rural muy visitada por sus hermosas  playas y la variedad de fauna que posee.  Sus principales actividades económicas son el turismo y la agricultura.

Perfecto nos comenta que el único ingreso económico en la familia es el suyo, él se dedica a comprar ganado pequeño lo alimenta  hasta que obtenga el peso adecuado y lo vende en las ferias ganaderas locales, en este momento está solicitando un crédito de un millón de colones (¢1.000.000) para comprar terneros  e iniciar el proceso de engorde  y luego venderlos a buen precio.

Perfecto es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Caña Blancal, una de las 150 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica,destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Perfecto is a 71-year-old man. He lives with his wife and his mother, who is of an advanced age, in a community called Osa, which is located in Caña Blanca in the province of Puntarenas. This community is a much-visited rural area known for its beautiful beaches and wildlife. The main economic activities here are tourism and agriculture.
Perfecto says that he is the sole economic support for his family. He buys calves and fattens them up until they are ready to sell in the local cattle market. He is currently requesting a loan of a million colones (c1,000,000) in order to buy calves and begin the process of fattening them up and selling them for a good price.
Perfecto is a member of the Communal Credit Business of Caña Blanca, one of the 150 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. Thanks to the organization and the ease of obtaining credit, he is able to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Duo San Luis Group

texts.es: Duo San Luis, Doña Marcela de 27 años de edad, líder de este dúo, es una mujer casada, originaria del Municipio de San Juan. Doña Marcela tiene dos niños de 6 y 4 años, se dedica a la elaboración  y venta de candelas y veladoras elaboradas en parafina desde hace 15 años actividad que aprendió de su padre, quien inicio este negocio desde hace muchos años, doña Marcela logra vender sus producto en un pequeño local en el interior del mercado de  su localidad,ella trabaja juntamente con su hermano quien se encarga de repartir la mercadería en varias tiendas, en colonias y aldeas de este municipio, está solicitando este credito para la compra de cera para elavoracion de candelas.
texts.en: Doña Marcela, who is the leader of the Duo San Luis, is 27 years old, married, and orginally from the town of San Juan.  She has two children, ages six and four.  For 15 years, she has produced and sold candles and votive candles made from parafin.  Doña Marcela learned her craft from her father who began this business many years ago.  She manages to sell her products in a small shop inside her local market, and she works alongside her brother who is responsible for distributing the merchandise to various shops in districts and towns in their municipality.  Doña Marcela is applying for this loan in order to buy wax for the production of her candles.

loans.use: to buy wax to make candles.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris is 50 years old and widowed, with two children.  She works very hard to provide for them.

Doris runs a general store in the Philippines.  She sells a variety of products, such as snack foods, canned goods, and other grocery items. She has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell.

Doris has been in this business for 30 years.  In the future, she would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell.

loans.name: Khorn's Group

texts.en:
Living under a thatched house located in the Pursat province's Bakan district, Khorn is one of the breadwinners in the family. She is a 51-year-old mother of five children. Her two sons have their own employment whilst another three are students and still under her responsibility.  

For the children's sake, she and her husband overcame the family's hardships by selling their handmade fish traps. They have been with this business for 15 years and are able to earn almost 15,000 Cambodian riels (KHR) per day. 

Khorn is new to VisionFund (a Kiva partner), the same as her group members. Her group has four members; all are female. She leads this group to seek a new loan, and each member is taking a loan of 1,000,000 KHR. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy bamboo for making more fish traps and a portion of it to buy pigs for raising as extra income. She hopes to make more income in order to sustain a good standard of living for her family.

loans.use: To buy bamboo for making more fish traps and to buy pigs.

loans.name: Kishwar

texts.en:
Kishwar is 26 years old. She is an energetic working woman with five years' experience and the skill of stitching both ladies and gents clothing. 

After her marriage, she felt she should help her husband in covering day to day expenditures. She owns her stitching machine, and she wants to invest in buying cloth of different colors for making stitched suits and catering to a large demand from her customers. 

She hopes to have a good experience with the new loan.

loans.use: To buy cloth of different colors in bulk.

loans.name: Olia

texts.en:
Olia is 59 years old and lives in Gardabani district. She is married, and she has a son and a daughter-in-law. Her husband works as a watchman and gets a monthly salary. 

The family runs an animal husbandry business. They own four milk cows and produce cheese. Olia is very hard-working woman, with a rich experience at her work.

Olia requested a loan to purchase food for cattle. She will purchase hay, which will be used for feeding her cows during the fall and winter.  Hay is cheap now, but the price increases by 30% to 40% in the fall months.  By buying now, Olia significantly saves on the cost of feeding the cows. She will be able to get more milk and increase the income of the family. 

With the increased income, Olia plans to build the new cattle shed.   She plans to expand the dairy farm by adding more cows, but the existing cattle shed doesn’t allow her to implement this plan.  After the building is expanded, Olia will purchase calves and raise them. 

Olia will improve the living conditions of the family. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase hay for cattle before the price goes up.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 46 years old and married, with three children.

Mary Ann works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines.  She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

Mary Ann has borrowed and repaid ten loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years, and she also earns an income from raising pigs.

Mary Ann aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

NWTF is presenting Magdalena's business for funding of another loan in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is 26 years old and single.  She lives in the Philippines.

Janeth is buying and selling copra, dried coconut meat, in her vilage. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more copra to resell.

Janeth is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more copra to resell

loans.name: Jemma

texts.en:
Jimma works hard to support her family. Jimma is married and has a trisikad (pedicab) transportation business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 7 years.

Jimma requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy an additional trisikad.  In the future, she would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: buy a pedicab

loans.name: Bunra's Group

texts.en:
Bunra, a young single man, is 22 years old and a villager from Battambang province's Ek Phnom, Cambodia. 

To earn his feed, he grows paddy rice and beans as the primary source of income. To add to his income, he also raises cows and catches fish for resale. Having been in this business for seven years, he is able to earn about 39,000 KHR per day. After his daily expenses, he is able to save about 9,000 KHR each day on average. 

Bunra joined VisionFund (Kiva's partner)  two cycles ago, and he managed to pay back the entire loans already.  The past loans supported his business in a timely way and stabilized his lifestyle.  

Now, he has formed a group of three members to seek a new loan. As the group leader, he will use his loan portion to pay for harvesting his rice.  He hopes to make more healthy rice, so as to keep good progress in his life.

loans.use: To pay for harvesting fee for his rice farm

loans.name: Saret's Group

texts.en:
Saret is a 53-year-old married mother of six school-aged kids. For this big household, she can earn a decent income from her two-hectare plot of rice farmland. For past 33 years with her business, she has been able to earn about 16,000 KHR per day. 

Saret took her first loan with VisionFund in 2011 and has paid back the entire loan with success.  The previous loan has made a better support for her household as well as her business. 

Now, forming a group of three, Saret is the group leader. She is applying for 1,000,000 KHR, while her two fellow members are seeking 500,000 KHR each. Saret will use her portion of the loan to pay for harvesting fees and to buy fertilizer for her farmland. 

She expects to double her income from her business and sustain a good standard of living for her children's sake.

loans.use: to pay for harvesting fees and to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Santos De La Concepcion

texts.es: Santos de la concepción de  47 años de edad, soltera, con dos hijos, de los cuales uno está bajo su responsabilidad ya que es menor de edad y está estudiando,  Santos está solicitando el financiamiento para realizar mejoras en la vivienda, y brindarle mayor seguridad a su familia, las mejoras  consisten en construcción de cuartos y porche de la casa,  ponerle zinc a la cocina, el financiamiento lo quiere para comprar material de construcción como :    zinc, cemento, cal, arena, piedrín, ladrillos, madera, alambre, clavos, bloque entre otros.
texts.en: Santos de la concepción is 47 years old, single and has two children, one of whom is her responsibility because he is still a minor and is studying. Santos is seeking this financing to make improvements to her home and to provide better security for her family. The improvements consist of the construction of rooms and a porch for the house, and putting zinc in the kitchen. She wants the financing to buy construction materials like: zinc, cement, lime, sand, stones, bricks, wood, wire, nails and slabs, among others.

loans.use: to buy zinc, cement, lime, sand, stones, bricks, wood, wire, nails and slabs, among others.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Miguel le esta haciendo falta el barandal al frente, pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para mandarlo a elaborar y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de realizar la mejora.
El señor Miguel elabora para una compañía de gasolina en el aria de despachador y su esposa tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de refrescos y ropa usas. Estos son los ingresos que regeneran para los gastos familiares ya que son personas mayores de edad y sus hijos ya tienen su propia familia.
Solicita el préstamo para mejorar su patrimonio y la seguridad de el y su esposa.
texts.en:
Miguel's home lacks a balustrade in front, but he doesn't have the money necessary to installl it and pay the person who does the work.

Miguel works for a gasoline company as a despatcher and his wife has a small business selling soft drinks and used clothing. These are the incomes they must rely on to cover family expenses, since they are older people and their children already have families of their own. Miguel is requesting the loan for the purpose of improving the property as well as enhancing their security.

loans.use: install a balustrade in front of their house to enhance security.

loans.name: Saroert's Group

texts.en: Saroeurt is a 33 year-old married mother of one son. The rest of her family resides in the Kror Lanh district of Siem Reap province, Cambodia. To support her household, she plants the rice in a paddy and works for others for a fee. Having been with this business for two years, she is able to earn about 15,000 KHR per day. Saroeurt's group consists of two members as who are first time borrowers. The amount she is requesting is 1,000,000 KHR whereas her co-members are seeking 500,000 KHR. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her rice field. She hopes to earn more income from her current business and maintain good progress of her family's living condition.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her rice field.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Kror Lanh district

loans.name: Gloria Narcisa

texts.es:
Gloria Narcisa tiene 43 años de edad es casado civil actual es casada tiene tres hijos, vive con los hijos y los nietos en ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC LA UNION, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas Frías, Perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol.

Gloria Narcisa se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, además se dedica a la crianza de anmales. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para  la compra de semillas, abonos, líquidos, urea, insecticidas. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los abonos agrícolas sin ningún tipo de problema y poder trabajar.

El sueño es poder comprarse comprarse una casa y hacer los desmontes. El desafío al que se enfrenta son las plagas la falta de agua causa sequedad a los cultivos.

En el tiempo libre le gusta pasear por el campo y viajar.
texts.en:
Gloria Narcisa, 43, is in a common-law marriage and has three children.  She lives with her children and grandchildren in Ventanas province in Los Rios.


She is a member of the VRC La Union group which is located in the Aguas Frias Recinto, Ventanas canton.  This chapter has farmers who plant short term crops such as corn, rice and beans.

Gloria Narcias grows corns and she also raises animals.  She buys and sells them in Ventanas.

She is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, liquids, urea, and insecticides.  The loan will help her buy agricultural fertilizer easily and she will be able to work.

Her dream is to buy a house and clear the land.   The difficulties that she faces are the infestations, and the lack of water that dries up her crops.

In her free time she likes to travel through the countryside.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, liquids, urea, and insecticides

loans.name: Aleli

texts.en:
As a married mother of 6 children, Aleli works hard to support her family.  She has a food vending (pusu making) business in the Philippines.  Aleli is borrowing PHP 15500 through NWTF to buy rice for her food vending business. 

Aleli has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy rice for her food vending business

loans.name: Phat's Group

texts.en: Phat, aged 41, is a citizen from the Ek Phnom district in Cambodia. She has four children and makes her living through rice and maize growing. Her husband uses his spare time to support her business too besides his job as the village's chief. She has been involved in this business for ages, earning about 31,000 KHR per day. However, she is able to save only 7,000 KHR per day after the daily expenses. For the past six-cycle, she and her fellow group member has been with VisionFund (Kiva's partner). She has paid back the entire previous loans with success.  These loans have helped her to gradually support her business and reduce her family's burden.  Now, leading her group for the seventh loan cycle, Phat and her group member are seeking for 1,200,000 KHR each. For her, the loan portion will be used to buy fertilizer and to pay for pumping water. A portion of it she will use it to buy pigs for raising to add to her income. She hopes to increase her crops and make a better living.

loans.use: buy fertilizer, pay for pumping water, and buy pigs

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has two children, both go to school. She sells traditional men’s wear on a retail basis in a shop.  She has been in this business for four months.  She works six days a week.  

Rehema has requested for a loan of Shs100000 from MCDT- SACCO to buy more materials for her business like cooking oil, cow peas and baking flour.  Her major business challenge is seasonality and transportation.  Her goal and aspiration is to buy a plot of land.  She lives in a rented house.  Her family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water.  Her major expenses are school fees, rent and electricity.

loans.use: buy flour, cooking oil and cowpeas

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 41 years old and single.  She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines.

Anita requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell.  She has been in this business for 11 years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Anita aspires to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: buy more stocks to sell

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita is from Poblacion, Panaon. She is 67 years old. Florita is widowed and has 4 children. To make a living, Florita plants and harvests vegetables like squash for sale. Florita has been engaged in her business for 6 years and earns PHP 5,000 a month from these activities.  In 2009, Florita joined GDMPC.

Florita is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: buy seeds and seedlings

loans.name: Amado

texts.es:
Amado, se dedica a la elaboración de hamacas y presta servicios con un molino de nixtamal, vive con sus tres hijos, todos son dependientes, él aprendio el negocio desde que está pequeño, junto a su familia, tiene aproximadamente cuatro años de estar realizando para cubrir los gastos del hogar.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de material para la elaboración de las hamacas que es el hilo de seda de varios colores, éste le permitirá tener a la mano los recursos necesarios para poder cubrir la demanda que tiene con los clientes, ya que tiene varios pedidos.

Su objetivo es apoyar a su familia con el negocio, enseñar a sus hijos la elaboración de las hamacas para que puedan tener una ocupación para el futuro, también apoyarles en educación.
texts.en:
Amado works making hammocks and he provides service with a Nixtamal-brand grinder.  He lives with his three children, all of whom are dependent.  He learned the business from his family when he was very young.  He has been doing this work for approximately four years to cover the household expenses.

He is requesting a loan to buy materials to make hammocks, which is silk thread in various colors.  This will allow him to have the necessary resources on hand to be able to meet his customer demand, because he has several orders.

His goal is to support his family with the business, to teach his children to make hammocks so they can have a job for the future, and to support them in their education.

loans.use: to buy silk thread in various colors

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es: Leonor  de 59 años de edad, casada con un hijo mayor de edad, por lo tanto nadie depende  económicamente de ella, Leonor ya ha tenido crédito con fundación león 2000 y ha demostrado ser responsable, trabajadora ya que manifiesta que quiere tener un medio de cómo obtener  ingresos y no depender económicamente de  su hijo y esposo por eso día a día se levanta con ganas de trabajar y  seguir adelante, el financiamiento lo necesita para invertir en la compra de pacas de ropa usada que es la actividad a la que se dedica y la distribuye de  forma ambulante y por encargo a sus clientes fijos y eventuales.
texts.en: Leonor is 59 years old and married with one older son, hence no one is depending on her economically. Leonor has already had a loan with Fundación león 2000 and has demonstrated that she is responsible and hard working which shows that she wants to have a means of obtaining an income and to not depend economically on her son and husband. Because of this, every day she wakes up with the desire to work and get ahead. She needs this financing to invest in the purchase of bales of used clothing, which is the activity to which she dedicates herself. She distributes them as a street vendor and customizes them for her regular and casual customers.

loans.use: to buy bales of used clothes

loans.name: Cesar Augusto

texts.es: Cesar Augusto  de  32 años de edad, soltero, tiene por actividad económica la venta de bolsas plásticas de todos los tamaños. Cesar ya ha trabajado con fundación en créditos anteriores por lo tanto  manifiesta que sin la ayuda que fundación león 2000 y kiva le brinda con los financiamiento no habría podido sacar adelante su negocio para invertir en capital de trabajo ya que existen mucha competencia, cesar es un emprendedor muy responsable ,trabajador, buena paga, su objetivo y meta en un futuro es poder obtener una moto como medio de transporte para su negocio y de dicha forma poder desplazarse en su ruta de trabajo día a día  para obtener mayores ingresos y clientela su productos consisten en  : ( bolsas de gabachas, bolsas de libras, bolsas de basura de todos los tamaños)
texts.en:
Cesar Augusto is 32 years old and single.  He makes a living by selling plastic bags of all sizes.  Cesar has worked with Fundación before as he mentions that without the financial help of Fundación león 2000 and kiva he would not have been able to move his business forward and invest in merchandise especially with the high amount of competition that exists.  

Cesar is an entrepreneur that is very responsible, hard-working, and has good character.  His future goal and objective is to obtain a motorcycle as a mode of transportation for his business therefore being able to find new routes and create new business opportunities to increase his customer base and income.  His products include garbage bags, pound bags, and garbage bags of all sizes.

loans.use: to purchase garbage bags, pound bags, and garbage bags of all sizes

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is 43 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living raising pigs in the Philippines. Melinda is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy additional feed for her pigs.

Melinda has been raising pigs for 10 years and also earns additional income from rice retailing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additonal feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is 28 years old and married with three children.  Flordeliza works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines.  

Flordeliza requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to purchase more grocery items to sell.  She has been in this business for six years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Flordeliza aspires to save enough to improve her business and continue to send her her children to school.

loans.use: buy grocery items to sell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a basket making business in the Philippines.

Teresita requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy materials needed for her basket making.  She has been in this business for 26 years.

In the future, Teresita would like to save enough to improve her business.

loans.use: buy basket making materials

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo.

Yasmeen is a 24-year-old young woman. She is married and a mother to one son. Her husband is employed and gets a low salary which is not enough to cover the family's needs.

Yasmeen wants to live in better home conditions with her family, so she is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the cost of purchasing new living room furniture and dinning room furniture in order to improve the living conditions in her house. Taking this loan will offer to Yasmeen and her family comfortable furniture so they can enjoy living in their house.


About Shariah-compliant lending:
 FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: to purchase living room furniture and dinning room furniture.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a 43-year-old married woman. She has 4 children with ages ranging from 15 years to 27 years. She describes herself to be a social and talkative woman. 

Amina operates a food stall where she sells ground nuts. She has been involved in this business for 23 years. Her business is located behind a busy shopping mall and her primary customers are from the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds for improving the business. 

Amina will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy more ground nuts to resell. Her business goal is to run a retail shop  within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she can educate her children with the profits she will have made.

loans.use: buy groundnuts to sell

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred has five years in mixed farming in his rural home in Kisii, South Rift, Kenya. He produces maize, beans, wheat, and bananas to provide the major part of his farming income.

Alfred has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He plans to run a cereals processing business within the local market to supplement the farming business.

Alfred says animal diseases and poor infrastructure are the main challenges, but he remains optimistic he will be able to give his four children better education.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Chhunheng's Group

texts.en:
Chhunheng is 55 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom is still dependent on her and in school. 

To support the family's daily basic needs, she grows paddy rice with her husband on two hectares of farmland as the main source of income. To make more income, she also sells grocery items. She is able to earn about 20,000 KHR per day from the businesses.  She has been with them for 36 years. 

Chhunheng's group consists of two female members; both of them are the second-time borrowers. The previous loan, which she has paid back, helped her to provide proper clothes for her child and keep her daughter in school. Furthermore, she also can manage to save some money for the future's need. 

She leads her group to apply for a new loan. She is seeking 1,200,000 KHR, and her fellow group member is asking for 1,000,000 KHR. 

Chhunheng will use her loan portion to buy fertilizers and to pay for plowing plus harvesting fees. She hopes to grow her rice on time and sell at a good price, so as to keep her children in school until tertiary level and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and to pay for plowing plus harvesting fees.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a resident of Murang’a in Central Kenya where he has been practicing mixed farming for fifteen years.  He produces and sells tomatoes, cabbages and Arabica flowers. He also sources greenhouse polythene and sells to local farmers for additional income.

George has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy greenhouse accessories. He will use these to set up a greenhouse on his farm to boost the growing of Arabica flowers and tomatoes. He reiterates that he will channel the income to improving the lives of his two children as well as making his farming more commercial.

George says poor weather conditions that make pests and weeds rampant remain his major challenge.

loans.use: buy greenhouse materials

loans.name: Nornita

texts.en:
Nornita is 49 years old and married with 5 children.  Nornita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines.  She has been running her general store for 2 years and also earns an income from food vending. 

Nornita has borrowed and repaid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan.   She requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store.  

Nornita aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: buy more stock for her store

loans.name: Rorn

texts.en:
Rorn is 36 years old and the father of two children, both of whom are dependent on him and still in school.   He is a villager from the Kampong Cham province’s Tbaung Khmum district of Cambodia

The main source of the family’s income is rice cropping; he also supplements his income through cassava and groundnut growing. Rorn and his wife have been in these businesses for 12 years, earning about 40,000 KHR per day and clearing about 15,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. 

This is the first-time loan for Rorn with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund.  He is applying for a loan of KHR 4,000,000. 

With this loan, he is going to buy fertilizers and rice seed for his farmland. He hopes to increase more income from a better crop yield, so as to better his family’s living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and rice seed for his farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to purchase additional gallons of coconut wine to sell.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 12 years.  She also earns income from farming sugarcane and food vending.

Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional gallons of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Guillermo Santiago

texts.es: Guillermo Santiago de veintiocho años de edad, el desempeña dando clase en un colegio público de su localidad, el está solicitando un financiamiento   para realizar mejoras de construcción en su vivienda, Guillermo Santiago es muy trabajador, responsable, con ganas de superación personal, su sueños y metas es llegar a construir  su casita por completo y el día de mañana que llegue sus hijos darle un lugar digno donde vivir. Con el financiamiento comprara materia del construcción como: cemento, arena, zinc, bloques, madera, clavos, alambre, piedrín, pintura, entre otros.
texts.en:
Guillermo Santiago, 28, teaches in a public school in his town.  He is requesting a loan to make improvements on his home.  Guillermo Santiago is very hardworking and responsible with a desire for personal improvement.  His dream and goal is to be able to finish building his house and, in the future, give his children a decent place to live.

With the loan he will buy construction materials such as cement, sand, metal roofing, concrete blocks, wood, nails, wire, gravel, paint, and other supplies.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn, wood and gas.

loans.name: Richlie

texts.en:
Richlie is 28 years old, married and has one child who is in school.

Richlie is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines.  She has been raising pigs for 5 years now and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.  Richlie requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy additional feeds for her business.

In the future, Richlie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy pig feed

loans.name: William Abuni

texts.en:
William is a 35-year-old  businessman  who lives in Juba.  He is married and has 3 child between the ages of 5 and 12, all of them go to school.

William runs a general store.  He has been in business for 3 years.  He has no  employee and no other source of income other than this business.  William heard about Finance Sudan through other clients.  He is taking a loan of 1500 SDG to purchase soap, sweets and many other items to sell.

In 5 years William  would like to expand his business and open other branches.  His major challenges include high prices in the market.   Wlliam  says he is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan  through Kiva.

loans.use: buy items to sell in his store

loans.name: Sanpa

texts.en:
Sanpa is 49 years old and married with 4 children.  She works hard to provide for her family.  

San runs a general store in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell.

Sanpa has borrowed and paid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for 10 years and also earns an income from food vending and raising pigs.

Sanpa aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy more stocks for her store

loans.name: Vensita

texts.en:
Vensita is 43 years old.  She is married and has 2 children, with 1 child in school.  

Vensita is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Vensita requested a PHP 12500 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.  She has been in this business for 2 years now and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Vensita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Angie

texts.en:
Angie is married and has a fruit vending business in the Philippines.  She works hard to support her family. 

Angie requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of fruits to sell.  Angie has been in her business for 10 years now.

In the future, Angie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy fruits to sell

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a restaurant business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 20 years now.

Carmelita requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business.  In the future, Carmelita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy ingredients for her restaurant

loans.name: Enriqueta

texts.en:
Enriqueta is 42 years old and married with 5 children.

Enriqueta works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines.  Enriqueta  requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional products to sell.  She has borrowed and repaid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan.  Enriqueta has been running her general store for 26 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

Enriqueta aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Joceri

texts.en:
Joceri is 37 years old and married, with four children, who are in schoo l.  Joceri works very hard to provide for them.

Joceri runs a general store in the Philippines.  She requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like shampoo and groceries, in her general store.

Joceri has been in this business for 12 years and sells a variety of items, such as noodles, spices, canned goods, and sugar. 

In the future. Joceri would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.,

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a welding shop business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 2 years and also earns more income from pig fattening.

Josephine is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase materials for her welding shop business.  She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF.  Josephine dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: buy materials for her welding business

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
La señora Karina, es socia del banco comunal “las Pomarrosas” Distrito Coronal portillo, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 38 años de edad, está casada y tiene una hija pequeña.
Lleva dos años trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza sus compañeras de trabajo son las mejores clientas que tiene.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles comprara: 3 perfumes que están en oferta, 1 champú, 1 enjuague, 2 labiales, 3 colonias de mujer, 3 perfumes para niños.
De esta manera genera un ingreso más a su hogar para poder tener un poco de tranquilidad económica,  muy contenta porque negocio está creciendo cada vez más tiene la oportunidad de poder trabajar con tranquilidad porque tiene para cubrir los pagos de los compromisos adquiridos.
texts.en:
Karina is a member of Las Pomarrosas Communal Bank, in the Coronal Portillo district, department of Ucayali.  She's 38 years old and married, and has a young daughter.

She has been working with loans from Manuela Ramos for two years.  She works selling beauty products.  Her coworkers are her best customers.

With her new loan for 1,000 soles [PEN] she will buy three perfumes that are on sale, one shampoo, one conditioner, two lipsticks, three colognes for women, and three perfumes for children.

This way she will generate additional income for her home to be able to have a bit of financial peace.  She's very happy because the business is growing more all the time.  She has the opportunity to be able to work peacefully because she has money to cover the payments for the commitments she has acquired.

loans.use: to buy perfume and shampoo

loans.name: Serey's Group

texts.en: As a 58 year-old mother living in a rural area located in the Siem Reap Province's Pouk district, Serey is one of the breadwinners of a family of five children. All of her children have their own employment already. To make a living for her daily needs, she manages a two-hectare farmland for crop planting as her primary source of income. She also supplements her income by selling food (porridge and noodle). She is able to earn about 19,000 KHR per day from the current businesses that she has been in for 10 years. This Serey's first loan with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. Both of them are seeking the same loan amount of 1,000,000 KHR each and she is the group leader. For Serey, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her crop to boost its productivity. She expects to make more income and maintain a better living condition for her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her crop to boost its productivity.

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy is a father of six children aged between 14 and 2 years old and he is also a farm with four successive years in active farming. He produces maize, bananas and beans for the local market to meet his family's needs.

Kennedy has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He says the income will go into meeting his family's basic needs. He plans to run a farm of at least three dairy cows and buy a motorcycle to ensure timely and cheaper deliveries of the farm produce to the market.

He mentions that there are poor roads networks and animal diseases that effect his business. He appreciates Juhudi Kilimo's loan services.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Nolita

texts.en:
Nolita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a pocketbook rentals business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12500 through NWTF to buy assorted pocketbook for her pocketbook rentals business.

Nolita has been in this business for 12 years. Nolita also earns income from her general store.

Nolita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy assorted pocketbook for her pocketbook rentals business.

loans.name: Zeinabi

texts.en:
Zeinabi is 30 years old and lives in a small village in Terjola district. She is married and has a 3-year-old daughter.  Zeinabi works as a sick-nurse and gets a monthly salary.  Her husband is a tractor driver and provides seasonal agricultural services to local farmers and gets a service fee for the work. Zeinab is also involved in a dairy business. She has 3 milking cows and produces cheese.  She sells the cheese locally. The family also owns a vineyard and agricultural land as well. They work hard, but still don’t have enough income to make some savings and improve their living conditions. 

Zeinabi requested a loan to roof and repair her house, which is old and damaged. With this credit she will purchase building materials and renovate the house.  As a result of the above mentioned repairs, the living conditions for the family will be improved and they will be able to spend their evenings after a hard working day in a more comfortable environment.  Zeinabi hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to repair her house

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 62 years old and married with 9 children.   

Julieta works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has been running it for 10 years.  She also earns an income from pig fattening and farming sugarcane.  

Julieta requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional products to sell.  She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy fishing supplies

loans.name: Taciana

texts.en:
Taciana is 49 years old, married and has 5 children, 2 of the children are in school.

Taciana has a charcoal retail business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 5 years. 

Taciana requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.  She would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy charcoal to resell

loans.name: Gelieta

texts.en:
Gelieta is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.  She works hard to support nine children. 

Gelieta requested a PHP 1500 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.  She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of emergency.   Gelieta is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 59 years old and married with 4 children.  She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines.  Lilia has been farming sugarcane for 10 years and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport.

Lilia is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: buy farm inputs

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business of buying and selling of fruits and vegetables in the Philippines.   Mildred has been in this business for 6 years.  She also earns more income from farming sugarcane.  Mildred is borrowing PHP 16000 through NWTF to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Mildred has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: buy fruits and vegetables to resell

loans.name: Naranbaatar

texts.en:
Naranbaatar is 31 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a ger in Bayanhoshuu district of Ulaanbaatar city. His older daughter is a secondary school student, his younger daughter and son are kindergarden kids. 

In 2004, he and his wife purchased a car and became a taxi business. Since then they have been operating a taxi business. Currently Naranbaatar is starting a new business. He is producing iron doors and other iron goods by order. 

Naranbaatar is an open-minded and diligent man who says "I have a plan to open a work place in the future." He is requesting a 1,600,000MNT loan to build a work place for the producing of iron goods.

loans.use: build a metal workshop

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen works hard to support 4 children. She is married and has a sari-sari store business in the Philippines.

Helen requested a PHP 1500 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.   She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of emergency.

Helen is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Doña Ana  es una mujer viuda de 70 años, madre de 4 hijos  en las edades de 38 a 52 años. Ella es una comerciante que se dedica a la venta de productos, mediante guías especializadas o catálogos, negocio que inició desde hace 10 años, pues siempre tuvo la vocación comercial y para no convertirse en una carga para su familia, decidió trabajar con su mayor potencial, que es el de vender. Su vivienda se encuentra ubicada en un sector muy transitado y este flujo de personas que por allí caminan, potencializan su venta diaria. Doña Ana  vende artículos de miscelánea, como papelería, silletería, materiales de modistería, ropa y artículos de aseo personal. Sus ventas las realiza de contado y sus compras de la misma manera; ella diariamente abre sus instalaciones desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche, cuando se va su último cliente y de lunes a domingo. Su negocio ha recibido un anterior crédito de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con este logró aumentar su capacidad de compra, por eso está muy entusiasmada y actualmente esta aplicando a un credikiva, mediante el cual invertirá nuevamente en mecánica variada, como vestidos, productos de aseo personal y accesorios femeninos, que es la que mas se mueve en el mercado y esto hace que su inversión sea muy exitosa.
texts.en:
Ana is a 70 years old and a widow. She is the mother of four children, ages 38 to 52. 

She is a merchant, and sells products through specialized guides or catalogs, a business she started 10 years ago. She has always had a natural inclination toward business, and in order to not become a burden for her family, she decided to work with her greatest strength, which is her ability to sell. 

Her home is located is a very busy part of the city, and the flow of people that walk by boosts her daily sales.

Ana sells miscellaneous items such as stationery, sewing supplies, clothing, and personal hygiene items. She carries out her sales for cash, and her purchases in the same way. She opens her store daily from 8:00 in the morning to 7:00 at night, when her last customer leaves, and from Monday to Sunday. 

Her business has received a previous loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and with this she managed to increase her purchasing capacity. That is why she is very enthusiastic, and is currently applying for a credikiva loan.  By this means, she will again invest in a variety of merchandise, such as dresses, personal hygiene items and women's accessories. This is what sells best in the market, and will make her investment very successful.

loans.use: To invest in a variety of merchandise such as dresses, personal hygiene products, and women's accessories.

loans.name: Tumendemberel

texts.en:
Tumendemberel is 60 years old. He is divorced and lives alone in a ger, a national yurt, in Zavhan province. He started a furniture producing business with his son-in-law in 2007. He produces wooden furniture, frames for a ger, wooden paste boards, doors and cabers (yurt poles). His monthly profit is approximately 200,000-300,000  MNT. 

Tumendemberel needs to warm his work space.  His business stops in the winter time because it's too cold. He requests a 2,000,000 MNT loan to buy the insulation for his work place and also boards and paint for his business.  His next plan is to have some savings. Although Tumendemberel  is an old man, he is a very hard-working man.

loans.use: insulate his workshop and buy and materials for his furniture business

loans.name: Maria Belen

texts.en:
Maria Belen is 50 years old and married.  She lives in Macabayao, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Maria Belen raises cattle to sell as her source of income.   She earns PHP 3,000 every month doing this business. She's engaged in this business for three years. 

Maria Belen requested a loan of PHP 6,000 from GDMPC to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. 

In 2011, Maria Belen became a member of GDMPC. In the future, she hopes to expand and improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa de 51 años de edad se dedica al negocio de confecciones en el municipio de Malambo, donde habita con su esposo y sus dos hijos en las edades de 21 y 24 años de edad. Ella tiene una experiencia de 30 años  en la tarea de confección, desde que su amiga le enseñó con mucha paciencia y ella dio sus primeros pasos en una máquina sencilla familiar haciendo las primeras prendas de vestir en el año 1982. En su taller realiza todas las operaciones de la confección desde el diseño, corte preparación ensamble y acabado de piezas, elaborando  productos en los cuales se ha especializado, como  ropa interior femenina y masculina, multiusos y camisas de dormir. Su principales clientes son vendedores mayoristas que distribuyen en la ciudad de Cartagena de Indias, y también vende al detal a los vecinos del sector. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará telas, hilos e insumos, para fabricar productos en tejido de punto, como pijamas y ropa interior para damas y caballeros. Su meta mas adelante es adquirir nuevas maquinarias para mejorar sus tiempos productivos y ser aun más efectiva, aumentar su producción y tener una nueva clientela que aumente sus ventas y muy seguramente lo conseguirá con su disciplina y capacidad de gestión.
texts.en:
Rosa is 51 years old, and has a garment making business in the town of Malambo where she lives with her husband and two children who are 21 and 24 years old.  Rosa has 30 years of experience in garment making after her friend taught her the trade with much patience.  In 1982, she made her first garments on a family-owned simple sewing machine.  

In her workshop, the entire garment-making process takes place- from the design, to the cutting, preparacion, assembly, and finished piece.  Rosa produces garments that she has come to specialize in such as undergarments for men and women and pijamas.  Her main customers are wholesalers who distribute within the city of Cartagena de Indias.  She also retails her clothing to her neighbors.  

Currently, Rosa is applying for her first loan from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to buy fabric, thread, and other supplies to make her clothing.  Her goal is to obtain new machinery to improve her production time, to be more effective, to increase her production, and to gain new customers that will increase her sales.  Surely she will achieve this with her discipline and business sense.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, and other supplies to make clothing such as pijamas and men and women's undergarments.

loans.name: Lica Del Carmen

texts.es: Lica de 39 años, vive con su cónyuge y sus 4  hijos en las edades de 1 a 19 años en el municipio de Soledad, donde desarrolla su actividad comercial con la que  genera ingresos que aporta al desarrollo de su hogar. Lica vende mercancía variada, como ropa, cosmético y perfumería en general. Este negocio lo inició cuando una amiga le ofreció productos, que esta vendiera mediante guías especializadas, fue así como Lica hizo su primer ejercicio comercial,  sin  aun ser afiliada de la organización en que su amiga estaba. A Lica le fue muy bien, porque paso a paso su negocio fue creciendo, así empezó a hacerle créditos a nuevos clientes y a explorar mercados que estos le referían. Hoy con sus ingresos provenientes de su negocio, apoya los gastos de su hogar, tiene una clientela exclusiva y otorga créditos a cortos plazos, ajustados a la posibilidad de pago de su clientela. Actualmente  está aplicando a su primer credikiva, aunque es el tercer crédito que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo; con los anteriores financiamientos ha logrado incrementar su capital de trabajo, ha aumentado su clientela y ha generado cada día más utilidades. Su primer credikiva le permitirá invertir en un mayor volumen al acostumbrado, en ropa, perfumes, cosméticos, para dar continuidad a su propuesta de crecimiento en que está comprometida, para unida a  su cónyuge,  lograr un  mayor bienestar para su familia.
texts.en:
Lica, 39, lives with her spouse and four children, ages 1 through 19, in the town of Soledad where she conducts the business activities with which she generates income to contribute to the growth of her household.  Lica sells a variety of merchandise such as clothing, cosmetics, and perfume.  She started this business when a friend offered her products she sold through specialized catalogues.  This was how Lica began her first business activity, without being affiliated with the organization her friend was in.

It went very well for Lica because little by little her business grew, so she began to give loans to new customers and to explore markets on their referrals.  Today, with the income from her business, she supports her household expenses, she has a select clientele, and she grants short-term loans adjusted to her customers' ability to pay.

Currently she is requesting her first Kiva loan, although this is her third loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  With the previous loans she has managed to increase her working capital, expand her clientele, and generate more profits all the time.

Her first Kiva loan will allow her to invest in a greater volume of clothing and cosmetics than she is accustomed to and give continuity to the growth to which she is committed, so that she and her spouse can achieve greater well-being for their family.

loans.use: to buy clothing, perfume, and cosmetics

loans.name: Ser

texts.en:
Ser, 31, lives a rural area located in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. He is married with three daughters who are still in school and dependent on him. The main source of his family’s income is from rice farming on one hectare of farmland and cassava planting on 2.5 hectares of farmland.  He and his wife have been in this business for almost ten years to earn a living. Together, they are able to earn about 40,000 KHR per day to support the family.

Ser has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for two cycles and had completely paid back the previous loans. The past loans have helped him relieve his family’s burden and improve their livelihood. Now he is applying a loan of 1,500,000 KHR to buy fertilizers and seeds for his farmland. He hopes this loan will enable him to earn more income from the crop yield and he can sell it for a good price so as make a living better and keep his children in school.

loans.use: buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Hamda

texts.en:
Hamda is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo.  This is a picture while he is cutting wood in his workshop.

Hamda is a 33-year-old young woman.  She is married and is mother to three sons and two daughters.  For the past four years, Hamda's husband has been operating a carpentry business, which has been a profitable project, but is not enough to cover their cost of living.

Hamda wants to help her husband in improving their family's income, so she is requesting a 1,500 USD loan from FATEN to help her husband cover the cost of purchasing new cutting machine and additional amounts of wood. This will improve his work quality and increase demand from the customers. This will increase the family's income and offer to Hamda and her family better living conditions.

loans.use: buy a cutting machine and wood

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 52 years old and married with 7 children. With 3 children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Anita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store.

Anita has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as sardines, sugar, milk, soft drinks, etc. 

In the future, Anita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Linorn's Group

texts.en: Linorn is 30 years old and is a single man.  He is a rural villager from the Kror Kor district of Pursat province. Linorn is a rice farmer on two hectares of farmland and supplements his income through pig raising for several years. The current business earns him about KHR 20,000 per day and he manages to save about KHR 10,000 each day after daily expenses. This is a second-cycle loan for Linorn with VisionFund, while the other member in this group is a first-cycle client.  Linorn is leading the group to apply for this loan with VisionFund.  As the leader, he is going to use his portion to buy fertilizer for his farmland and use a portion of it to buy more piglets for raising.  He hopes to earn more income so as to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: buy fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Nuriniso

texts.en:
Nuriniso is 53 years old and married. She sells women’s underwear to earn a living. She has been in the business for 7 years. Her husband is a pensioner. Nuriniso must work hard to provide her 3 children with all necessary things. Her elder son helps her with the business. She dreams of expanding her business and becoming prosperous in the future. 

Nuriniso needs a loan to of 2000 USD to buy new varieties of women’s underwear for widening her assortments. She is looking for your help.

loans.use: buy women's undergarments to resell

loans.name: John Ali

texts.en:
John  is a 30-year-old  businessman  who lives in Juba.  He is married and has 2 child between the ages of 3 and 6, 1 of them go to school.

John  runs a general store and has been in business for 5 years.  He has no  employee and no other source of income in addition to this business.  He heard about Finance Sudan through other clients.  He is taking a loan of 1500 SDG to purchase soap, flour and many other items to sell.  

In 5 years, John  would like to expand his  business and open other branches.  His major challenges include high transportation cost.  John  says he is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan  through Kiva.

loans.use: buy maize flour, rice, soap, etc. to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Noy's Group

texts.en:
Noy, 43, is a widowed mother with six children, some of whom are helping the family business while some are the paid workers and the remaining children are in school. She lives in a rural village in the Kror Kor district, Pursat province. 

Noy has struggled to raise her children through rice farming and to supplement her income by working as a paid worker.  She has been in the farming  business for almost twenty years. The main challenge for her business is low crop yield resulted from lacking of fertilizers. 

Noy has been with VisionFund for three cycles while her group member has been with VisionFund for four cycles. She has successfully paid back the past loans which have helped her relieve her family’s burden. Now she is leading her group to apply for a new loan. As the leader, Noy is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it to pay for labor costs. She hopes her crop yield will become more profitable and she can sell it for a good price so as to make her living better.

loans.use: buy fertilizer

loans.name: Ryan

texts.en:
Ryan is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 4 children. 

Ryan has pigpen where he raises and sells pigs. He has had this business for 6 years. He requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to animal feed for the pigs.

Ryan has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: buy pig feed

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan, se dedica a la venta de frutas por mayor y también viajes en un vehículo, vive acompañado por su esposa y una niña que aún depende de ellos, el negocio lo inicio por la necesidad de percibir dinero y llevar el sustento a su familia, las ventas de frutas son de acuerdo a la temporada.

Solicita un préstamo por qué quiere invertir en ampliación del local, haciéndolo más grande para poder tener más capacidad de almacenaje de frutas, él préstamo deberá mejorar la condición en el negocio cubriendo el gasto en lamina, madera, así también poder tener más capacidad para atender a su clientela.

Su aspiración es mejorar cada vez más, haciéndose un comerciante rentable, al mismo tiempo poder instalar un pequeño restaurante, esto le permitirá mejorar sus ganancias familiares.
texts.en:
Juan works selling fruit wholesale and also makes trips in a vehicle.  He lives with his wife and a daughter who is still dependent.  He started the business because he needed to earn money and support his family.  The fruit sales are in accordance with the season.

He is requesting a loan because he wants to invest in expanding his space, making it bigger to be able to have more room for fruit storage and for serving his customers.  The loan will improve the condition of the business, covering the expense of roofing and wood.

His goal is to improve more all the time, making himself a profitable merchant, and also to be able to set up a small restaurant.  This will allow him to improve his family earnings.

loans.use: to buy roofing material and wood

loans.name: Kiry's Group

texts.en:
Kiry is aged 36 and is a single man who lives in a rural area of the Preahnet Preah district of Banteay Meanchey province, Cambodia. He has been planting corn and supplementing his income by selling gruel in the village. He has been in this business for four years to make a living. Kiry is able to earn about KHR 20,000 per day and manages to save about KHR 10,000 each day after daily expenses. 

Kiry has been with VisionFund for two cycles while the other member is just a first cycle client with VisionFund. The past loans have helped him relieve his family’s burden. Now he is leading his group of two to apply a loan. As the leader, Kiry is going to use his portion to buy fertilizer. He hopes to earn more income from the current business so as to make a good living.

loans.use: to fertilizer

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Preahnet Preah district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy fish to resell

loans.name: Chanthoeurn's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district of Cambodia, Chanthoeurn is a 45-year-old married mother of four children, three daughters and one son, all of whom are dependent on her and still in school. She earns a living through rice farming on half hectare of farmland and supplements the family’s income by cassava growing on one hectare of farmland. She and her husband have been in this business for ten years. The current business earns them about 8,000 per day and they manage to save about 2,000 each day after daily expenses.
 
Chanthoeurn’s group consists of two members who live in the same village and she is a second-cycle client with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She successfully paid back the first loan, which has helped her to better support the family. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Chanthoeurn, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to pay for labor costs. She hopes to increase her income from the current business so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Foni Misalina

texts.en:
Foni is a 28-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has two children, and their ages are 3 and 7. All of them go to school.

Foni runs a general store, and she has been in this business for three years. She has no employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through some of their other clients. She is taking out a loan of 1,500 SDG to purchase soda, water, and many other items. She has no other source of income.

In five years, Foni would like to expand her business.

Her major challenges include high prices at the market.

Foni says she is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan.

loans.use: To buy more items like water, soda, juice, etc.

loans.name: Saltanat

texts.en: Saltanat is married and has 2 children who are 8 and 11 year old. She always wanted to provide them with a good education and since her husband’s income is not enough to provide the family with a good quality of life, Saltanat decided to start a new business sewing national women’s dresses in order to generate income with which she can contribute to her home’s finances. She had been busy with animal husbandry but it was bringing a small income which is why Saltanat wants to change her business. She took the course ‘To get ahead’ at a women's organization and got enough skills for the new business. She is asking for a loan of 5700 somoni to buy a new sewing machine to start her new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for starting a new business

loans.name: Rosa Mistica Group

texts.es:
El comité "Rosa Mística" esta integrado por 17 señoras, todas ellas emprendedoras y dedicadas al trabajo con el cual logran mantener a sus familias.
Fátima, un de las señoras que integra este comité, se dedica a la venta de sábanas y manteles, con esta actividad ella logra sacar adelante a su familia; su ideal es llegar a tener su negocio propio y estable.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de manteles y sábanas de diferentes tamaños, formas, colores con los que podrá satisfacer aún más los gustos de su clientela y generar mayores ingresos económicos.
texts.en: The "Rosa Mística" ("Mystic Rose") group consists of 17 women, all entrepreneurs who dedicate themselves to their work so they can provide for their families. Fátima, one of the members, makes a living selling sheets and tablecloths, and in this way she makes headway for her family. Her goal is to be able to have her own stable business. She is requesting the loan to purchase tablecloths and sheets of different sizes, styles and colors so she will be able to better satisfy he customers' tastes and generate more income.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of styles and sizes of tablecloths and sheets.

loans.name: Lim's Group

texts.en: Lim, aged 50, is living in a rural area of the Prey Chhor district, Kampong Cham province. She has three children and earns a living through rice farming, supplementing her family’s income by pigs raising while her husband works for others for a fee. She and her husband have been in this business for 25 years. From the current business, they are able to earn about 25,000KHR per day and to save about 7,000KHR each day after daily expenses. Low crop yield destroyed by insects is the main challenge for her business. This is the first loan for Lim’s group consisting of four members with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund.  All of them are seeking 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, Lim is going to use her portion to buy pig feeds for her pig raising business. She hopes her crop yield will become more profitable and increase her family’s income so as to earn a better living.

loans.use: To buy pig feeds for her pig raising business

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband Yousef appears in her Kiva profile photo pictured in his grocery store.
Yasmeen is a 26-year-old young woman, she is married with no children yet.

For the past three years, Yasmeen's husband has had a grocery store selling different types of groceries. It has been a profitable project and the only source of income for the family, but not enough to cover their costs.
Yasmeen is requesting a loan from FATEN to help her husband cover the costs of purchasing needed stock of basic groceries that customers often request such as dairy products, canned food, sugar and  rice. This will increase sales and increase the family's income, which will enable Yasmeen and her husband to live in better conditions.

About Shariah-compliant lending:
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself.
